loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de escuela de choferes,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de escuela de choferes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar autopartes para carros.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The borrower continues to operate her driving school business. She has several years in this business already, and it is going very well. 

Her dream is to expand the driving school business. She is requesting the loan to buy car parts for the cars. She is grateful for the loan granted, and promises to make her installment payments on time.

loans.use: To buy car parts.

loans.name: Sengkong

texts.en:
Sengkong, aged 50, is a humble man and a father of two. He lives with his wife and children in their own home in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To earn a living, he and his wife have a rice farm on one hectare of land. Despite their hardships, they aim to give their children a better life and the opportunities of education.

Sengkong would like to borrow $500 to drill a well in his yard, because he wants to ensure he has enough water for his family both in the rainy season and dry season. This way they will not face a water shortage and will not need to spend time collecting water from far away. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Sengkong will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to drill a well in his yard.

loans.name: Rino

texts.en:
Rino is a married man from San Miguel, Bohol. He has been engaged in a motorcycle transport business for several years now. Rino is also in rice farming. 

Rino is asking for a loan to buy gasoline and spare parts for his motorcycle such as wheels, nuts, bolts, etc.In the future, Rino hopes to succeed in his business. He also wants to expand his farm.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and spare parts for his motorcycle such as wheels, nuts, bolts, etc.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en: Ani is a housewife living with three people in the family home in Bandung. Bandung is a major city in West Java, located about a two-hour drive from Jakarta. Ani runs a small stall that sells mobile phone airtime credits, mobile phone accessories, and processing bill payment for her customers. She joined Ruma because she wanted to expand her business. She is glad that her business is assisted and supported by Ruma agents. For the last three months, she has had around $30-$31 per day sales in average just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. She hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends when more people tend to come to her stall. In the future, she is planning to seek more business opportunities and put aside the extra income for his son's education. In the photo, Ani is sitting in front of her small stall. Ani thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es:
Ella es tatiana, estudiante de enfermería en campo alto segundo semestre, en este momento esta pidiendo el favor que le colaboren para el descuento con kiva para poder seguir estudiando, ya que su sueldo no le alcanza para poder pagar una mensualidad tan costosa.
Le gustaría poder obtener el descuento con kiva porque le dan la oportunidad de seguir con los estudios y también, después de terminar de estudiar le gustaría hacer una especialización con sus estudios a qui en campo alto.
En el momento se encuentra viviendo con los dos hijos y el esposo, el cual el esposo de ella tuvo un accidente y no puede ver, y el no le puede colaborar en el momento, y tiene que trabajar para poderlos sacar adelante, ya que no cuenta con los recursos, y la familia esta lejos y ellos no tienen la capacidad económica de colaborar.
A ella le gustaría continuar con los estudios para poder obtener una carrera y poder si dios lo permite entrar a trabajar y que le paguen un poco mas del mínimo, y también para colaborar con los dos hijos para que continúen sus estudios y poder ayudar con lo que los hijos necesitan.
texts.en:
Tatiana is a nursing student in her second semester at CampoAlto.  At this time, she is requesting that you please contribute to her for the Kiva discount so that she may continue studying because her salary is not enough to cover such an expensive monthly payment.  

She would like to be able to get the discount with Kiva because it would provide her with the opportunity to continue with her studies.  In addition, after completing her studies, she would like to pursue a specialization here at CampoAlto .

At the moment, she is living with her husband and two children.  Her husband had an accident and is blind and cannot contribute right now, so she has to work in order to get ahead.  She doesn’t have any resources, and her family is far away and doesn’t have the financial ability to contribute.  

She would like to continue her studies, earn a degree and, God willing, go to work and be paid a little more than minimum wage.  She would also like to work with her two children so that they may continue their studies and be able to help them with what they need.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a semester.

loans.name: Nelys

texts.es:
Ella es nelis, ha escogido este técnico porque por medio de esto cree que puede sacar a su familia adelante, porque es una persona que no le ha tocado muy fácil, viene desde muy lejos buscando un futuro mejor, vive con su hermana, y a escogido a kiva porque es la manera mas fácil de poder seguir estudiando, porque se le hace muy dificil de pagar el valor mensual, porque es una chica que trabaja en un restaurante para poder pagar sus estudios y a demás de eso no cuenta con el apoyo de alguien y mucho menos económicamente, y aparte de eso es una chica huérfana de padre y madre y a pesar de todo esto sigue luchando para buscar un mejor futuro.
Quiere agradecer a kiva y a campo alto por la ayuda que le están ofreciendo porque realmente lo que ella gana no es mucho, pero le agradece a dios que le sirve para todo lo que necesita y sobre todo para poder pagar sus estudios, se siente muy agradecida por esta ayuda porque sabe que con esto va a tener un mejor futuro, no siendo mas,se despido y queda muy agradecida.
texts.en: Nelys has chosen this technical degree program because she believes that she can get her family ahead through this means.  Life hasn’t been easy for her, and she has come a long way seeking a better future.  She lives with her sister and has chosen Kiva because it is the easiest way to be able to continue studying. She works in a restaurant in order to be able to pay for her studies, but it is very difficult for her to meet the monthly payments.   In addition, she doesn’t have the support of anyone, much less financially.   Apart from this, she is an orphan, without a mother or father.  In spite of all this, however, she continues striving to find a better future.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a  semester.

loans.name: Santos Matilde

texts.es:
Santos, es viuda, tiene 51 años de edad, vive con una sobrina de 20 años de edad, la cual depende económicamente de ella en casa propia, tiene una tienda la cual administra desde hace ya 15 años, la apoya su sobrina, su horario de atención es de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m.
El préstamo  lo invertirá en la compra de jabón, detergentes, frijol, arroz, bebidas, golosinas, etc., lo que le ayudara a tener mejores y nuevos productos en su negocio, espera incrementar su clientela y tener mejores ganancias.
Sueña con tener un negocio más rentable y así poder cancelar sus deudas, para tener un mejor estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Santos is 51 years old and a widow. She lives in her own home, with her 20-year-old niece, who depends on her financially. She has a store which she has been running for 15 years now. Her niece helps her. The hours of the store are from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. 

She will use the loan to purchase soap, detergents, beans, rice, drinks, candy, etc., which will help her to have new and better products in her store. She hopes to increase her clientele and have better earnings. She dreams of having a more profitable business, so that she can pay off her debts and have a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy soap, detergents, beans, rice, drinks, candy, etc.

loans.name: Kevin Eliud

texts.es:
Kevin es un joven muy trabajador, con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de venta de verduras en uno de los mercados de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir delante.

Kevin está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mas verduras para su negocio como papa, zanahoria, cebolla al por mayor, entre otros y de esta  manera poder seguir luchando para pode hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Kevin is a hardworking young man. With great effort, he was able to start his business of selling vegetables at one of the markets in his city. His business enables him to earn the income he needs to move forward.

Kevin is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, he will be able to buy more vegetables for his business such as potatoes, carrots, onions, and other produce in bulk. This will allow him to continue on until he is able to fulfill his greatest wish of having a house of his own.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is married and has four children.  She is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol.  Zosima helps her husband in cultivating their farm. 

Zosima needs a loan. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor costs of the farm. With this, they will be able to improve the productivity of their farm, thus, augmenting their yield and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor costs of the farm

loans.name: Olympia

texts.en:
Olympia joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2013 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op.She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 
She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 12,000. This loan is intended to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store business.
Olympia dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income from her  business.

loans.use: To buy stock for her sari-sari store business

loans.name: Moch Saefulloh

texts.en:
Moch Saefulloh and his family live together in a family home in Garut, a rural area located about two hours from Bandung, the main city of West Java. He manages a small stall that sells household electrical equipment, mobile phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits, and processes bill payments for his customers. He joined Ruma because he wanted to improve his business. Moch Saefulloh thinks that by joining Ruma, he can expand his network with other business owners so he can gain more business knowledge. He hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva because he sees more opportunities to boost his transactions, especially on weekends. For the last three months, his average sales were about $6 - $8 per day, just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. 

Moch Saefulloh hopes he can improve his business by adding more items to sell and earn more income. In the photo, he is standing in his stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Agustian

texts.en:
Agustian is a single man who lives in Serang, a suburban area located about three hours from Jakarta, the capital city. He runs a small stall called a "warung" that sells snacks, drinks, groceries, and mobile phone airtime credits. He joined Ruma because he wanted to improve his business and try out the mobile phone airtime credits business.

Agustian hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva because he sees more opportunities to boost these transactions, especially on weekends. For the last three months, his average sales were about $37 - $38 per day just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. He also seeks other business opportunities for the future, such as processing bill payments for his customers. In the photo, Agustian is standing in front of his stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits transactions on weekends

loans.name: Raygie

texts.en:
Raygie is 20 years old, single and a resident of  Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He earns a living through selling bananas at the market.

He has been a member of PMPC for two years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, he is applying for a loan of PHP 10,000  to restock  bananas to sell. 

Raygie deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To restock  bananas to sell

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Eng is age 50 and married with four children. For more than 28 years, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava as the primary sources of the family’s income. They can earn about US$11 per day and manage to save about US$6 each day for future needs. 

Eng has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already, and she wisely and successfully used the first loan to make her living conditions better. She is now applying for a loan. Eng will use use this loan to pay her daughter’s tuition fees at the university, in the faculty of Accounting. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition fees at the university.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Masrina

texts.en:
Masrina is a housewife living with her husband and her son in Bandung, a city known as "The City of Flower", located about two hours from Jakarta. Her husband works as a laborer in a factory in Bandung. 

Masrina runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, groceries, and mobile phone airtime credits. She felt interested in joining Ruma because she wanted to improve her business. She is glad that her business is assisted and supported by Ruma agents.
 
As her business continues, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to process more business transactions on weekends. For the last three months, she has had around $16-$17 per day in sales just from selling mobile phone airtime credits, Masrina plans to seek more business opportunities and put aside the extra cash for her children's education. 

In the photo, Masrina is standing inside her stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Gabina

texts.es:
La socia Gabina se sigue dedicando al negocio de limpieza y tambien cocina,la socia ya tienes varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar una cocina para su casa.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member Gabina continues working at her cleaning business and she also cooks.  She has had this business for several years now, and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a grocery store.

She is seeking a loan in order to purchase a stove for her house, and she feels grateful for the loan that she has been given; she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase a stove for her house.

loans.name: Ana Elsa

texts.es: Ana de 53 años de edad es casada y habita junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 18 años, 14 años y 11 años de edad. Ana es muy trabajadora y creativa ya que hace variedad de actividades para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a su hogar. Ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, además, vende variedad de joyería de enchape y granos básicos. Desea invertir en su negocio de de joyería y granos básicos ya ha notado que se demanda mucho en su comunidad. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de joyería( anillos, pulseras, aretes, cadenas, etc.) y granos básicos(arroz, maíz y frijoles) para la venta y así mejorar sus ingresos y por consecuencia su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 53 years old, married and lives with her husband and their three children, ages 18, 14 and 11. Ana is very hard-working and creative, as she does a variety of activities in order to earn a living and support her household. 

She makes articles of clothing and also sells a variety of plated jewelry, as well as basic staples. She wishes to invest in her jewelry and basic staples businesses, as she has noted that there is considerable demand in her community. 

As indicated above, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of jewelry (rings, bracelets, earrings, chains, etc.), and basic staples (rice, corn and beans) to sell. This will allow her to improve her income, and consequently her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To buy jewelry (rings, bracelets, earrings, chains, etc.) And basic staples (rice, corn and beans).

loans.name: Sumbersari Permai Group

texts.en:
The Sumbersari Permai group is getting a loan for the seventh time. The number of members is 10 and the total loan amount is 15,000,000 IDR. Two members couldn’t attend the meeting because of several reasons. 

Having been successful with maintaining and fattening pigs, Kadek plans to use this  loan to purchase four types of local pigs. For pork roll, the pigs are maintained for two months. Any remainder of the loan will be used to fix the pigpen to make sure the pigs have a comfortable place. 

The price of pig feed is currently very expensive, but Kadek remains optimistic about her business going forward. With all the profit she gets, she plans to repair her home and also save for the working capital of the business. The group has one new member.

loans.use: to purchase four types of local pigs and fix the pigpen.

loans.name: Gliber Sabino

texts.es:
Gliber es un hombre muy trabajador, con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de venta de abarrotes, golosinas, y bebidas como gaseosas y cervezas; con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia.

Gliber está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le ha  brindado el podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como golosinas al por mayor y también poder comprar una vitrina para su negocio para poder exhibir sus productos de mejor manera a sus clientes, mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Tener un minimarket”.
texts.en:
Gliber is a very hardworking man. He managed to initiate his own business through a great deal of effort. He sells groceries, candies and beverages such as soda and beer. He uses the income from this business to get his family ahead.

Gliber is very grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to purchase merchandise for his business such as candies in bulk and a display case for the business, which he will use to improve the way he displays products to his customers. This will increase his income and help him continue working to realize his dream of "having a mini market".

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and a display case for his business.

loans.name: Maria Elida

texts.es:
María, se dedica a atender la tienda de donde obtiene los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos familiares, ella es madre soltera de una niña, dicho negocio ya tiene 7 años de poseerlo y no le representa ningún problema su administración.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar bebidas, golosinas, pan, pollo, embutidos, aderezos, entre otra clase de productos que sus clientes necesitan, en esta temporada de fin de año ella espera tener mejores ingresos con los que podrá cumplir con sus compromisos familiares.
Sueña con tener un negocio mucho más grande para contar con la satisfacción de sus clientes y de esa manera tener una economía más estable.
texts.en:
María runs the store where she earns the income necessary to cover her family expenses. She is a single mother of a young girl and has had her business for 7 years with no problems running it.

The loan is needed to buy drinks, candies, bread, chicken, meats, dressings and other products that her customers need. In this end of the year time she hopes to have higher incomes with which she will be able to cover her family commitments. 

She dreams of having a much bigger business to satisfy her customers and in this way have a more stable economic situation.

loans.use: to buy drinks, candies, bread, chicken, meats, dressings and other products.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 38 years old and lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 2 children.

Rosemarie sells clothes such as blouses, t-shirts, and shorts to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year. Each month she earns 3000 PHP doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 5000 to buy more blouses, t-shirts, and shorts to display and sell..

Rosemarie is a new member of PMPC. In the future Rosemarie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more blouses, t-shirts, and shorts to display and sell.

loans.name: Mekar Jadi Pondoan Group

texts.en:
This is the fourth loan for the Mekar Jadi Pondoan  group. After they make the payments, 3 of the members have decided to resign. They are focused on harvesting their crops in their own gardens. Other members decided continue the loan. They still need financial support until they are able to continue their businesses with their own capital. 

With every sale of pork, they are saving to use as venture capital. Ni Nyoman used her loan to purchase local piglets. She plans to sell piglets for pig barbeque. Pig for pig bolsters require easier care than superior pigs and faster sales. She hopes her new plan can be more successful.
Besides being a pig breeder, Ni Nyoman also works as a laborer who helps other farmers to maintain their land.

loans.use: To purchase local piglets for pig barbeque.

loans.name: Djafar

texts.en:
Djafar is 50 years old, married and has two children.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli region, and now lives in Baku region. One of his children is a 26-year-old university graduate. She is engaged and in the near future wants to get married. Another child is 23 years old and is studying at College. Djafar’s wife is a housewife. 

Djafar runs a business manufacturing stone facing for walls. Djafar learned this profession from his uncle and loves his job. Today he wants to buy apparatus that is necessary for his business. Therefore Djafar has applied for a loan of 2,300 AZN. He is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for their help. In the future Djafar wants to recruit an assistant.

loans.use: to buy apparatus required for his business

loans.name: Feleciana

texts.en:
Mrs. Feleciana is 61 years of age. Having three children, she is a kind and hardworking mother, and a good model for her children. She has a good husband who helps her in her business, and her husband is also a fisherman as their other source of income. 

Mrs. Feleciana is from Dipolog City. Her main business is an eatery, and to satisfy her daily needs, she has also another source of income: her boarding house and her space for rent. 

Mrs. Feleciana has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since 2012. Mrs Feleciana is good member and payer. She had a previous loan amounting to 35,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). She used her previous loan for adding to her capital and buying spices for her eatery business. 

Mrs. Feleciana wants to help her husband with his fishing business, so Mrs. Feleciana will avail a new loan amounting to 35,000 PHP to buy new fish net for her husband's fisheries. Having a new fish net helps them to have additional income to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for fish net for her husband's fishing business

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina is a 41-year-old lady from Kakamega count and married to Wycliffe, who is civil servant. They have three children, ages 15, 13 and seven years old respectively.

She operates a retail shop business, which she has done for the last three years, earning an income of KES 25,000 per month. She has now applied for KES 50,000 as her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she intends to use for expanding her business by buying goods in bulk, such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

The profits will be used to educate her children and provide other basic needs. She has a dream of expanding to be a whole seller in this sector.

loans.use: to purchase goods in bulk, such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc to resell.

loans.name: Tariq

texts.en:
Tariq is 22 years old. He is living in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his family consisting of 2 siblings and his retired parents.

Tariq is studying for a Bachelors Degree, majoring in Computer Information Systems. He is in his last year and is only one step from graduation. He is planning to find a job that suits his study field after graduation to start supporting his family financially as they are facing a financial crisis, which is making it difficult for them to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Jati Ayu Group

texts.en:
Ni Nengah and all members of Jati Ayu Group are very grateful because they were able to repay the third loan on time. Ni Nengah and all members are also grateful that MUK will continue to provide loans for them. In this period, the group members still numbered eight, but they received a higher loan amount to improve the effort. Now they are receiving 24,000,000 IDR and each of them receives 3,000,000 IDR. 

Ni Nengah has one daughter named Kezia, aged six years, now in elementary school grade 1. Her husband works as a farmer. In addition to raising pigs, Ni Nengah is also a teacher. The loan will be used to purchase three piglets and feed. Ni Nengah hopes the profit from raising pigs and fully be used to help cover everyday family needs.

loans.use: to buy three superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Ana Cleta

texts.en:
This is Ana Cleta, 44, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to their children. She, together with her children, manages their household, while operating a business. She is working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Ana Cleta maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct-selling brands. 

A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s costs are lower than those in the catalogue, and the difference represents the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. 

Ana Cleta's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Ana Cleta is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products, like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products needed in her business. 

Ana Cleta hopes to expand her business and dreams to have a better living. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products, like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fee and to buy a new computer.

loans.name: Munandar

texts.en:
Munandar and his family live in Tangerang, a city located about 30 minutes from South Jakarta. He has three children and his wife is a housewife. Tangerang is known as one of the satellite cities of Jakarta, where many factories of various industries are located. 

Munandar manages a mobile phone shop that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, mobile phone airtime credits, mobile phone service, and bill payment service. 

He joined Ruma because he was interested in Ruma's products. Since he joined Ruma a month ago, Munandar has made around $82 - $83 per day in sales, just from selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for his customers. As his business continues, he would like to take out a loan for working capital from Kiva in order to boost these transactions, especially on weekends when more people tend to come to his stall. He hopes that he will be able to improve his business and seek more business opportunities. In the photo, he is sitting in his stall. Munandar thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Eab's Group

texts.en:
Eab is aged 42 years old and married. She is a mother of seven children. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for 15 years and supplement their family’s income by raising pigs. She and her husband can earn about 52,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Eab’s group consists of three members who live in the same village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a third cycle client. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Eab, who is the leader, will user her portion to buy piglets and pig feed for nourishing them. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed for nourishing them

loans.name: Sreysang's Group

texts.en:
Sreysang is a 32-year-old mother of one dependent son who is too young for schooling. She is a borrower from Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. 

To support her family, she works in a local factory, and her husband works at  a construction site in addition to the rice farming business that they have had. However, the transportation fee back and forth to the workplace for her and her husband is quite challenging. 

Therefore, she decided to get a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) by joining a group of three borrowers. It is the second loan for Sreysang, and her original loan has been fully repaid with a positive impact of improving her lifestyle gradually. 

Now, she and her co-borrowers are applying for the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend a portion of her loan to buy a decent motorbike for commuting back and forth to the workplace. Moreover, she will also use some of the money in to renovate her house to a better condition. 

She hopes that she can reduce transportation costs as well as renovate her house to a better condition in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for commuting back and forth to the workplace.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa runs a retail store and offers specialty foods.Her husband operates their tricycle transporting passengers.

With her desire to make her dreams come true, Nimfa manages her business well. She aims to have comfortable living conditions and earn greater income.

For this reason, she is borrowing PHP 30,000 to buy more soft drinks, grocery items, raw meat and ingredients used in cooking foods. She hopes to encourage more customers to buy the grocery items and delicacies she offers so as to be able to earn better income. She aims to provide good customer service always.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, grocery items, raw meat and ingredients used in cooking foods

loans.name: Chhuonly

texts.en:
Chhuonly is a 39-year-old married woman with four children of various ages. She lives with her husband and children in a rural area of the Prey Chhor District in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. Chhuonly is a farmer and grows rice crops on a few pieces of land to earn a living. With support from her husband and children, Chhuonly is able to earn well for the family. 

Having been a farmer for over 20 years, she has gained enough experience to improve her farming practice so far. She aims to improve her production during each harvest, but she doesn't have the capital needed to make that possible. For this reason, she would like a loan to rent a piece of land for growing cassava crop. Chhuonly has never been with other local state banks before, and it’s her first loan with HKL, a reliable institution. In the future, she hopes to immediately support her family members.

loans.use: to rent a piece of land for growing cassava crop.

loans.name: Rolito

texts.en: Rolito is a 32-year-old father of an eight-year-old child. He and his family live in Talibon, Bohol. For five years now, he has had a fishing and fish-vending business to provide for his family. He is asking for a loan of 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fishing net and paint. These materials will help him improve his catch and thus better provide for his family. In the future, Rolito would like to improve his fishing business to support his family, send his child to school, and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and paint

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a 35-year-old single man from the town of Loon, Bohol. He is a fisherman. He catches and sells fish for a living. His fishing business started quite a few years ago. Aside from fishing, He also raises and sells hogs. He is asking for a loan to buy piglet and more fish to sell. This will help Bernard augment his income to meet his daily needs.

In the future, Bernard hopes to expand his business to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy piglet and more fish to sell

loans.name: Thơ

texts.en:
Mrs. Thơ is 54 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives in Thieu Hoa district a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.She is requesting a loan to purchase materials such as sand, cement, brick and equipment for toilet to build a new toilet. Thơ and her family dont have latrines now they are using neighbor latrine .

In 2007, Thơ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thơ has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Thơ has a manufacturing business making iron furniture. Thơ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. 
Thơ has one dependent.One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Thơ hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as sand, cement, brick and equipment for toilet to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a 54-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She engages in farming. She toils the land and grows rice. Aside from rice farming, she makes native hats out of buri (palm) to augment her income. She has been growing rice for 10 years. To improve her harvest, she requested a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer and pay a laborer's wage. 

In the future, Avelina would like to expand her farming business to improve her family's living status.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fertilizer and pay a laborer's wage

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a fish vendor in Sindangan, Zamboanaga del Sur. She earns a monthly income of Php 5,000 per month. She is 63 years old, and has four children. 

She signed up for her membership with PMPC in 2007, and has taken several loans already. All her obligations were paid in a timely manner. 

She has applied a loan of Ph 10,000 to buy "banyeras" (a big basin) of fish to sell. 

She hopes to save more for her retirement, and to have savings in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy "banyeras" (a big basin) of fish to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia, 62, is married with four children. She lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, in the Philippines.

A farmer, Virginia grows rice and fruit crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

Virginia has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for seven years. She has requested a loan to buy 20 sacks of fertilizers,5 bottles of pesticides and for labor expenses .

In the future, she hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of fertilizers,5 bottles of pesticides and for labor expenses

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is a 60-year-old married woman and the mother of two grown-up children.  She is from Sikatuna, Bohol and is engaged in food vending and selling of beauty care products and cosmetics. She sells bibingka (rice cakes) and also clothes, and cosmetics from Avon and Natasha brands.  

Claudia is asking for a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy clothes, perfume, cologne, and body talc which she will be able to sell to increase sales and profit. 

In the future, Claudia hopes to sell a greater variety of products from different brands to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfume, cologne and body talc

loans.name: Areej

texts.en: Areej is a 21-year-old lady who lives in a sector in Jordan called Salt with her parents and 3 brothers. One of her brothers is in the military. She is working at a restaurant and at the same time studying for her Bachelor's degree, majoring in Computer Science. She is in her 3rd year. Areej is planning to work in her study field after graduation in order to help her family financially as they are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en: Amneh was born in 1972. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla with her husband and 2 sons. Amneh has been trying her best to support her husband in improving their living conditions and covering their sons’ needs by running her business of selling blankets at her house for 2 years. She needs to expand the business now by buying a larger quantity of blankets and adding variety to them in order to attract more customers and to raise her profit. But, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more blankets to sell.

loans.name: Jafar

texts.en: Jaafar is 23 years old. He is living in a sector in Jordan called Baqaa with his family, which consists of 10 siblings and his parents. He is studying for a  Bachelor's degree, majoring in Accounting. He is in his 2nd year and is planning to find a job that suits his study field after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially as they are facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Nhem's Group

texts.en:
Nhem, a rural villager from Battambang province's Moung Russey district where rice farming is the common way to make a living in the neighborhood, is 39 years old. Nhem is a rice farmer. To supplement the family’s income, she has been work as a paid worker. She can earn about 35,000KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 
This is Nhem sixth loans with VisionFund. She has successfully used the past loans to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Nhem is going to use her portion to pay for labor fee in harvesting rice. She hopes to make more crops so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to pay for labor fee in harvesting rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Rehaf

texts.en: Rehaf was born in 1984. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla with her husband, who is in the military, and 5 sons and daughters. Rehaf has been trying her best to support her husband in improving their living conditions and covering their children's needs by running her business of selling blankets at her house for 1 year. She needs to expand her business now by buying a larger quantity of blankets and adding variety to them in order to attract more customers and to raise her profit. But, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more blankets to sell.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es: Toribia de 55 años es casada con 04 hijos independientes, ella pertenece al grupo “Los Girasoles” conformada por 08 socios empeñosos y responsables. Toribia se dedica a la venta de menudencias de pollo y lo realiza en un mercado de su localidad. Con su perseverancia y dedicación a podido apoyar a sus hijos en su educación y mejorar su vivienda. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de menudencias de pollo. El deseo de Toribia es de tener su propio puesto ya que por el momento solo lo alquila. El grupo “Los Girasoles” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Toribia es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste chompa negra.
texts.en:
Toribia, 55 years old, is married with four adult children. She belongs to Los Girasoles Communal Bank, which is composed of eight diligent and responsible members. She makes a living selling chicken giblets at a market in the area.  With her perseverance and dedication she has been able to support her children’s education and improve her house.  Her recent loan will be used to purchase chicken giblets. Toribia’s wish is to have her own stall because at the moment she rents one.

The members of Los Girasoles group are grateful to the people who made this loan possible and are committed to continuing to work hard.

Toriba is the second on the left wearing a black top.

loans.use: to purchase chicken giblets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the school fee for her daughter.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Because Maha is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Maha is a 30-year-old lady living in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour with her 5 children and her retired husband. She has been trying her best to support her husband in improving their living conditions and covering their children's needs by running her business of selling electrical machines at her own store for 2 months. She needs to expand the business now by buying a larger quantity of electrical machines and adding variety to them in order to attract more customers and to raise her profit. But, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more electrical machines.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is a 28 years old gentleman.  He is married to Ann and the father of one child. He buys and sells bags in the town of Narok and has been in business for the last ten years.  This trade earns Cyrus a monthly income of about 35,000 KES.

He has been advanced a third loan of 120,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya, which will enable him purchase and transport a bale of second hand bags.  The anticipated profit will be used to help the young family meet its basic needs.  

Cyrus dreams to both improve his family's living standards and to own his residential plot.

loans.use: to purchase bags for resale.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey, aged 48, lives in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district. She has three children, all of whom are dependents. She and her husband are rice farmers and they also raise pigs to make a living. She has been in this business for several years. The current business earns her about US $18 per day.

This is the first loan for Srey with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to buy a plot of farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow more crops so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Janet Nyamalo

texts.en:
Janet's farming business has been doing fine and she has successfully paid off her previous loan of KES 60,000. She has managed to add to her number of animals. 

Janet has been advanced a sixth loan of KES 85,000 by Visionfund which will facilitate her leasing a bigger piece of land for farming. 

The proceeds will be used to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to attain financial stability and see her children go on to higher levels of learning

loans.use: to lease a piece of land for farming.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila was born in 1966.  She is divorced and does not have any children.  Ludmila lives with her mother who is a pensioner.  Ludmila works in a state organization and has been employed for more than 13 years.  She is a good employee.  Ludmila is the breadwinner and main provider for her family. 

She wants to repair her house but she has no money.  Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 800 TJS to buy building materials such as cement and wood to repair her house.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement and wood.

loans.name: Abdulsamad

texts.en: Abdulsamad was born in 1973. He is married and a father of 4. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour. Abdulsamad has been working in construction for 12 years. He started his business with a small amount of wood and bricks and started expanding it gradually. Now, he needs to buy an iron cutter to be able to do his work professionally and to raise his productivity and profit. But, he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy iron cutters for his business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad was born in 1994. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour with his 2 siblings and his parents. For 6 years, he has been trying his best to support his family by running his business of selling home products and accessories. He also sews clothes. Now, he wants to expand his business by expanding the quantity of his products and buying a new sewing machine to raise his productivity and income. But, he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories and perfumes and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.en: Emilienne's last loan is fully repaid and she needs to increase her business. She is going to buy ready made clothes. Her business was affected positively by the last loan. Her profit increased by more than seven percent. Her family circumstances improved significantly. They now have three square meals daily.

loans.use: to buy ready made dresses for her business.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto es un señor de 32 años de edad, casado,  tiene 6 hijos: tres  hombres y tres mujeres, el y su familia viven en el Caserío Chuacruz, Sololá
El es comerciante, se dedica a la compraventa de verduras (cebolla y papa); la   comercialización la realiza en el mercado de su comunidad; a  través de  esta actividad obtiene ingresos aceptables que le ayudan al sostenimiento de su familia. Lleva más de 11 años realizando esta labor.
El está  solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para la compra de  2 cuerdas de cebolla (0.1445 hectáreas) 
El sueño más importante de Humberto es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y asi brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Humberto is a 32-year-old man who is married and has 6 children: three boys and three girls.  He and his family live in Caserío Chuacruz, Sololá.  He is a merchant who makes a living buying and selling vegetables (onions and potatoes).  He carries out his sales in the market in his community.  Through this activity he obtains suitable income that helps him to sustain his family.  He has been doing this work for more than 11 years.  He is requesting a loan of Q 4,000.00 (GTQ) for the purchase of onions from two plots of land (0.1445 hectares).

Humberto’s most important dream is to improve his living conditions and in this way provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase onions from two plots of land (0.1445 hectares).

loans.name: Brenda Isabel

texts.es: Brenda de 22 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de 3 años de edad. Brenda trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace un año y de esta forma se gana la vida y colabora con la economía del hogar. Desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de una puerta de uno de los cuartos de su vivienda y para cambiar las láminas del corredor las cuales se encuentran deterioradas, por lo que comprará lamina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en: Brenda, 22, lives in her own home with her partner and their small daughter, 3 years old. Brenda has been working as a domestic employee for one year and it allows her to earn a living and help with the household expenses. She wants to improve her living conditions, which is why she asks FUSAI for money to buy a door for one of the rooms in her home, and to change the tin sheeting in the hallway which has deteriorated. She will buy galvanized tin sheeting, wood and nails.

loans.use: to buy a door, galvanized tin sheeting, wood and nails.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa mayor de edad madre soltera con una hija mayor de edad, originaria del municipio de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora con muchos deseos de superación personal, Teresa es una microempresaria que se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como:ropa de niños, cosméticos, zapatos, pantalones, prendas de oro, plata y bronce, perfumenes, cremas, ropa interior productos plásticos entre otros, sus compras las realiza en otro país, los cuales después los distribuye en centros de trabajos y comerciante de chinandega, los cuales tiene clientes fijos y eventuales da crédito y al contado los cuales recupera semanal y quincenal, negocio el cual lo desempeña de forma ambulante inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano para recorrer todos los lugares de chinandega para entregar sus productos, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de mercadería como:variedades estilos de ropa para niños y adultos, cosméticos, productos plásticos entre otros, y de esa manera obtener mejores ingresos para su hogar, Teresa agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les brindan a personas de bajos recursos económicos a países pobres como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Teresa is a single mother of a grown daughter. She is from the town of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. She is known for being hardworking and dedicated, with a lot of desire for personal improvement. She is a small businesswoman, selling merchandise door-to-door like children's clothing, cosmetics, shoes, pants, gold, silver and bronze goods, perfumes, creams, underwear, and plastic products, among other things. She makes her purchases in another country and distributes them in business centers and merchants in Chinandega, where she has fixed and occasional clientele. She sells in cash or on credit, which she collects weekly or bimonthly. She starts her day very early to run all over Chinandega delivering her products.

The goal of this loan is to invest in business capital and stock her store by purchasing merchandise such as: various styles of clothing for children and adults, cosmetics, plastic goods and other things. This way she can make more money for her home. Teresa is very grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders give to people of scarce economic resources in poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as various styles of clothing, shoes, cosmetics, plastic products and other things.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar was born in 1974.  She is a married woman living in a sector of Jordan called Zarqa with her three children and her retired husband.  Samar is trying her best to support her husband in meeting her children’s needs and providing them with the best education.  

For the past three years, she has been running her project of sewing clothes at home.  At this time, she needs to expand her project by buying more thread and sewing tools in order to be more productive.  But, she does not have enough money to do so.  It is for this reason that she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more thread and sewing tools for her sewing business.

loans.name: Benda

texts.en:
Benda is a merchant from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various goods and items to the people in her community. This is the source of her income.

Benda is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like eggs, dried fish, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, canned goods and detergents. With this, she will be able to improve her stocks thus attracting more buyers to her store. Benda hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like eggs, dried fish, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, canned goods and detergents.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for an efficient and clean energy in order to save on cost and dust from charcoal

loans.name: Juan Alexander

texts.es: Juan Alexander, mayor de edad soltero, originario del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona donde predomina el comercio, turismo, sus playas, es un microempresario que se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: ropa, zapatos, perfumenes, cosméticos, telas, adornos, chinerias, productos plásticos entre otros mas, sus compras las realiza en otros municipios del país al por mayor, los cuales son al contado, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales los cuales desde muy temprano comienza sus jornadas de trabajo de forma ambulante en diferentes barrios y municipios de chinandega, el financiamiento de este nuevo crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo incrementando su inventario y así aprovechar las ventas en este mes que son mayores por aproximarse las fiestas navideñas, los cuales ya tiene varios pedidos de sus clientes. Juan agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les brindan a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Juan Alexander is single and lives in Chinandega in the western part of the country, an area known for commerce, tourism, and its beaches. He is a small business owner who sells general merchandise like clothing, shoes, perfumes, cosmetics, fabrics, decorations, knick knacks, plastic goods and other things. He makes his purchases in bulk in other towns, in cash. He sells for cash or credit to fixed and occasional customers. He starts his work day very early, walking around various neighborhoods and towns in Chinandega.

This new loan will be used to increase his inventory and take advantage of the sales this month, which are higher because the Christmas season is coming. He already has several orders from his customers. Juan is very grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders give to people of low economic resources.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like shoes, cosmetics, clothing, fabric, decorations, plastic products and other things.

loans.name: Los Girasoles De Compone Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS GIRASOLES DE COMPONE”; Este banco se ubica en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Norma; ella es conviviente, tiene 24 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y alimentos para su negocio.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de ganados, venta de leche, crianza de animales menores, ganadería, venta de productos lácteos, agricultura, obrero maestro constructor.
 Las personas que salen con la cara tapada no pertenecen al banco comunal.
 La foto fue tomada en dos grupos y algunos de forma individual por motivos de trabajo y salud esperemos que para el siguiente desembolso se tome en un solo grupo.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the communal bank Los Girasoles de Compone (The Sunflowers of Compone). This group is located in the Anta district, in the Anta province, department of Cusco. 

Norma is common law married. She’s 24 years old and has a son. She alternates her daily activities with raising small animals like guinea pigs and chickens. She’s been in this business for some time, and it’s going well thanks to the work she puts in every day. She raises these animals for later resale to clients who order them. She’d like to be able to continue this work to support her family. 

She’s asking for a loan to buy guinea pigs and feed for her business. 

The other members work selling cattle, selling milk, raising small animals, raising livestock, selling dairy products, farming and doing construction work. The people in the photo who have their faces covered aren’t in the communal bank. The photo was taken of the bank split into two groups along with some other individuals. Hopefully the next photo will be taken of one group. 

Norma thanks all those who share in her dream through this means and commits to make her installment payments according to the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and feed for her business.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Rubina is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has six children. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various goods including beverages, noodles, biscuits, sugar, canned goods, shampoo and detergents. Rubina needs a additional capital to expand her store. Because of this, she requested a loan to buy more supplies like beverages, noodles, canned goods, toiletries and dry goods. Through this loan, Rubina will be able to improve the variety of her stocks, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more supplies like beverages, noodles, canned goods, toiletries and dry goods.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is a married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has three grown children. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. This is the source of her income.

Candelaria is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soap and detergents. With this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store. 

In the future, Candelaria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods like biscuits, toiletries and beverages to attract more customers.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan tiene 28 años, está casado y tiene tres hijos, su actividad principal es el transporte de carga, viaja al trópico de Cochabamba y a todo el país, cuenta con una experiencia de 8 años, pero como los ingresos que obtiene no le alcanzan para cubrir todos sus gastos, los fines de semana fabrica lavanderías de cemento, mientras que su esposa se dedica a la ganadería. Desde muy joven tuvo que dedicarse a trabajar para salir  adelante y se compro un lote para contruir su casa. Con el objetivo de otorgar mayores beneficios a su familia, solicita un crédito para terminar la construcción del segundo piso de su vivienda, ya que la obra no se termino por que no tenia dinero suficiente, de esta forma lograra proporcionarle a su familia mayor comodidad y bienestar.
texts.en: Juan is 28 years old. He is married and has three children. His main economic activity is cargo transport. He travels to the tropical area of Cochabamba and the whole country. He has 8 years of experience, but since the income he earns isn’t enough to cover his expenses, he makes cement wash basins on the weekends. His wife takes care of their cattle. Since the time he was very young, he has had to work to get ahead and buy a lot for his house, with the goal of continuing to get ahead and to provide better benefits for his family. He is requesting a loan to finish the construction of his house, which he could not finish because he did not have the necessary funds. This is how he will provide improved comfort and well-being for his family.

loans.use: to buy a land title and finish construction on his home

loans.name: Yom's Group

texts.en:
Yom is 45 years old.  She lives with her husband and six children in a village in Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district in Cambodia.  To earn a living, she and her husband have been growing cassava and farming rice for almost 22 years.  In addition, they supplement the family’s income by working as workers for hire. The current business earns them 24,000 KHR per day. 

Yom has been with VisionFund for two cycles and has completely repaid the previous loan.  She is now leading her group to request a loan.  As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava.  She hopes to earn more income from her paddy so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en:
Alaa’ is 23, and he lives with his family in Gaza. He has a store for selling school products, where he earns a monthly income of $750. He needs this youth loan to buy a printer, new school products, and shelves. This will increase his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family. 

Alaa’ is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a printer, new school products, and shelves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Para elaboración del escobas y artículos de limpieza como cepillos, trapeadores etc

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.es:
Hermenegilda de 61 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, por no tener los suficientes recursos económicos, es madre soltera. Vive junto a sus 2 hijos (mayores de edad) quienes le ayudan en atender la tienda que administra.

Las actividades productivas de Hermenegilda es una tienda y la compra y venta de ganado; negocios a los que se ha dedicado desde hace 30 años. Ella viaja 30 kilómetros a la ciudad a comprar los artículos que vende en su tienda.

El préstamo será invertido como capital de trabajo, para la tienda y con ello poder comprar mercadería y tener mayor diversidad de productos para vender. La visión que tiene, es que su tienda sea sostenible en el tiempo.

Los sueños de la cliente son tener una fuente de ingresos, que permita poder contar con lo necesario y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia. Desea mantener una tienda siempre bien abastecida.
texts.en:
Hermenegilda is a 61 year old woman who never had the opportunity to go to school because she didn't have sufficient economic resources. She is a single mother. She lives with her two adult children who help her take care of the store she runs.

Hermenegilda's work includes her store and buying and selling livestock; businesses she has dedicated herself to for 30 years. She travels 30 km to the city to buy items she sells in her store.

Hermenegilda will invest the loan as working capital in the store. With the loan, she will be able to buy merchandise and have a greater variety of products to sell. Her vision is for her store to be sustainable over time.

Hermenegilda's dream is to have a source of income that allows her to have everything she needs and cover her family's basic needs. She hopes to always keep her store well stocked.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: Tomasa de 68 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijas mayores de edad y su pequeña nieta de 9 años de edad. Tomasa trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace mucho tiempo. Dicho oficio le ha permitido ganarse el sustento diario y mantener la economía del hogar dado que su esposo falleció y ella se quedó a cargo del hogar. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción del corredor de la vivienda por lo que necesita comprar: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines par comenzar a construir e corredor lo antes posible.
texts.en: Tomasa is 68 years old. She lives in her own home along with her two grown daughters and her young 9 year old granddaughter. Tomasa has worked as a maid for several years. This job has allowed her to earn enough for daily costs and to meet household expenses since her husband died and she was left in charge of the house. She’s asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a hallway in her house. She needs to buy galvanized metal sheeting, support beams, and pins to be able to begin building the hallway as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, support beams, and pins to build a hallway in her home.

loans.name: Angie Paola

texts.es:
Ella es angie paola, y el sueño de ella es estudiar medicina forense por lo cual inicio estudiando auxiliar de enfermería en campo alto, piensa que es un escalón fuerte para ir haciendo realidad el sueño, lastimosamente no tiene la plata suficiente para costearse toda la carrera, pues los padres solo ganan el salario mínimo y tienen que pagar arriendo, servicios y demás. Posterior a eso, tiene una hermana pequeña entonces los ingresos no alcanzan, por eso necesita la ayuda, para poder hacer el sueño de ella realidad, la ventaja es que a pesar de la edad tiene gran conocimiento sobre la medicina y le encanta, es algo por lo que lucha y quiere hacerlo realidad, es buena estudiante, cumple lo que promete, es muy cumplida y juiciosa.
Agradece enormemente el apoyo y colaboración ya que con este aporte de que el sueño se hace realidad sale adelante profesionalmente y laboral mente.
texts.en: This is Angie Paola. Her dream is to study forensic medicine, and so she’s begun by studying nursing at CampoAlto. She believes this is a good step towards fulfilling her dream. Unfortunately she doesn’t have the money she needs to pay for the entire degree since her parents earn only a minimum wage and they have rent, utilities, and other bills. She also has a little sister so their income isn’t enough. So, she needs help to realize her dream. The upside is that, despite her age, she knows a lot about medicine and loves it. This is what she’s working towards and wants to make a reality. She’s a good student, she does what she says, she’s very nice and smart. She’s extremely thankful since, with this help, she can make her dream a reality and move forward in her profession.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: Jose Ángel mayor de edad casado con dos hijos uno aun bajo su responsabilidad, originario de uno de los municipios de chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable, con muchos deseos de superación personal, Jose es un microempresario el cual posee varios negocios como:venta de lotería rifero en uno de los mercados de esa localidad, también se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general por encargos como: ropa, productos plásticos, cosméticos, bordados, tejidos entre otros, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados de mayoreos y sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales los cuales recupera semanal y quincenalmente lo invertido, negocio el cual lo inicia con capital propio buscando un medio digno de sobrevivir y el de sacar adelante a sus hijos, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo como: cosméticos, ropa, entre otros y lograr cubrir con pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Jose Ángel is married and has two dependent children. He is from one of the towns near Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. He is known for being hardworking, responsible and with a great desire for personal improvement. Jose is a small businessman, with several businesses like selling lottery tickets in one of the markets, and selling general merchandise by order such as clothing, plastic goods, cosmetics, embroidery, knit goods and other things. He makes his purchases in the wholesale markets and he sells for cash or credit to both fixed and occasional clientele. He collects payments weekly or bimonthly. He started his business with his own capital, looking for an honest way to survive and take care of his children.

The goal of this loan is to invest in business capital like cosmetics, clothing and other things to cover the orders that he has.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like clothing, plastic goods, cosmetics and other things.

loans.name: Juan Camilo

texts.es: El es juan camilo, estudia cocina, esta en primer semestre, gracias a muchos esfuerzos y responsabilidades lo culmino y paso a segundo semestre, por lo tanto pide la colaboración de kiva para seguir adelante  con la carrera y poderla culminar completamente hasta el final, ya que se encuentra trabajando informalmente, pero en el cual gana lo necesario para los gastos, y el cual le deja parte para el estudio, pero como no le alcanza completo por eso pide la colaboración y pronta respuesta para poder inscribirse al segundo semestre y seguir aprendiendo y avanzando cada clase para ser el mejor y mejorar la calidad de vida, tener un campo de alto estudio y rendimiento en la carrera para superar obstáculos y cada día escalar lo mas alto para ganar las metas y logros.
texts.en: This is Juan Camilo.  He is a first semester student studying cooking.  Thanks to a lot of work and responsibility he finished and passed on to second semester, which is why he requests help from Kiva to keep advancing in the program and be able to finish it completely.  At this time he is working informally, earning enough to cover his expenses and part of the cost of his education.  However, since he doesn't make enough to pay the whole cost he requests help and a prompt response so he can enroll in the second semester and continue learning and advancing in each class.  He wants to be the best and improve his quality of life, have a degree, and see results for his career so he can overcome obstacles, and do his best every day so he can reach his goals and succeed.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice and sugar for her business.

loans.name: José Gerardo

texts.es:
José de 26 años de edad, solo estudio hasta sexto grado de educación básica, vive desde hace cuatro años en la comunidad junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo, quien por su corta edad aun no va a la escuela. Él al igual que su esposa se dedican al comercio informal de refrescos naturales y también comercializan con mariscos, por temporadas también venden en una pequeña ramada a orilla de la carretera donde viven.  Actualmente viven en la casa de sus suegros.
	
Ellos se dedican al comercio informal desde hace 3 años, tomaron la iniciativa de modificar una bicicleta y adaptarle una hielera en la parte de atrás para transportar mariscos en la temporada y también comercializar con refrescos en la zonas aledañas, viaja todos los días una distancia de 5 kilómetros ofreciendo sus deliciosos refrescos y es un negocio que le ha generado buenos dividendos debido a que vive en una zona costera y las condiciones del clima son de bastante calor por lo que sus refrescos se vende en tiempo record. Su jornada de trabajo es en horas de la mañana y parte de la tarde, al finalizar el día se dedica a compartir tiempo con su familia y asistir a la iglesia.

El destino del crédito es la construcción de una habitación,  en donde vivirá junto a su esposa y se pequeño hijo, lo que él desea es tener mayor privacidad y comodidad ya que actualmente viven en una habitación bastante reducida que reúne las condiciones mínimas de salubridad y seguridad. Sus suegros han tomado a bien cederle una porción de terreno para que puede levantar una construcción y con ayuda de Credicampo espera lograr su objetivo.

Como muchos clientes el sueño o la mayor aspiración del señor, es tener una bonita casa, sin lujos, que la haya construido con sus propias manos y poder contar con todo lo necesario para poder vivir en ella, ver como su hijo cada vez se hace más grande y que les permita a su familia estar protegidos contra las inclemencias climatológicas. Sobre su negocio también se proyecta obtener otro crédito y poder construir un pequeño cafetin de láminas donde poder vender sus productos y ya no mojarse en época de invierno en vista  que con la que actualmente cuenta esta construida con palmeras y madera de mala calidad y se filtra el agua llovida. Él espera seguir contando con el financiamiento de Credicampo y se esforzará en pagar sin atraso para lograr dicho apoyo.
texts.en:
José is 26 years old. He completed his education through primary school, sixth grade. For the past four years he has lived in the community with his wife and their small son, who is still too young to start going to school. 

José and his wife sell natural beverages and seafood. They have been in business for three years. Depending on the season they sell either from a small shelter on the side of the highway near their home; or from a bicycle, to which they attached an adapted cooler in which they transport seafood and beverages in their neighborhood. A typical day includes traveling 5 km to offer delicious refreshments. This business has generated good revenue for them because they live in a coastal zone where the climate is very hot and cool drinks sell in record time.

José typically works in the morning and part of the afternoon, and spends the last part of the day with his family and helping his church.

They currently live with his in-laws, and this loan will be used to construct an additional room in which José and his wife and son will live. They want to have more privacy than they currently have, in a very small room which doesn't offer good living conditions or security. His in-laws have been good enough to give hem a piece of land on which they can build, and with the help of CrediCampo, José hopes to fulfill this goal.

Like many CrediCampo clients, his greatest dream or aspiration is to have a nice home, without frills, built by his own hands, which he can count on to protect his family against the elements and in which he can watch his son grow bigger every day.

José also hopes to obtain a separate loan for his business, which he will use to build a small aluminum stall from which to sell his products. That way he will not get wet in the winter as he does now because their roadside stall, built out of low-quality wood and palm fronds, allows water to leak through.

He hopes to continue being able to count on financing from CrediCampo and will work hard to earn that support by making payments without falling behind.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita vive en la población de Entre Ríos, junto a su hijo, es viuda y tomo la desicion de cambiar de lugar de residencia yendose al trópico para conseguir trabajo y salir adelantesola saco adelante a su familia, . Se dedica al comercio de venta de abarrotes en una tienda de barrio, es muy dedicada a su actividad y tiene una tienda en la que vive y ahí también realiza sus ventas, su negocio es familiar por ello recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, pero también contrata una persona eventual para que le colabore con las ventas de refrescos, como quiere seguir mejorando, solicita un crédito para ampliacion de vivienda de forma que pueda acomodar mejor la tienda y logre ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Señora Margarita lives in the town of Entre Ríos, along with her son. She is a widow, and she made the decision to change her place of residence, moving to the tropical zone in order to find work and move forward. She has raised her family on her own.

She sells groceries in a neighborhood store and she is very dedicated to her occupation, having a shop in which she lives and also makes her sales.  Hers is a family business, so she has the help of her sons, but she also employs a person part-time to help her with selling soft drinks. 

Because she wants to continue improving, she is seeking a loan in order to enlarge her home so that she can accommodate the store better, and be able to offer better service.

loans.use: to enlarge her home.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is a married woman and a mother of six children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for several years now. She also operates a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place.

Saturnina is asking for a loan to buy animal feed for the pigs, and additional stock, such as canned goods, candies, noodles and detergents, for her store. Through this, she will be able to grow and raise healthy pigs and improve her stock in her store as well. 

In the future, Saturnina hopes to make her business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs, and additional stock, such as canned goods, candies, noodles and detergents, for her store.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.es:
Jimmy tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus clientes hasta los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Vega Jimmy, 36, lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotún. The people in his community work in agriculture, business and livestock.  The district is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the northern coast of Peru.

He offers public transportation on his own motorcycle taxi taking customers until the surrounding villages of his district.
