As a main source of income for her family, Romarani's husband grows seasonal vegetables in their ancestral land.  He grows mainly beans and potatoes.  He sells the products in the local market.  Romarani also helps her husband in his work after maintaining her household work. As the prices of essential commodities have increased these days, they are unable to give sufficient financial support with this business.

With the aim of further developing their income, they have decided to start a milk supply and dairy product business (butter, paneer, curd).  She applied for a loan from BJS to purchase a cow and start the new business. She will sell the products in the local market, where there is a great demand for these products.

She hopes this business will be a great support to her family and she will be able to build a concrete house with the profit.

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Protima

texts.en:
Protima is a rural housewife who is 41 years old.  She lives with her three children (two sons and one daughter) and her husband Alok, 58 years old, in the small village of Kholaigram in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Protima is illiterate but her husband has completed his primary education. Two of their children are receiving an education. One of the children is in college and the other is in grade 12.  The third son works under a building contractor. They live in their own house.

To take care of the family's needs, Protima's husband is engaged in agricultural activities. He cultivates different green vegetables like onions, beans, and chilies on his own land and sells the agricultural products in the local market. This is the main source of income for the family.  Protima is also very hardworking and energetic.  She has an animal husbandry business.  After managing her household work, she looks after the cattle and helps her husband in his agricultural activities.

In order to give economical support to their family, they want to develop their agribusiness in a sustainable way and they have decided to grow potatoes on their land.

Protima heard about Kiva’s partner, BJS, and applied for a loan from them to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers so they can start potato cultivation. As the product is in great demand, they hope it will be a profitable business so they can earn enough profit to fulfill their dreams of bettering the family's economic conditions and giving a better education to their children.

She and her husband are thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Chobijan

texts.en:
Chobijan is a rural housewife from the small village Altagram in the district Jalpaiguri. She is 28 years old and studied up to grade 3.  Her husband, Sirajul, is a farmer. He is 26 years old and completed primary education.

Chobijan’s husband works in their land from dawn to dusk and grows different vegetables in different seasons and sells the products in the local market, which is the main source of income for the family.  His income, however, is not enough to meet the needs of the family.

To continue running his business in a sustainable way, and to start potato cultivation on their land, they need to make some investment, so Chobijan applied for a loan from BJS to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers.  She and her husband highly rely on their ability and luck, and they hope to develop their business, which has a good potential in the present market.

She and her husband greatly appreciate the support of their lenders, BJS and Kiva, for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
Sushila is a 27-year-old married woman who lives in Magurmari village at Dhupguri with her husband, Mantu, and two daughters. She and her husband are illiterate, but can sign their names only. One of her daughters is in class II (grade 2) and the other one is too small to go to school. 

Sushila is a housewife, while her husband is a farmer. Her husband farms many kinds of seasonal vegetables on their own farmland and sell them to the market. 

Sushila and her husband now decided to cultivate green peas, which are a very common vegetable in the winter season in Indian dishes. She is taking a loan of 15,000 INR from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy green pea seeds and fertilizers. 

She is confident that she can improve their economic condition through this business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for farming  green peas.

loans.name: Ashobala

texts.en:
Ashobala, a 44-year-old married woman, is involved in animal husbandry in the village of Barshoria at Dhupguri. She is married to Bimal, 53 years old, who is busy on his own farmland growing many kinds of vegetables. Both of them are illiterate and only know how to sign their names. They have two daughters. One of their daughters is married and another is studying in class IX (grade 9) in a village school. 

Her husband has been farming for many years. He cultivates vegetables and sells them in the market and Ashobala takes care of their animals but their income is insufficient for them to lead a normal life. Ashobala now decided to expand her business by purchasing more cows to sell more dairy products in the market to make more profit. She hopes that this business is profitable for her because there is a lot of demand for dairy products in her area. Due to a lack of money, she can't buy more cows and is unable to extend her business. For this reason, she needs the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She dreams of building a cattle farm as well as a pakka (concrete) house with the profit from this business and is trying her best to make her family financially strong.

She knows that she will be new in this business and not experienced in this field, so it will take some time to be successful. But she is confident enough that she will reach her goal. 
   
Ashobala is thankful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Bharoti

texts.en:
Bharoti is a rural housewife.   She helps her family economically; she is engaged in work as a labourer on a daily wages basis. She is 40 years old and illiterate and can only sign her name. Her husband, Sobin, age 46 years, is engaged in agricultural business.  He is also illiterate.  Both of them are raising two daughters, who are receiving education and in class VII (grade 7) and class VI (grade 6). They live in the small village Magurmari in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri in their own kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo made).

It's already more than 15 years that Bharoti's husband has been extensively engaged in agribusiness.  Their agribusiness is the main source of the income for their family. They sell the agricultural products in the local market.

Now her husband decided to start cultivation of potatoes, and to sustain her agribusiness, Bharoti asked for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to buy potato seeds and fertilizers.  It is a very profitable business and so she hopes to gain a good income from it.

Her goals are to give a decent lifestyle to her family, well educate her children and upgrade their house to a concrete one.

Her full thanks go to their lenders BJS and Kiva for giving her the loan.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Swarabala

texts.en:
Swarabala is 39 years old, married, and together with her husband has brought up three children, two sons and one daughter. Their two sons work in a local factory to give financial support to their family.  Their sons do not have school educations. Their only daughter reads in class VII ( Grade 7). Both Swarabala and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names.

Swarabala's husband is engaged in cultivation of vegetables in their own land. Though Swarabala is a housewife, yet she helps her husband in his agricultural work after managing her household work. They sell their products in the local market and earn money to meet the needs of their family. Her earnings are too low to meet all the necessities, especially these days when prices of essential commodities are going up, so they decided to start potato framing, which is a lucrative business in their area these days.

With the aim of further developing her agribusiness, she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for farming potatoes.

Swarabala plans to invest the income from her business to provide better education to her daughter and plans to save money for improving the well-being of her family.

loans.use: To purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers for starting cultivation.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a 45-year-old woman who lives with her husband, Pramir, 65 years old. Kalpana has completed her education to grade 5 and Pramir has passed B.A. (bachelor of arts). They live in Barshoria village at Dhupguri in their own pakka (concrete) house. 

She is a housewife while her husband is busy with his grocery shop. They have their own grocery shop in their locality. Kalpana and her husband have two sons who help their father in their own grocery shop.
 
Still Kalpana is not satisfied with their income because she fails to balance the expenditures of her family. As they have insufficient capital, they are unable to maintain the stock of their shop -- the varieties of grocery items and day-to-day necessary items -- so their business is running well. 

Being a responsible housewife and an affectionate mother, Kalpana wishes to pay attention to the financial condition of her family. That is why she needs the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more necessary grocery supplies and stationery goods, which have a great demand in her remote area. She knows that the profit generated from her business will make their economic condition stable.

loans.use: To purchase necessary grocery supplies and stationery goods for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Rupali

texts.en:
Rupali is a 19-year-old housewife who lives with her 31-year-old husband, Robin, and her little daughter in Khalpara at Dhupguri. Rupali has read up to class V (grade 5) and Robin has read up to class VII (grade 7).
 
Rupali’s husband is engaged in a betel nut and leaves business. Betel nut and betel leaves are used as a mouth freshener in India. They have a small pan (betel) shop. Her husband sells different kinds of betel leaves and betel nuts in his shop. Rupali assists her husband in his work. Due to their low income, they are gradually going down trodden and are struggling hard for their financial up gradation. 

Rupali heard about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and came to know that BJS offers loans to the poor women of rural areas. She applied for a loan of 15,000 INR to extent her business. She will purchase different kinds of betel leaves and betel nuts for their shop. She is fully concerned in deodorization of people’s mouths by chewing betel leaves and betel nuts after taking meals.

She knows that it is a profitable business, so she wants to extend her business. The profit she acquires from her business will help to improve their economic condition. In the future she also hopes to live in a pakka (concrete) house rather than staying in a kaccha (made of straw and mud) house, in which they have to face many difficulties for dwelling.

loans.use: To purchase different kinds of betel leaves and betel nuts for their shop.

loans.name: Sobita

texts.en:
Sobita is illiterate and can only sign her name. She is an entrepreneur. She has an animal husbandry business where she raises cattle. She has been in this business for more than five years.

Sobita is married and has three children (one daughter and two sons). All of them are students and in grade 10, grade 8 and grade 4 respectively. Her husband Ratan, aged 39 years, is a cycle-van puller. He carries goods and people and thus earns money for their family. They live in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own kachha house (mud, wood and straw-made).

The income from her business normally goes towards helping her husband cover the family's general expenses and paying their children's school fees. To give sufficient financial support, she has decided to purchase one more dairy cow. She has taken a loan. She wants to start a milk-supply business, which is a profitable business in their locality. Her customers will be her neighbours. She will give the supply of milk from door to door.

Sobita wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible and plans to channel the new profits from her business for the betterment of her family.

She is thankful to her lenders, BJS and Kiva, for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and start a milk-supply business.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita, age 33, is married to Swapan, age 43, and they live in Magurmari at Dhupguri. They live in their own kaccha house (made of straw and mud) with their two children. Both the children are students. 

Sabita has completed class VI standard (grade 6) and Swapan passed class V (grade 5). Sabita is a housewife and her husband is a decorator who supplies clothes, bamboos, bedding etc. for hire for different occasions such as festivals.  Their income depends upon their rate of service charges but now they are unable to provide their frequent service renting out their equipment. The rent is also too little for them to run a family, that is why Sabita needs the loan from BJS to buy more decorating clothes, bamboo, bedding and many other things to run the decorator business smoothly. She thinks that the profit she will obtain from their business will improve their financial condition and standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase decorative clothes, bamboo and different kinds of necessary equipment for their pandal (decorator business).

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi  is a 20-year-old housewife who studied up to class VI (grade 6) and is married to Mahesh, age 29, who completed his education up to grade 5. They live in Bargharia village in Dhupguri with their two children. The older child goes to school in grade 1 and the other is too small to go to school. Laxmi  takes care of her children and looks after her family throughout the day. 

Mahesh is a van driver who deliveries goods and vegetables to the market shops. The villagers also use his van as transport in the village and pay the traveling charges to him. The income of Laxmi's family thus depends on her husband’s daily income which varies every day. Due to this variation of income, Laxmi  decided to buy a cycle-van to expand the same business, taking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She hopes she will gain more profit from this and she could afford to give her family a decent lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van to carry goods and as a rural conveyance.

loans.name: Suniti

texts.en:
Suniti is a married woman with two children (sons). She completed primary education (grade 4).  Being a housewife, she looks after her husband and sons.  Her sons are students and read in grade 11 and grade 7.  Her husband Manu, 31 years old, is a farmer. He read up to grade 7. They are from the rural area of Promod Nagar in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri .They have their own house.

Suniti's husband has been actively involved in his agribusiness for about 10 years.  As the sole breadwinner of the family, he uses his income to provide financial support for the entire family.  But his income is too low to cover all the household costs.

Suniti is an ambitious, hardworking and optimistic woman.  She has decided to help her husband by taking a loan to grow potatoes. She has applied for a loan from BJS to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to cultivate potatoes, which is a profitable crop in the present market.

With the profits from her business, Suniti plans to provide a better education to her children, assist her family financially and improve her business to secure their future.  She dreams of purchasing a tractor in the future with her profit.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rapia

texts.en:
Rapia is a young entrepreneur who is married and has two children (one daughter and one son). She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than five years.  Little by little with the passing of the time, she has perfected her knowledge.   Her husband Yarul, 27 years old, is engaged in agriculture. Both the husband and wife have a primary education.  They live in the small village of Vangapara in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Their children are below school-going age.

Rapia's husband's agribusiness is the most important source of the family's income.  He sells the agricultural products in the local market. Rapia needs to make some investments in her agribusiness in order for it to function in a sustainable way.  A loan will support this hard working woman and her family greatly.

Rapia decided to take a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS to purchase bean seeds and good quality fertilizers to start cultivation of beans on their small piece of land, as the product is in much demand in the market

With the help of the loan, the family will maintain and develop their agribusiness and will be able to cover the expenses of their family, including the educational expenses of their children.

Rapia aspires to build a concrete house with the profit generated from the new business.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase bean seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Bharati

texts.en:
Bharati is a housewife, and her husband is a farmer by profession. Throughout the day, her husband keeps himself busy in farming different kinds of seasonal vegetables on their own agricultural land, and sells the harvest in the local market.  

Bharati manages all the household work as well as assists her husband in his farming work. Now she and her husband plan to take a loan to invest in potato farming by buying necessary supplies like potato seeds, fertilizers, etc. 

She hopes to earn a great profit from her newly planned potato business, which will enable her to meet the family’s financial needs as well as to give her children higher education.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Satkumari

texts.en:
Satkumari is a 44-year-old hardworking woman. She is married to a 51-year-old farmer named Jadunath. She is blessed with two daughters, studying in class XII (grade 12) and class X (grade 10) respectively. She studied up to class IV (grade 4) and her husband up to class III (grade 3). In spite of being less educated, they both are very much concerned with their children’s higher education. That is why they are working hard from dawn to dusk to meet the expenses incurred in their family. 

At present, due to their low income, Satkumari fails to bear the household expenditures and so she applied for a loan to Kiva’s partner, BJS, to buy potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes on her own plot of land. Then she wants to sell these potatoes to the local market for earning a profit. 

This business is in great demand in her locality, and she hopes for a great profit from this business with which she can give her children a better future and better education. She also wishes to renovate her kaccha house (made of mud and straw) to a pakka (concrete) house with the profit from the business, and so she is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase good quality seeds and fertilizers for potato farming.

loans.name: Bhalo

texts.en: Bhalo is a 46-year-old housewife from Bairatguri at Dhupguri. She lives with her husband Santosh and her only son. Santosh is 54 years old and engaged in farming. Bhalo is illiterate and can only sign her name while her husband has read up to class VI (grade 6). Their only son works in a grill factory. Her husband and son are hardworking and work until night but their income is too low for purchasing the daily household needs. Bhalo now decided to farm beans with the other vegetables on their farmland. She gives preference to this business because it is profitable and is in great demand in her rural area. That’s why she needs capital to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. She decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to accomplish her idea of cultivating beans. With the profit from her business, she thinks her financial condition will improve. She will be able to develop her kaccha house (made of straw and mud) into a pakka house (concrete) with the profit from her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is a 52-year-old woman who is married to Dhiren, 60 years old. Both of them are illiterate but know how to sign their name. They live in Dhupguri in the Jalpaiguri district in their own kaccha house (made of straw and mud). Dhiren is a cycle van puller. 

They have two children involved in the wood business. They sell timber to different furniture shops and wood factories. Their earnings are not enough to cover the family’s needs. Due to a lack of capital, they cannot purchase more wood so Gita made the decision to contribute to her children’s business. She plans to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy timber logs and sell them to the wood factory to earn a profit. She expects that she will be successful in elevating her income with the profit from the business.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell

loans.name: Lakhirani

texts.en:
Lakhirani is 43-year-old woman, married to Fatik, age 48 years. They live in Boragari village at Dhupguri. She is a housewife, while her husband is a farmer. Both of them have read up to class IV (grade 4). They have four sons; only one of them is a student of class XI (grade 11), and the others are engaged in farming activities along with their father. 

They live in a kaccha house (made of straw and mud), and they own a plot of land where they farm different kinds of vegetables and sell them in the village market for their income. The earnings of their family are insufficient to lead a decent lifestyle. 

Now Lakhirani Rani decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for farming potatoes with other vegetables. She hopes she will be successful to earn more profit from her business, which will ensure her to run her family smoothly. 

Her dream is to build a pakka house (concrete) in the future with the profit from her business. Lakhirani will overcome all the dreadful challenges; she may pursue a peaceful as well as comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Kanan

texts.en:
Kanan is a 46-year-old woman who lives with her husband Haripada, 55 years old, and their only son in Raipara village in Dhupguri. Both of them are illiterate and only know how to sign their names. She is a housewife and her husband is a farmer while their son is working for a private company. 

They have their own farmland where her husband cultivates different kinds of vegetables and crops in different seasons and supplies those items to the village market. This is the way they earn an income. Now, she plans to take a loan to invest in potato cultivation by buying the necessary supplies like potato seeds, fertilizers, manure etc. She chose this because potatoes are a year-round crop and are in great. They are used in almost all Indian dishes so Kanan is very confident about the profit she will earn through this cultivation. In spite of being uneducated, she has the power to improve her financial condition and extend her business. She is very thankful to BJS and Kiva for lending her the loan.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ajifa

texts.en:
Ajifa, age 45 years, is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the small town Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri.  She is a mother of one daughter who is a student of class XI (grade 11).  Ajifa has an elementary education up to grade 4.  Her husband, Kabir, is illiterate and can only sign his name. He is engaged in cultivation. They live in their own kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo made).

Ajifa's husband earns a living through farming green vegetables in their inherited land, which he has been doing for more than 15 years.  Ajifa and her husband decided to start a potato growing business.

Ajifa has heard about Kiva’s partner, BJS, and applied for a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to grow potatoes and sell them to the local market, which is a very profitable business and has a great demand in the present market.

This loan will enable her to extend her farmland to increase her potato farming production to upgrade her family's living conditions.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Alifa

texts.en:
Alifa, her husband, Jastiuddin, and their two children live in Barosharia village at Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district in a kaccha house (made of straw and mud). She is 39 years old and works as a daily labourer. Her husband is 44 years old and is a farmer. Both of them are illiterate and only know how to sign their names. Their children are engaged in farming activities, assisting their father in the field. They are so poor that they can’t send their children to school.

Alifa and her husband work very hard all day long, but cannot earn enough money to provide their basic daily needs. Due to their low income, they are even sometimes deprived of proper food, which is most important to stay alive. Even sometimes they cannot afford a couple of meals per day.

Alifa works hard, but could not earn enough to contribute to her family’s expenses. Due to lack of capital, Jastiuddin also is unable to farm more vegetables for sale. Their living condition is gradually going down day by day. In spite of being an illiterate woman, Alifa takes the initiative to give her family a stable condition, and so she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for farming potatoes along with other vegetables on their land.

The potato business is very profitable in that area, and she is optimistic that she can earn more money through this business. She can also bear her household expenditures and flooding expenses with the profit from her business. Then she could lead a happy and peaceful life along with her family.

Alifa is very much grateful to the Kiva lenders and BJS for this loan, as they have given financial support in her odd days.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizers to start potato farming.

loans.name: Tarubala

texts.en:
Tarubala is a 32-year-old housewife from a rural area, Dhupguri, in the district of Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband, Brojen, aged 46 years, and four children (three sons and 1 daughter), all of them attending school and in grade 9, grade 8, grade 6 and grade 4 respectively. Both husband and wife have a primary education. They live in their own kachha house (straw, bamboo and mud-made).

They have their own small plot of inherited land where Tarubala's husband cultivates different kinds of vegetables. He is an experienced farmer who always looks after his products, resulting in harvesting delectable crops. Tarubala is also a very energetic and hardworking lady. She also helps her husband through her agricultural activities. 

Now, Tarubala has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to start potato cultivation. With the loan, she will purchase a large quantity of potato seeds and fertilizer with the aim of increasing her productivity. She has chosen this business, as it is a profitable one.

Tarubala has a lot of future plans for the profits from the business: to give financial support for the betterment of their family, give their children a good education and build a concrete-made house. She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Anjali

texts.en:
Anjali is 31 years old, married, and with her spouse is raising three daughters. Anjali studied up to grade 8. Her husband, Hirendranath, is a 37-year-old farmer. He is illiterate and can only sign his name. All their daughters are receiving education and are in grade 8, grade 7 and grade 1 respectively. They live in their own semi-pacca house (brick-built and thatch roof) in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Anjali's husband's agribusiness is the main source of income for the family. He works hard on his land from dawn to dusk to grow crops, which he sells in the local market. But his earnings are too low to cover all the necessary needs of their family.  Anjali is also trying hard to help her husband. She raises livestock. Thanks to her hard work, she assists her husband financially to run the family.

With the aim of starting a dairy products business (products like: milk, paneer, butter and curds), Anjali asked for a loan from BJS. With the loan, she will buy a cow to start her business. She hopes to earn much profit, as it is a lucrative business.

Anjali plans to invest income from the loan to improve the family's well-being and give her children a good education. She also plans to save money to further propagation of the quantity of domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply and dairy products business.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is a 44-year-old woman who is married to Phani, 62 years old. They have five children. Three of them are students and the other two children are engaged in business. Sabita and her husband both are illiterate and can only sign their names. She lives in a kaccha house (made of straw and mud) at Raipara in Dhupguri with her family.

Sabita is a hardworking housewife who is always concerned with her family’s wellbeing, and her husband is busy with his own betel leaves shop. Her husband is unable to earn much so that she can lead a decent lifestyle. Even sometimes, they are deprived of food, so she decided to take a loan to invest in her husband’s business by buying necessary supplies like different kinds of betel leaves, betel nuts, lime, sweet ingredients, etc. to prepare betel leaves nicely. She knows that the villagers are fond of betel leaves after their laborious work, and so she wants to buy different kinds of ingredients for the preparation of betel leaves in her husband’s shop. It will enable them to earn a profit by selling betel leaves in her area to a large extent. 

She also hopes to build a concrete shop for betel leaves through the profit of their business, and their financial condition will also improve. In that way, she can spend enough money for her children’s higher education. 

Sabita is too much grateful to BJS (Kiva’s partner) as well Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: to purchase different supplies for the betel leaves shop.

loans.name: Kanika

texts.en:
Kanika is only 23 years old. She is a married woman and a housewife. She received education up to grade 8. Her husband, Ananda, is a farmer who raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. He has five years of experience in this field, which makes him an experienced and skilled farmer. They live in their own house with their three children in the small village of Nirendrapur in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. One of their children goes to school and reads in grade 1; the others are below the school-going age.

Kanika's husband usually sells his crops to the market in his area. His products have good demand in the market. Raising crops takes a lot of strength. This is very hard work, and that's why Kanika helps him in agricultural work after managing her household work. But this business cannot provide them sufficient financial sustenance, so they decided to start potato cultivation on their land.

Kanika needs additional money to invest in seeds and fertilizers. They chose this business because it is a profitable one, and there is great demand in the market.  They applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS for this purpose.

This business will give her an opportunity to earn profits to fulfill her dreams, such as financial development of their family, to provide education to her children and improve her business to secure their future.

Her thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds for cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en: Zohra is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals such as baby goats at low prices, raises them and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more baby goats. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats.

loans.name: Jahonteh

texts.ru: Чахонтех позитивный и ответственный мужчина в возрасте 34 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Он живёт со своей семьёй в небольшом посёлке. Но дом, в котором они живут, маловат и не совсем  благоустроен для хорошего проживания в нём. Жена Чахонтеха домохозяйка, она очень трудолюбивая и заботливая мама. Сам Чахонтех работает мастером по строительству и ремонту домов и квартир. Этим делом он занимается вот уже более 15 лет. И от этого дела он получает хороший доход. Но этого дохода хватает ему только на проживание. Но у него есть мечта, Чахонтех хочет построить большой дом для своей семьи. Но для этого ему необходимы денежные средства. То, что он зарабатывает не достаточно, чтобы позволить себе построение нового дома. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и  хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для построения дома. Чахонтех надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд  за поддержку.
texts.en:
Jahonteh, age 34, is a responsible and positive man.  He is married and the father of three children.  He lives with his family in a small village.  Their house, however, is quite small and poorly constructed.  Jahonteh's wife is a homemaker: she is a very hardworking and caring mother.  Jahonteh himself works as a master builder and also repairs houses and apartments.  He has been working in this field for more than 15 years.  He makes quite a good income from his job, but the money is just enough to provide for his family, on a daily basis.

Jahonteh's dream is to build a bigger home for his family, but to do this he needs money.  What he currently makes is not enough to allow him to build a new home.  For this reason, he has turned to Arvand and requested a loan to buy building materials for the construction of a new house.  He is hoping for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Silvio José

texts.es:
Don Silvio José es un señor de 45 años que habita en la comarca San Agustín, una comunidad ubicada a 15 kilómetros del municipio de El Sauce.
Ahí habita en su humilde vivienda al lado de su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus tres hijos dos de ellos en edad escolar.
Don Silvio se desempeña como Guarda de seguridad en una Institución de dicho municipio donde tiene varios años de laborar.
A pesar de su edad hace el esfuerzo por desempeñar bien su labor, ya que le toca viajar estos 15 kilómetros en bicicleta de ida y regreso para estar puntual en su centro de labores.
Debido a esta rutina don Silvio se ha sentido mal de salud por lo que se presentó a la oficina de Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito con fondos de los inversionistas de Kiva para la compra de medicina, realización de exámenes y pago de consultas médicas con el fin de mejorar y así rendir mejor en su t
Se siente muy agradecido con estas personas de buen corazón que apoyan al más necesitado y pide a Dios que los ilumine para sigan ayudando a personas de todo el mundo.
texts.en: Silvio José is 45 years old and lives in the village of San Agustín, some 15 kilometres away from the town of El Sauce. He lives in a humble house with his family, comprised of his wife and their three children, two of whom are of school age. Silvio works as a security guard for an institution in the town of El Sauce. He has had this job for many years. He spares no efforts to do his job properly, since, despite his age, he cycles every day 15 kilometres to and from work. This daily toil has had an adverse impact on Silvio's health, which is why he asks for a loan from Kiva, through the field partner, in order to pay for visits to physicians, pay for medical tests and buy medicine. His aim is to feel better so as to be able to work better. He is very grateful to the kind lenders who help those in need and asks God to help them help other people throughout the world.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses.

loans.name: Oumar Bakary

texts.fr:
OUMAR BAKARY est âgé de 41 ans et vit avec ses cinq enfants et ses époux à BASSIAN dans la sous préfecture de BAGUINEDA, Région de KOULIKORO.
OUMAR BAKARY n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le quatrième prêt il est à son cinquième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 4 tonnes de céréales (maïs, haricot, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de BASSIAN et environnants qu’elle gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, OUELESSEBOUGOU.
OUMAR BAKARY espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Oumar Bakary is 41 years old and lives with his five children and his wives in Bassian, in the Baguineda sub-district, which is part of the Koulikoro region.

Oumar Bakary did not have the chance to attend school. Very soon he became interested in income-generating activities including the trading and storing of grain cereals. He learned the business from his maternal uncle, who was once a major grain trader.

In order to satisfy his growing number of customers, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. Having successfully repaid the fourth loan, this is his fifth personal loan.

It will be used to purchase four tons of cereals (maize, beans, millet, fonio) from producers and farmers in Bassian and the surrounding area. He will then store the grain for at least three months. He sells primarily wholesale to retailers from large cities like Bamako and Ouelessebougou.

Oumar Bakary hopes to achieve average monthly profits of 90,000 CFA francs that will be used to repay the loan and to reinvest the remainder in the business activities.

loans.use: buy cereals

loans.name: Karen Vanessa

texts.es:
Ella se llama karen vanessa escogió el profesional en enfermería porque le parece que  cumple un papel importante en el cuidado de la salud de las personas.
La meta es ser una enfermera dedicada para cumplir con los protocolos establecidos, para así prestar un buen servicio a todas las personas, familias, grupos y comunidades enfermos o sanos, tanto en la prevención como en el cuidado de una enfermedad. 
para cumplir ésta meta necesita primero de la ayuda de Dios y  también de la ayuda del instituto CAMPO ALTO que tiene convenio con kiva,  donde empezó a cultivar los sueños, pues  necesita la ayuda económica,  puesto que los recursos desafortunadamente no alcanzan a cubrir la totalidad de los gastos, ruega a Dios que el instituto pueda apoyarla para cumplir el sueño.
texts.en: Karen Vanessa is studying to become a nurse, a path she chose because it is important to her to care for people's health. Her goal is to be a professional nurse who complies with safety and hygiene rules in order to really help individuals, families, groups, and communities. She wants to help healthy people prevent disease as well as care for the sick. In order to reach her goals, she asks for God's help, but also for Campo Alto's teaching institute, which has an agreement with Kiva. She wants to follow her dreams, but she needs financial help, since she does not have enough income to cover all the costs. She asks God to help the institute help her make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to pay for registration fees for one semester.

loans.name: Baara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  BAARA est constitué de  4 femmes dont 3 mariées et une célibataire. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 3 enfants et vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 5ème prêt. Les 4 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de galettes à l’image de SAYON qui est la femme assise dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 150kg de sorgho, 100kg de maïs et 5 kg de beurre de karité   avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte. Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
BAARA The Baara group consists of four women of whom three are married and one is single. They are on average 35 years old with three children and live in traditional extended families in the North Heremakono neighborhood of the city of Bougouni.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity to improve their businesses, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their fifth loan. The previous four loans were repaid.

This group of women sell flatcakes like Sayon who is the woman sitting in the photo. She intends to use the loan to buy 150 kg of sorghum, 100 kg of maize and 5 kg of shea butter from wholesalers in Bougouni. She conducts her retail sales at the market and at home, against cash or on credit to a mixed clientele.

She expects average monthly profits of 35,000 CFA francs to be invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make flatcakes

loans.name: Niño De Praga  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo crédito Niño de Praga está conformado por 6 mujeres quienes viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, la misma que le dio el nombre de Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, esta bañada por 4 ríos, su geografía es accidentada y cuenta con varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza. Las socias son mujeres emprendedoras quienes trabajan muy duro cada día para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares y así ofrecerles a sus hijos y familias un mejor porvenir, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Nancy, se encuentra realizando su tercer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Niño de Praga, le gusta este tipo de crédito por la unión de todas sus amigas y porque en cada reunión tienen la oportunidad de conversar de muchos temas y comparten experiencias vividas.
La Señora Nancy tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de un niño de 8 años  que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos de su hogar, la casa es propia.
Doña Nancy labora en la atención de un bar de una escuelita desde hace 1 año y desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de bisutería, este mercadería  les vende a sus amigas y recorriendo la ciudad puerta a puerta. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de bisutería y así crecer más en este negocio. Su meta es ser una profesional ya que va a estudiar Parvulario.
texts.en: Niño de Praga group is comprised of 6 women who live in the town of Cuenca, known for its architectural beauty which granted it a spot on the World Heritage list. Four rivers run through and around it, and the beautiful natural landscape boasts a lot of mountains. The members of the group are entrepreneurs who work very hard every day in order to improve their families' financial stability and give ther children a better future. They uphold the culture and traditions of their ancestors. Nancy, one of the members, is on her third loan together with her friends and comrades of the group. She likes this type of communal loans because of the sense of closeness to the other women, and because each meeting is the opportunity to discuss several topics and share past experiences. Nancy is 32 years old and a single mother of a child of 8 years, who goes to a school in the city. She does not have a house of her own and thus lives with her parents, with whom she shares household costs. Her parents do own their house. Nancy has been working at the canteen at a school for the past year and selling jewellery for two years. She sells her wares to her friends as well as door-to-door in the city. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise and make her business grow. Her goal is to learn a profession, which motivated her to start studying in order to become a preschool aide.

loans.use: to buy jewellery to sell.

loans.name: Laura Vanesa

texts.es:
Laura Vanessa tiene 18 años es la mayor de tres  hermanos pertenece al programa de Auxiliar de Enfermería.
Actualmente está en tercer semestre y ya realizando  prácticas en la Clínica San Rafael, se graduó de Bachiller comercial en el año 2012. 
Vive con el papá, la mamá y  2 hermanos, uno de 11 años y otro de 4 años, los padres siempre le han inculcado la necesidad de trabajar y ganar el propio dinero
El padre es quien costea todas las necesidades de la casa, y la mamá se dedica al hogar
 Destaca las cualidades que tiene, entre ellas la constancia en el estudio y la pasión por ayudar a los demás y siente que en enfermería lo puede realizar. 
Necesita el convenio Porque los padres le ayudaron los 2 primeros semestres, ahora ya se incrementa el costo y ella tiene dos hermanos pequeños y no desea dejar lo que está haciendo porque le gusta y se siente identificada con la enfermería, adicional a esto quiere poder ayudar a los padres y hermanos en un futuro  
Para ella la enfermería la acerca a las personas y  es una labor muy compleja. 
Siempre se va a sentir  satisfecha porque sabe que está ayudando a las personas y pacientes que en verdad lo necesitan. 
Desea continuar estudiando y sabe que con esfuerzo, dedicación y  vocación lo va a lograr
texts.en:
Laura Vanessa is 18 years old and the oldest of three siblings. She is in a Nursing Assistant program. She is currently in her third semester and is interning in the San Rafael Clinic. She graduated from secondary education with a business emphasis in 2012. 

She lives with her father, her mother, and two siblings, one aged 11 and the other aged 4. Her parents have always impressed upon her the need to work and make her own money. Her father pays for the things they need, and her mother takes care of the home. 

Among her standout qualities are studiousness and a passion for helping others, which she feels she can fulfill through nursing. 

She needs this loan agreement because her parents helped her with the first two semesters, but now the cost has increased and she has two younger siblings. She doesn't want to stop what she is doing because she likes it and she feels identified with nursing. In addition, she wants to be able to help her parents and her siblings in the future. 

For her, nursing brings her closer to others and is very complex work. She will always feel satisfied because she knows that she is helping people and patients who truly need it. She wants to continue studying and knows that with effort, dedication, and vocation, she will achieve it.

loans.use: to pay a semester of tuition

loans.name: Kaed

texts.en: Kaed is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 27 years old and single. Kaed owns a small cafeteria, where he offers fast food and drinks. Ever since he was a child, Kaed has worked as a waiter in a restaurant. After gaining enough experience, Kaed decided to rely on himself and open his own business. In 2011, Kaed successfully established his own restaurant and is gradually developing a good reputation in his surrounding area. Kaed is requesting a youth loan of $1,800 to pay the annual rent of his cafeteria. In the future, Kaed aims to grow his business even more, so he will be able to provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his cafeteria.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of twelve children from Panglao, Bohol. Most of her children are grown, but her youngest child is 15 years old. She goes fishing and catches sea urchins. Sea urchin is highly prized for its fishy-flavored roe and flesh. Its flesh is removed from the shell and placed in a clean bottle to be sold fresh or salted. It is a great appetizer during meal time. Bottled sea urchin can be sold in the wet market or even in grocery lanes. 

Aside from fishing, she raises hogs to have an additional source of income. Leonora is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and pig feed. This will help her raise more pigs at a given period of time. The income will go toward food and pay for school fees.

Leonora hopes to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: José Rubén

texts.es:
El joven José Rubén es originario de la comarca San Agustín ubicado a 15 kilómetros del municipio de El Sauce. Es padre de dos niños uno de ellos en edad escolar.
Se desempeña como Guarda de seguridad para una Institución de dicho municipio donde tiene más de cinco años de laborar, todos los días viaja desde muy temprano para estar puntual en su centro de labores, ya que lo más importante para él es cuidar su trabajo porque es el que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.
José Rubén en este momento tiene la necesidad de un crédito para la realización de ultrasonidos y compra medicamentos para mejorar la salud de su pequeño hijo, ya que con su salario no alcanza para cubrir estos gastos de emergencia.
Solicita a los inversionistas de Kiva para que a través de Ceprodel le financien este crédito donde les quedará eternamente agradecido.
texts.en:
The young José Rubén is from the comarca San Agustín, located 15 kilometers from the municipality El Sauce. He is the father of two children, one of whom is school-aged.

He is a security guard for an institution in the municipality, where he has worked for more than five years. He leaves very early every morning so he can arrive punctually at work. The most important thing for him is to take care of his job, because that's what allows him to bring home the daily bread.

José Rubén is now in need of a loan to get ultrasounds and buy medicines to improve the health of his young son, since his salary doesn't reach to cover these emergency costs. 

He brings this request to the Kiva investors so that, through Ceprodel, they may finance this loan, for which he will be eternally grateful to them.

loans.use: Realización de ultrasonidos y compra medicamentos

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   BENKADI est constitué de  4 femmes (3 mariées et une célibataire) ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier DIALANIKORO de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 5ème prêt. Les 4 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’habits à l’image de MARIAM qui est la femme assise dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 9 pièces de pagnes avec les grossistes  de BAMAKO. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group consists of four women (three married and one single) who on average are 39 years old with four children. They live in traditional extended families in the Dialanikoro area of ​​the city of Bougouni.

They met through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity to improve their businesses, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their fifth loan. The previous four loans were repaid.

This group of women sells clothes like Mariam who is the woman sitting in the photo. She intends use the loan to buy nine lengths of pagne (colorful West-African fabric) from wholesalers in Bamako. She conducts her retail sales at the market and at home, against cash and on credit to a mixed clientele.

She expects average monthly profits of 35,000 CFA francs to be invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy pagnes (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Khorshaid

texts.en: Khorshaid is a 54-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of selling and purchasing animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and sells them off near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Islamic countries). At present she has two buffaloes and two goats. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 50,000 to purchase two more calves. She is in her 7th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and raise her income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Ameeran

texts.en: Ameeran is a 54-year-old married woman. She has been in business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has three cows, which she uses for selling milk to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Ameeran has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her 7th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 60,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow to increase her sales. Ameeran is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 43-year-old lady, and a mother of four daughters and a son. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband provides a facility for tailoring services; he operates his business from the local market.

Her husband has to purchase some clothes in bulk for sewing dresses. But due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase the clothes in bulk. Therefore Shakeela requested a Kiva group loan with three members, from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, she'll provide financial assistance to her husband by purchasing clothes for sewing garments for his business. This will also prove good for making savings for her entire family's needs.

She is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

Note: She raised her hand in the photo.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sewing garments.

loans.name: María Carmelina

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del grupo de crédito San Pablo desde hace 5 años, todo este tiempo le ha permitido conocer bien a sus compañeras y para apoyarse mutuamente, vive en la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, esta parroquia es conocida por ser el mirador de la ciudad, se gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, a la agricultura y al comercio.
La Señora María tiene 58 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos mayores de edad que están casados y viven independientes, su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña María pasa en casa y se dedica a la cría de cuyes y pollos, también cultiva y sus cosechas son para la venta, en su tiempo libre lava ropa ajena. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes y alimento para animales. Su meta es tener más animales.
texts.en:
Maria has been a member of the San Pablo loan group for five years. Over these years she has been able to get to know her group members better and they have been able to support each other. She lives in the Turi parish in Cuenca, which is known for being the lookout over the city. The people of Turi work in animal husbandry, farming and business.

Maria is 58 years of age, married, and has six adult children from her marriage, all of whom are married and live independently.  Her husband works as a builder and they live in their own home.

Maria stays at home and works raising guinea pigs and chickens, as well as growing crops to harvest and sell. In her free time she provides a laundry service by washing clothes.

The money from this loan will be used to buy chickens, guinea pigs and feed for the animals. Maria's goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs and feed for the animals

loans.name: Iris Yalí

texts.es:
Iris de 25 años de edad,  es una persona que tiene un nivel académico de 5° grado, ya que en su época la familia era muy números, sus padre tenían 5 hijos y no a todos les podían dar estudio alguno, como ella le toco que trabajar con su madre en al venta de frescos en el pueblo, ella creció en el ambiente de trabajo, hasta que tuvo a su hija que hoy tiene tres años de edad, es una madre soltera y  vive con su padre.

 Es una mujer muy trabajadora, todos los día se dedica a vender en el pueblo ofreciendo refresco en los buses, también en la época de escuela ella trabaja en el cafetin de la escuela, queda a una distancia de 500 mt de su casa. 


El prestamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar frutas, churros,golosinas para el cafetin, ya que esta pronto de iniciar la época escolar y tiene que estar bien surtida de productos y así tener mayor ingreso económico.  

Los sueños de Iris, son de que su hija tenga una vida digna y que no le falte nada, también piensa comprar un terreno para construir su casa, porque en estos momentos esta viviendo con sus padres.
texts.en:
Iris is 25 years old and has a fifth grade level of academic study, since in her time her family was very numerous-- her parents had five children and they couldn't send them all to school. Some, like her, worked with her mother selling fruit drinks in the town. She grew up around work, until she had her daughter, who is now three years old. She is a single mother and lives with her father.

Iris is a very hardworking woman. Every day she sells in the town, offering soft drinks in the buses. Also, during the school year, she works in the school cafe, which is located 500 meters from her house.

The loan she is requesting is to buy fruit, churros, and candy for the cafe, since the school year is starting soon and she needs to have a good stock of products so as to make more income.

Iris's dreams are for her daughter to have a decent life and for her not to want for anything. She is also thinking about buyingsome land to build a house, because she is currently living with her parents.

loans.use: to buy fruit, churros, and candy for the cafe, since the school year is starting soon and she needs to have a good stock of products

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es:
Ella es cindy, quiere terminar de estudiar el programa técnico de Administración en salud en Campo Alto,  para poder obtener una mejor calidad de vida y asi poder ayudarle a los padres, el padre es de la tercera edad y la madre de 57 años tiene una enfermedad la cual no le permite desarrollar ninguna actividad laboral, por esta razón ella no cuenta con apoyo económico, por otra parte cindy esta en estado de gestación y no cuenta con el apoyo del padre, ella vive con la hermana y el gran sueño es terminar de estudiar, obtener un buen trabajo para poderle brindar un buen futuro al hijo, ayudarle a los papas y al sobrino que tiene una enfermedad. 

Aspira poder obtener y hacer parte del convenio KIVA para poder terminar los estudios.
texts.en:
This is Cindy. She wants to finish her technical program in Health Administration at Campo Alto so that she can achieve a better quality of life and be able to help her parents. Her father is retired and her mother, 57 years old, has an illness that does not allow her to work. For these reasons, Cindy cannot count on any financial assistance from them. In addition, she is pregnant and is not receiving support from the father. She lives with her sister and her biggest dream is to finish her studies and get a good job so she can provide her child with a good future while helping her parents and her nephew, who has an illness.

She would like to become part of the KIVA community so that she can complete her studies.

loans.use: pay for a semester of enrollment

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak lives in Dalarik village of Armavir region. He is a farmer with many years of experience running a farm. In particular, Artak keeps cows, calves and cultivates barley, tomatoes, and grass. Artak also owns an orchard where 100 apricot trees are grown. Now, to be able to enlarge his farm, Artak asks for this loan. The loan will help him to purchase three oxen and forage for feeding the livestock. 

Artak received a loan from a local financial institution in the past but was not able, unfortunately, to pay it back on time. However, thanks to his recent hard work, Artak was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. Consequently, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

Artak lives together with his wife and two grown-up children.

loans.use: to pay for three oxen and forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 41-year-old married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 45,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her 7th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Karen Dayan

texts.es:
Ella se llama erika dayan, es una persona que día a día lucha por preparase académica mente para ser mejor persona con principios, valores, ética y moral, respeto y responsabilidad. Desde  la infancia siempre soñó con ser una persona profesional  en el área de la salud, pero ha sido imposible pues desde muy niña le ha tocado trabajar y estudiar, ya que ella no tuvo quien le pagara el estudio. Todo lo que hasta el momento ha logrado realizar ha sido por ella misma. 
 Ser técnica en la carrera de Auxiliar en Salud Oral le sirve mucho para complementar los conocimientos en el área de la salud  obtener una mejor preparación y oportunidad laboral.
Agrádese a kiva que está interesado en subsidiar las carreras técnicas  que ofrece  el INSTITUTO CAMPO ALTO, pues es una oportunidad que le brindan a muchas personas como Erika, que no  tienen los medios para  pagar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
This is Erika Dayan. She is someone who strives every day to improve herself academically and be a person of principles, values, ethics and morals, respectability and responsibility. Ever since she was a child, Erika has always dreamed of becoming a health professional, however this has been impossible because since she was very young Erika has had to work and study, as there was no one else to pay for her tuition. Everything she has now is a result of what she has been able to achieve by herself. 

Specialising in the Dental Health Assistant course will be very useful for Erika and complement her knowledge in the health field, which will provide her with better training as well as work opportunities.

Erika is grateful to Kiva for their interest in subsidising specialist courses offered by the Campo Alto Institute. This provides opportunities to many people like Erika who don’t have a way of paying for a professional course.

loans.use: to pay her semester's fees

loans.name: Yeimy Rocio

texts.es:
Ella es Yeimy, es una mujer emprendedora llena de sueños y metas que cumplir, una mujer que busca sacar adelante la familia, ella es trabajadora, luchadora y dedicada. Quiere salir adelante, superarse, haciendo una carrera profesional. 
Desde hace un largo tiempo es manicurista, desde entonces le ha llamado la atención el tema de la estética, ha estado interesándose queriendo hacer una carrera para alimentar mas y mas el tema, ingresar a Campo alto le ayudara a aprender, a superarse y sobre salir en los desempeños. 
Estudiar cosmetología le ayudara a seguir adelante con el trabajo puesto a que esta carrera le parece muy interesante y le ayudaría bastante implementando nuevas técnicas, ya que piensa sobresalir con un buen rendimiento siendo una gran profesional y con ello crear la propia empresa desempeñándose como esteticista y formar el propio Spa.
Yeimy al hacer esta carrera con el apoyo de kiva esta dando un paso mas en la vida, es un paso en el que todo muy bien le saldrá con empeño y con gran dedicación en las metas esta dispuesta a realizar.
texts.en:
This is Yeimy. She is an enterprising woman full of dreams and goals she would like to achieve, a woman who looks for ways to take care of her family. She is hardworking, determined and dedicated, and she wants to get ahead and improve herself by undertaking a professional degree.

Yeimy has been a manicurist for a long time, but cosmetology has since caught her attention. She had been wanting to undertake a degree in it to specialise further in this area, so she enrolled in Campo Alto where they will help her to learn, improve herself and excel in her studies.  

Studying cosmetology will surely help Yeimy to get ahead in this line of work since it is a degree which she is very interested in. It would help her a lot to implement new techniques since she would like to stand out by providing good service and being an excellent professional. In doing so, she would be able to start her own business as a beautician and open up her own salon. 

By undertaking this degree with the help of Kiva, Yeimy will take a new step in her life . With this step, everything will work out very well for her by putting a lot of effort and dedication into the goals she would like to achieve.

loans.use: to pay a semester of fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a university course

loans.name: Margarita Johanna

texts.es:
La Señora Margarita está realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas del grupo de crédito San Pablo, vive en la parroquia Baños en Cuenca, esta parroquia es conocida por sus aguas termales, por sus centros de diversión y su rica gastronomía.
La Señora Margarita tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido 3 hijos de 8, 5 y 3 años, dos de sus hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad, su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Margarita labora de domingo a domingo en la venta de verduras, esta actividad la realiza ambulantemente desde que cumplió  14 años de edad, labora sin un horario fijo.  El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de verduras y así aumentar sus productos. Su meta es acabar sus estudios del colegio.
texts.en:
Margarita is taking out her first loan alongside her friends in the San Pablo loan group. She lives in the town of Baños in Cuenca, a town which is known for its thermal springs, entertainment venues and rich gastronomy. 

Margarita is 24, married and has three children from her marriage who are eight, five and three years of age, two of whom study in a local school. Her husband works in private employment and they live in their own home. 

Margarita works seven days a week selling vegetables as a street vendor. She has been doing this since she was 14 years old, working to no set timetable. 

The money from this loan will go towards buying vegetables and increasing her wares. Margarita’s goal is to complete high school.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Zahrae

texts.en: Zahrae is 35 years old, married, and has three children. She is from Iraq. Both Zahrae and her husband provide for the family together. Zahrae is a tailor and works from home, which she has been doing since 2012. She specializes in making all types of women's outfits. Zahrae has gained an excellent reputation and is well known in the surrounding area. She is requesting a loan of $2,280, which she will use to buy a new sewing machine, a motor generator and also to renovate her workplace. She wants to expand her business and increase her profits so that she may open an institute for tailoring and enroll her children in this field.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, a motor generator and also to renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, okra, rice, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lourdes Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora. Lourdes es socia desde hace 8 años del grupo de crédito San Pablo, vive en la parroquia Baños en Cuenca, esta parroquia es conocida por sus aguas termales, por sus centros de diversión y su rica gastronomía.
La Señora Lourdes tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 5 hijos de 17, 15, 10 y 6 años y su último hijo de apenas 10 meses, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y sus dos hijos menores en la escuela, su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Lourdes desde hace algún tiempo se dedica al negocio de animales, ella compra los animales los crías por un tiempo y los vende, también vende ropa, esta actividad la realiza en diferentes lugares de la ciudad. 
El dinero de su crédito es para comprar ropa. Su meta es viajar a los Estados Unidos.
texts.en:
Lourdes has been a member of the San Pablo loan group for eight years. She lives in the town of Baños in Cuenca, a town which is known for its thermal springs, entertainment venues and rich gastronomy. 

Lourdes is 33 years old and lives in a de facto relationship. She has five children who are 17, 15, 10 and 6 years old, the last being just 10 months old. Her first two children go to high school and her two younger children go to primary school. Her husband works as a builder and they live in their own home.

Lourdes has been working in animal husbandry for some time now, buying and raising animals and later selling them. She also sells clothes in different parts of the city. 

The money from this loan will go towards buying clothes. Lourdes’ goal is to travel to the United States.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica de 51 años de edad, soltera con dos hijos menores de edad. Es originaria del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera por falta de recursos económicos. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la compra y venta de cerdos en pie, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y por encargo, ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de cerdos en pie, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Angélica agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y  países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Angelica is 51 years old, single and has two underage children. She comes from Sauce, a town which is located in the northern area of the region. She is known for being hardworking, responsible and aspiring towards personal development, however unfortunately she was not able to undertake a degree because of a lack of financial resources. At present she strives day after day to offer her children a better future.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, Angelica works buying and selling live pigs, which she does in her own home on demand, working around eight hours a day.

The aim of this loan is to invest in working capital for her business in the purchase and sale of live pigs so that in the not too distant future she will be able to have a better income. 

Angelica is grateful to the Kiva lenders who offer people of scant resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua the chance to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital for her business in the purchase and sale of live pigs

loans.name: Veronica Siomara

texts.es:
Veronica de 57 años de edad, casada con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Esta mujer se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. en la vida ha luchado dura para obtener el pan de cada día a pesar de todas las adversidades, que ha superado gracias a su espíritu de superación de optimismo y sus ganas de lucha para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijo, para consolidar su sueños sus metas como es forma a su hijo en un profesional.
Gracia a su esfuerzo tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa usada como pantalones de vestir y jeans, blusas, camisetas, short, faldas, vestidos, ropa de cama de adulto y niño, juguetes, bolsos de damas. Ella dedica su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa de segunda mano, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Veronica agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Veronica, 57 years old and married, has one son who is a minor. She is from El Sauce, located in the northern area of the region. This woman is characterized as hardworking and responsible with a desire for personal improvement. She has fought hard in her life to get her daily bread in spite of all the adversities she faced, which she has beaten thanks to her spirit of overcoming and optimism, and her desire to fight to give her son a better future and to realize her dreams and goals, such as educating her son into a professional. 

Thanks to her efforts, she has as an economic activity: the selling of used clothes such as dress pants and jeans, blouses, shirts, shorts, skirts, dresses, sleepwear for adults and children, toys, and ladies' bags. She works in her business some 10 hours a day, offering her products. The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business of buying and selling secondhand clothes, so that in a future not too far from now, she can make more income.

Veronica is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people with scant resources in poor countries, as Nicaragua is, so that they can have some measure of decent work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business of buying and selling secondhand clothes such as dress pants and jeans, blouses, shirts, shorts, skirts, dresses, sleepwear for adults and children, toys, and ladies' bags

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 19-year-old single young man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. His father works in a local firm, and this is the only source of income for the family. Mohammad is a student at the university where he studies information technology. He would like to finish his studies, earn a bachelor of arts degree, and find a job. 

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies, so he is able to do his homework and read articles. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Tabasum

texts.en:
Tabasum is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of four. She has been running a business of selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city, and after doing stitching she sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling well designed clothes in her community. 

She requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes along with packs of threads and needles. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes along with packs of threads and needles.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
El socio Sabino se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el socio tiene un taxi que presta servicio  a las diferentes personas,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio,el sueño del socio es comprarse un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member Sabino continues working in the transport business. He has a taxi which offers services to different people. He has been working in this business for several years and his dream is to buy a new car. He requests this loan to buy tires for his car. He is glad to have the loan and is committed to making his payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema, age 43, is a married woman and the mother of three children. She deals in a business of selling bed covers, spreads and bedsheets to the people of her community. She purchases a variety of blankets from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community.
