She always has a great collection to offer to her customers and earns a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently Haleema is in her 6th loan cycle and applied for a loan of Rs. 50,000. This will help her to purchase a variety of bed covers and spreads in various colors and designs to inflate her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of bed covers and spreads in various colors and designs.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 36-year-old married woman and mother of two children. She works very hard to provide for her family's needs, including food, health, clothing, and education. Along with her husband, Fatima has done agricultural work for many years. She grows different vegetables and fruits, and sells them in the local market. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Fatima applied a loan of Rs. 40000 to purchase different types of seeds as well as packs of insecticides and pesticides. This would help her to grow more crops and generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds as well as packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia Lucila se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia y agricultura,la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva verduras como cebollas,zanahorias y zapallos y luego los vende en las diferentes feria y tambien vende ganados,la socia por medio de estos pequeños negocios quiere salir adelante.El sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las verduras.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilantes para su terreno.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lucila continues to work raising cattle and farming. She has a plot of land where she grows vegetables such as onions, carrots and pumpkins, which she later sells in different markets, as well as selling cattle. 

With these small businesses Lucila strives to get ahead. Her dream is to have her own store where she can sell her vegetables. 

Lucila has asked for a loan to buy seeds and fertiliser for her land. She is grateful for the loan she has been granted and promises to meet her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser for her land

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amistad Cusqueña”, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de ropa interior, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia vende lo que son calcetines, sostenes entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como ropa interior entre otros.
Se encuentra contenta por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
The member is part of the communal bank "Amistad Cusqueña" and continues with her business selling undergarments. She has been in this business for some time, and it is going well for her due to the effort she puts into her business every day. She is a responsible and industrious person. She sells socks, bras, and other items, and wants to be able to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family this way. 

At this time she needs the loan to buy merchandise such as underclothing, among other items. She is happy to have the loan, commits to making her payments on time, and expresses her thanks for the help given to her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as undergarments, among other items

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco Comunal “Amistad Cusqueña”, él socio continua con su negocio de elaboración de muebles, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio elabora roperos, muebles, camas entre otros, él socio es una persona responsable, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Amistad Cusqueña  (Cuscan Friendship) community bank. He still makes furniture for a living and has been doing so for a long time. He does a good job thanks to the effort he puts in every day. He makes wardrobes, beds and other items. 

This member is a responsible person and would like to keep working so that he can continue to support his family. He currently requires a loan to purchase wood. He is grateful for the support he has been offered and the loan that has been granted to him, and he promises to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to continue helping his family

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
Kazem is from Iraq. He is a hardworking client, 52 years of age, who is married and has 7 children, four of whom are employed and the rest are continuing their studies. Kazem is a mechanic. In his small garage, he repairs vehicles and restores all the damaged parts of the vehicle’s body. He established his business in 1990 when he was very young and grew up fast in this field. He has gained an excellent reputation in his surroundings thanks to his hard work and competitive prices. 

Kazem is requesting a loan of $3,000. He will use this loan to install an external ceiling and to renovate his garage. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to raise his children well and provide for all of his needs.

loans.use: to install an external ceiling and to renovate his garage.

loans.name: Ruqayia

texts.en:
Ruqayia is a married woman who runs a business of animal selling. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. At present she has one buffalo and four calves. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, Ruqayia contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz's age is 32. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan and has 4 children. Her husband is running a betel shop in the locality where they live. He sells the betel and a variety of soft drinks. 

Shahnaz is applying for a Kiva group loan with 2 members, so that her husband can purchase some products, i.e. groundnuts, betel leaf and a refrigerator for saving cold drinks. That will be useful for his business for reselling purposes, and for earning a good amount of profit.

The profit amount can help them to remove financial obstacles, and also make her family financially strong to secure the future of their children.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

Note: She has raised her hand in the photo.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts, betel leaf and a refrigerator for cold drinks.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is a 29-year-old married woman. She and her husband have been running a business of selling milk for many years. She has two buffaloes which she uses for selling milk to the people of her locality. She also sells animals to generate an extra amount of profit. Zahida has become famous for providing good quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her 5th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Zahida is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Jameel

texts.en:
Jameel is 19 years old and lives with his family in Gaza. His life conditions prevented him from completing higher education, so in 2013, he decided to work with his father selling chicken. He earns a monthly income of $519 USD. He brings the chickens from a poultry farm near his shop, but still needs a lot of improvement and changes made to his business. 

Jameel has applied for this youth loan to buy a refrigerator and new chicken plucking machine, which will help him to improve his financial condition, support the needs of his family, and reinvest in his business.

His dream is to complete his education and provide the best life conditions for his family. Jameel is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and new chicken plucking machine.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 37-year-old vigorous woman, who has been stitching clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons so that she can increase her revenues and generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Shantalle

texts.es:
Shantalle es una joven estudiante de Negocios Internacionales, ella esta solicitando un prestamo para poder pagar sus estudios, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es  Shantalle, tengo 18 años de edad, nací y crecí en el distrito nacional, de la ciudad de Santo Domingo, soy la segunda hija de  tres hermanos, mi hermana mayor de 22 años, mi hermano menor de 12 años, mis dos hermanos viven conmigo,  mi madre y mi abuelo quien es pensionado. 

Estudio de la carrera de Negocios Internacionales en la Universidad Apec  (UNAPEC) y tengo la necesidad de proveerme de transporte y alimentación necesaria  para la universidad y materiales académicos de los cuales me hacen falta, ya que demando recursos económicos que ahora no puedo satisfacer.

Ya he tomado 23 materias de mi pensum con un equivalente a 63 créditos de 199 en total. De las materias cursadas, mis favoritas han sido Introducción a los negocios, Mercadotecnia, Administración de Ventas y Gerencia de Servicios. 

Tengo la necesidad de este préstamo porque los recursos que pueden brindarme mi  familia no son suficientes para pagar la matricula, pasajes y materiales que demandan estos estudios. Si no recibiera este préstamo o ayuda tendría que suspender materias y quizás hasta la carrera, afectando mi desarrollo como persona joven que aún no trabajo por falta de oportunidad por mi poca experiencia laboral.

Mis metas académicas es terminar mi carrera con un buen índice, Mis metas familiares son ayudar a mis familiares a desarrollarse también, mi meta personal es ser mejor persona y profesional cada día.

Después de terminar mi carrera universitaria mis sueños sería continuar con una maestría o un doctorado en negocios y luego trabajar en una institución relacionada a los negocios internacionales para desarrollar lo aprendido y serle útil a mi familia y a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Shantalle is a young International Business student. She is requesting a loan so she can pay for her studies. This is her story:

My name is Shantalle, I'm 18 years old, I was born and raised in the Distrito Nacional, in the city of Santo Domingo. I'm the second daughter of three siblings: my older sister is 22 and my younger brother is 12. My two siblings live with me, my mother, and my grandfather, who is retired.

I'm studying International Business in the Apec University (UNAPEC) and I need to provide myself with transport and food for the university, and academic materials I need, so I'm requesting economic resources that I can't satisfy on my own now.

I've already taken 23 classes in my study program, which is equivalent to 63 credits out of a total of 199. Of the subjects I've studied, my favorites have been Introduction to Business, Marketing, Sales Administration and Service Management.

I need this loan because the resources my family can offer me are not enough to pay for my tuition, transport, and materials that are required for these studies. If I don't get this loan or some help, I will have to drop some classes and maybe even the whole degree, affecting my development as a young person who isn't working yet because of lack of opportunity due to my small amount of work experience. 

My academic goals are to finish my degree with a good GPA, my family goals are to help my family members to develop themselves too, my personal goal is to be a better person and professional each day. 

After finishing my university career, my dreams will be to continue with a Masters or a PhD in Business and then to work in an institution related to international businesses to use what I've learned and to be useful to my family and to society.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance, transport, and books for her International Business studies

loans.name: Diega

texts.en:
Diega is a married woman and a mother of five children who lives in Trinidad, Bohol. She has worked in the coffin-making business with her husband for more than six years.

Diega is asking for a loan to buy materials for coffin-making like plywood, varnish, nails, and paints. In the future, Diega hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for coffin-making like plywood, varnish, nails, and paints

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de queso, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua distribuyendo su mercadería en la ciudad de Cusco y en el distrito de Mollepata, la socia a la vez continua dedicándose a la agricultura, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de quesos.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member is Gregoria who continues with her business buying and selling cheese. She has worked in this business for a long time and it goes well thanks to the efforts she puts into her work each day. She still sells her goods in the city of Cusco and in the Mollepata Disctrict. Also, she still works in agriculture and by this she provides for her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy cheese.

She is very thankful for the loan granted and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy cheese.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia Gladys se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia lo vende por catálogos ofreciendo a diferentes personas o amigos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar labiz labiales, cremas y perfumes.

La socia Gladys agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The borrower Gladys continues her business of selling beauty products. She sells lipsticks, creams and perfumes by catalog, offering them to different people or friends. The borrower works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM. She has been working in this business for five years now and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell beauty products.

She is requesting this loan to buy lipsticks, creams, and perfumes. The borrower Gladys is grateful for the loan and commits to making her payments in accordance with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, creams, and perfumes

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is a 44-year-old lady, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband provides transport services by driving a 3-wheeler auto rickshaw to earn enough income to meet daily family expenses. For the past few days his rickshaw has not been working properly, therefore he is unable to generate any income. 

In order to help her husband, Samina has applied for a Kiva loan with three members from BRAC Pakistan because her husband needs to maintain his auto rickshaw so that he can provide better transport services. That will be a positive step for Samina to create savings to fulfill the needs of the entire family. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Samina is the one with her hand raised in the photo.

loans.use: to provide her husband financial assistance to maintain his auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, Shehnaz has gradually improved her business. Currently she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Naeem

texts.en:
Naeem is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of three. She is in the business of selling embroidered cloths in her community. She has five years of experience in this field. She makes beautiful embroidery patterns on cloth for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 through Kashf Foundation to buy bundles of cloth along with spools of thread, packs of beads, sequins and stones in different colors. This way she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers. 

Naeem dreams of her children's bright future and desires to build her own house, as she is living in a rented house with her family. She is in her 7th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy bundles of cloth along with spools of thread, packs of beads, sequins and stones in different colors.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una señorita  soltera de 38 años de edad, actualmente vive con sus padres en el Departamento de Sololá.
Ella es una mujer trabajadora que lucha por sacar adelante a su familia. Comenta que se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías como pulseras, collares y fajas y lo realiza en su domicilio.  Eligió esta actividad porque no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar cuando era pequeña, ya que sus padres no contaban con los recursos económicos suficientes. Ahora lleva varios años de experiencia en esta actividad que es bastante productiva y rentable, como también cuenta con un molino de nixtamal, porque es otra fuente de ingresos para su familia.
Por lo que ahora ella ve la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo de Q 8,000.00 para la compra de artículos de mostacilla para la elaboración de pulseras, collares y fajas y así poder ofrecerles una variedad de productos a sus clientes.
Su sueño es  construir su vivienda para que en un futuro pueda formar una familia.
texts.en:
Juana is a single woman, 38 years old. She currently lives with her parents in the Sololá Department. She is a hardworking woman who fights to move her family forward. She says that she works making artisanal crafts such as bracelets, necklaces, and belts, and that she does this work in her home. She chose this activity because she didn't have the chance to study when she was young, since her parents didn't have sufficient economic resources. Now she has several years of experience in this activity, which is quite productive and profitable. She also has a nixtamal mill, because it is another source of income for her family. 

So now she sees a need to request a loan of 8,000 GTQ to buy beading materials to make bracelets, necklaces, and belts, so she can offer her clients a variety of products. Her dream is to build herself a house so that in the future she can have a family.

loans.use: to buy beading materials to make craft items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and a chair and table.

loans.name: San Pablo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN PABLO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina ella es soltera y tiene 53 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
 
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cafe, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de agricultura.




La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio
texts.en:
The borrowers are part of the communal bank "San Pablo," which is located in the Huayopata district, part of the province of La Convencion in the Department of Cusco. 

The member Valentina is single, 53 years old, and has two children. She works in her business, a grocery store, where she sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil. She works from 8:00AM to 6:00 PM. She has been in this business for a year now and it is going very well; her dream is to grow the business of the grocery store. 

She is requesting this loan to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice. 

The other members work in animal sales, coffee sales, grocery store businesses and agriculture sales. 

The borrower is grateful to those who form part of her dream through this medium.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice

location.town: Sector san pablo/distrito de la convencion

loans.name: Muyisa Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Jacqueline est une commerçante d’une expérience de 2 ans, âgée de 55 ans, veuve et mère de 4 enfants dont 2 étudient et 2 autres sont mariés. La cliente est membre d’un collectif d’Affaires « Muyisa ». Elle est vendeuse des produits pharmaceutiques. Elle installe ses marchandises dans une maison/pharmacie sur la route principale de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter   des boites de médicaments modernes. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari(lors de son vivant). Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de microcrédit, pendant, ce moment de post conflit dans la région de l’Est du pays. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Jacqueline, the customer, has been a retailer for 2 years, is 55 years old, widowed and the mother of 4 children, 2 of whom are at school and 2 of whom are married. Jacqueline is a member of the Muyisa business group. She sells medicines. She displays her merchandise in a house/pharmacy located on the town's main road. She is requesting a loan from Hekima with which to increase her business. She will buy some boxes of modern medicines. She started her business with funds she received from her husband when he was alive. In the future, she would like to increase her credit, to feed her children and make sure they get an education. She thanks Hekima for its support of non-bankable female entrepreneurs in the form of microloans, especially in this difficult time after the war in the east of the country.

Note: some of the customers are holding their babies.

loans.use: to buy modern medicines.

loans.name: José Ursulo

texts.es:
José de 19 años de edad, se encuentra acompañado y padre de un hijo.  Es albañil aprendió el oficio de sus hermanos, pero a aparte de este negocio es comerciante de frutas, ya que con
su madre y sus hermanos se dedica a comercializar frutas al mercado de la ciudad.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar un lote de frutas a una finca, para comercializarla en la ciudad con sus hermanos y su madre.
texts.en:
José is 19 years old, and is a common-law husband and father of a son.  He is a bricklayer.  He learned the trade from his brothers.  But apart from this business, he is a fruit merchant.  Along with his mother and brothers, he makes a living selling fruits in the city market.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy a batch of fruit at a farm so that he can sell it in the city with his brothers and mother.

loans.use: to buy a batch of fruit at a farm.

loans.name: Noé De Jesús

texts.es:
Noé de 47 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, casado su esposa realiza los oficios domésticos, son padres de 6 hijos, los 6 viven en casa 5 están estudiando.

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 30 años, lo aprendió por su padre que le inculco desde pequeño esta actividad.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar ganado para engordar y luego venderlo será satisfecha una necesidad que tendrá más ingresos para él y su familia.

Pretende que los animales que compren tengan un buen desarrollo y así a un futuro venderlos y tener más ingresos para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Noé, age 47, went to school through the sixth grade.  He is married, and his wife does the household chores.  They have six children.  All of their children live with them, and five of them go to school.

He has been a farmer for 30 years.  He learned from his parents, who taught him this business activity when he was little.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy livestock to fatten.  Later, selling the livestock will fill the need to have more income for himself and his family.  He plans for the animals that he buys to develop well.  This way when he sells them in the future he will have more income for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy livestock to fatten.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BALIMAYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 28 ans et 1 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Wobougou, commune de Kaladougou préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de produit de premières nécessités.et l’élevage de petits animaux. Les femmes du groupe BALIMAYA sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande de la clientèle elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.   La cliente SANATA la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout est analphabète. Elle est actuellement vendeuse de chèvre. Elle compte acheter 4 chèvres avec son argent au marché hebdomadaire de Dioila (lieu d’approvisionnement) chez les grossistes. Elle les nourrit pendant quelques jours, et les revend à une clientèle mixte au marché des villages environnants en espèce et parfois à crédit. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 20000 FCFA. Le bénéfice mensuel sera en partie utilisé dans les dépenses familiales et dans son activité d’élevage de petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The Balimaya group is made up of married women who have an average age of 28 and, on average, 1 child. They all live in traditional families in the village of Wobougou, in the commune of Kaladougou, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women got to know each other thanks to family and neighbourly relationships and friendships. They sell staple commodities and farm livestock. The women of the Balimaya group are on their sixth group loan. They are turning to Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to meet their customer demand. The loans will be used to buy more merchandise.

Sanata, the woman standing on the far right in the picture, is illiterate. She currently sells goats. She plans to use her loan to buy 4 goats from the wholesalers at the weekly market in Dioila, where she gets her supplies. She feeds the goats for a few days then resells them at the markets of the neighbouring villages, for cash and occasionally credit to a varied clientèle. She expects to make a monthly profit of 20 000 francs, part of which will be spent on family expenses and the rest of which will be reinvested in her livestock business.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: El Renacer Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL RENACER”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Poroy, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Belen ella es viuda y tiene 76 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras y frutas, la socia vende manzanas,naranjas,uvas,platanos y mandarinas, la socia también vende zanahorias, tomates y pepinos, la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las frutas y verduras, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas y verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas, plátanos, uvas, cebollas, zanahorias y pepinos.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cerámicas, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.




La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrowers are members of the communal bank "El Renacer" ("The Rebirth"). This bank is located in the Poroy district, part of the province of Cusco in the Department of Cusco. 

This borrower is Maria Belen. She is a widow, 76 years old with two children. She works in her business selling fruits and vegetables. She sells apples, oranges, grapes, bananas, and mandarin oranges, and she also sells carrots, tomatoes, and cucumbers. She has a stall in the market where she sells the fruits and vegetables. She works from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. She has been in this business for seven years and it is going quite well. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell fruits and vegetables. 

She is requesting this loan to buy oranges, bananas, grapes, onions, carrots, and cucumbers.

The other borrowers work in businesses selling ceramics, selling fruit, grocery stores, and selling food.

The borrower is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this medium, and commits to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas, grapes, onions, carrots, and cucumbers

loans.name: Juana Nilda

texts.es:
La señora Juana pertenece al banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
La socia Juana continua dedicándose a ejercer su carrera profesional de docente, la socia es profesora en uno de los colegios de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma que la socias saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito  para uso personal (educación de su hijo). 
La señora Juana agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the "Virgen Asunta de Oropesa" communal bank that is part of the Asociación Arariwa. She continues to work as an educator, as a professor in one of high schools in Cusco. She has spent years working as a teacher and it has gone well for her thanks to the perseverance that she puts in every day at work. Juana is responsible, because in this way she is able to move her family forward. 

Juana is requesting a loan for personal use, to send her son to school. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to fulfilling the loan installments in accordance with the payment schedule.

loans.use: pay for her child's education.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKAN est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Wobougou, commune de Kaladougou préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments, de marchandises diverses. Les femmes du groupe BENKAN sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. 
 La cliente AYIRA 1ère à gauche dans le rang des assises est actuellement vendeuse d’articles divers. Elle compte acheter 2 sacs de sucre, 1 carton de tue, et 1 carton de Lipton à Dioïla (lieu d’approvisionnement) chez les grossistes. La vente se fait à une clientèle mixte chez elle à la maison en espèce. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 40 000FCFA par mois qui sera divisé en deux : une partie sera utilisée dans les dépenses familiales et les frais de scolarité des enfants et le reste de l’argent injecté dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Benkan group is made up of married women who have an average age of 39 and, on average, 2 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Wobougou, in the commune of Kaladougou, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women got to know each other thanks to family and neighbourly relationships and friendships. They sell prepared food, condiments and various other products. The women of the Benkan group are on their sixth group loan.

Ayira, the woman sitting on the left in the picture, sells various products. She plans to use her loan to buy 2 bags of sugar, 1 box of tea and 1 box of Lipton from the wholesalers in Dioïla, where she gets her supplies. She sells her products at home to a varied clientèle for cash. She expects to make a monthly profit of 40 000 francs, which will be divided into two parts; part of it will be spent on family expenses and the children's educational expenses, and the rest of the money will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of sugar, 1 box of tea and 1 box of Lipton.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia Cirila se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia y agricultura,la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva papa y maiz y tambien  sigue vendiendo los ganados,el sueño de la socia es ampliar sus negocio de ganaderia y agricultura.La socia solicita el credito para comprar ganados.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Cirila continues her livestock and farming business. She has a plot of land where she grows potatoes and corn, and she also is still selling livestock. Cirila's dream is to expand her livestock and farming business. She is requesting this loan to buy livestock. 

Cirila is happy to receive the loan and is committed to fulfilling the loan payments.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: San Francisco De Asis Group

texts.es: Graciela de 49 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales aún dependen de ella. Lleva 4 años como cliente de Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, gelatinas y productos en variedad su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Comenzó con la idea de este negocio gracias a su vecina que le dejó a cargo un mes para que ella venda, le gustó la idea y también fué porque vió que había clientela y así comenzó poco a poco y ahora se encuentra con la idea de invertir en un negocio de compra y venta de mochilas y así poder tener más ingresos. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo, Graciela ha logrado darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Ella cubre algunos gastos de alimentación, educación, vestimenta y servicios en su hogar. Su plan para el futuro es que crezca su negocio, terminar de construir su casa y que su hijos estudien en la universidad. Ella usa el préstamo para la compra exclusiva de mochilas para emprender un nuevo negocio. Graciela pertenece a la alcancía comunal “San Francisco de Asís”, el cual está conformado por 8 personas y lleva el cargo de presidenta. La Sra. Graciela es la persona que se encuentra de pie con una polera de color negro.
texts.en:
Graciela is 49 years old and single.  She has four children who are still dependent upon her.  She has been a client of Edaprospo for four years.  She sells soft drinks, gelatin, and a variety of products.  Her business is located at her house.  She started with the idea for this business thanks to a neighbor.  The neighbor left her in charge of selling for a month.

She liked the idea, and she also saw that there were customers.  That is how she started little by little.  She now has the idea of investing in a business of buying and selling backpacks.  This way she would be able to have more income.

With effort and work, Graciela has managed to give her family a better quality of life.  She covers some of the expenses for food, education, clothing, and services for her household.  Her plan for the future is for her business to grow, to finish building her house, and for her children to attend the university.

She is using the loan to exclusively buy backpacks in order to undertake a new business.  Graciela belongs to the San Francisco de Asís communal bank.  The communal bank is comprised of eight people, and she is the president.  Graciela is the person who is standing, and she is wearing a black shirt.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Hollman Sebastian

texts.es:
Hollman de 27 años de edad, soltero, padre de dos hijos menores de edad que estudian en primaria de 9,7 años de edad. Es originaria de Carazo lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta de la compañía de sus hijos, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo estudiar, y desde muy joven trabaja para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de utensilios de cocina usados como: ollas, cucharas, sartenes, trinchastes, cazuelas, cuchillos, ollas de presión, cafeteras, espátulas, cazuelas de teflón. El dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos en un lugar establecido de su localidad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de utensilios de segunda mano, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Hollman agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener  un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Hollman is 27 years old, single, and the father of two young children who are in primary school.  They are 7 and 9 years old.  He is from Carazo, a place located in the northern area of the country.  He is known for being hardworking, responsible, and wanting self-improvement.  In his free time he enjoys the company of his children.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, he was not able to go to school and from a very young age he has worked to help with living expenses.

Thanks to his strength and his desire to get ahead in life, he makes a living selling used kitchen tools like pots, spoons, frying pans, carving knives, saucepans, knives, pressure cookers, coffee makers, spatulas, and teflon pans.  He dedicates himself to this job for eight hours a day; offering his products in a place established in town.  

The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock up his business by purchasing and selling secondhand kitchen tools so that in the not so far future he can get a greater income.  Hollman is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders have offered to people of scarce resources and poor countries, like Nicaragua, so that they have a means of honorable work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock up his business by purchasing and selling secondhand kitchen tools like pots, spoons, frying pans, carving knives, saucepans, knives, pressure cookers, coffee makers, spatulas, and teflon pans.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La socia Yanet se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de leche y quesos y tambien vende ganados,la socia los hece engordar y crecer y luegos los vende en diferentes ferias,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los quesos y leche.La socia solicita el credito para comprar ganados.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Credit group member Yanet continues to work selling milk and cheese.  She also sells cattle.  She grows and fattens them and then later sells them in different markets.  Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her cheese and milk.  She is asking for this loan to buy cattle.  She is happy to have the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
La socia Eufemia continua dedicándose al negocio de elaboración de pan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
La socia elabora los panes para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, mantequilla entre otros.
La señora Eufemia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Eufemia continues her business making bread. She has been engaged in this business for a long time, satisfying her economically and personally. Eufemia belongs to the "Virgen Asunta de Oropesa" communal bank that is part of the Asociación Arariwa. 

Eufemia makes breads to then sell to her customers who place orders. She is a responsible woman, as this is the way that she can move her family forward. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients including flour and butter. Eufemia is thankful for the loan and is committed to fulfilling her loan installments in accordance with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients including flour and butter.

loans.name: Placida

texts.es:
La socia Placida continua dedicándose al negocio de elaboración de pan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
La socia elabora los panes para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, mantequilla entre otros.
La señora Placida agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Credit group member Placida continues to work baking bread.  She has been doing this job for quite a while now.  The work gives her financial, as well as personal, benefits.  She belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” communal bank, part of Asociación Arariwa.

She bakes bread to later sell to customers who request it.  She is a responsible person, which is why she has managed to get her family ahead.

She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients such as flour and butter, among others.  

Placida expresses her thankfulness for this loan and is committed to making her payments according to the agreed-upon schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour and butter, among others.

loans.name: Sadaka

texts.en: Sadaka is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as down-to-earth and self-motivated. She operates a farm where she keeps livestock and also owns a retail business where she sells charcoal. She describes her family challenge to be lack of water storage facilities and the long distances they walk to fetch water. She will use this 6,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit 10 family members. She hopes that in the future she will venture into a butchery business. This is her third loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes such as blouses, tee-shirts, jeans, etc., for her business

loans.name: Hajraan

texts.en:
Hajraan is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of eight children. She has been running a business manufacturing "waan," which is a thread-like material used in making wooden frame bedsteads on four legs. She offers various types of "waan" in different colors and is famous in providing good quality material in her community. Hajraan operates the machine at home and makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income.

In order to inflate her sales, she needs to purchase another waan making machine. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. It will help her to produce good quality material that will help in increasing her sales and profits as well.

loans.use: to purchase another waan making machine.

loans.name: Shabanam

texts.en:
Shabanam is a 28-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for 8 years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers.

For this reason, she requested a loan of 55,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Ailas

texts.en:
Ailas is a 50-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She lives with her husband and 4 children. Her elder son has been doing a business of recycling materials for the past 12 years. His is the single source of income in her family and fulfills the needs of the entire family.

Ailas is applying for a loan from Kiva's Field Partner BRAC Pakistan because her son wants to purchase raw materials for selling recycled goods. By doing so, he will be enabled to earn maximum profit so that he can provide financial assistance to her family. She is also planning to make savings for the future that will be most beneficial for her entire family.

Ailas is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for selling recycled goods

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ganados y estos ganados producen leche,la socia vende en los diferentes ferias,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un ganado y alimentos para los ganados.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to make a living with her business selling cattle. The cattle also produce milk. The borrower sells her products in different markets and she works from 8am until 5pm. The borrower has had this business for a number of years and her dream is to expand her cattle-selling work. The borrower is applying for a loan in order to buy cattle and cattle feed.

The borrower is happy with this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy cattle and cattle-feed.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis Eduardo es un jovem estudiante de Comunicación Social, el esta solicitando un prestamo para poder pagar sus estudios, esta es su historia: Hola mi nombre es Luis Eduardo, tengo 19 años de edad, vivo con mi madre, una prima y una sobrina en la Romana  al  Este de la República  Dominicana.  No tengo relación con mi padre, desde pequeño mi madre ha sido la que me ha dado todo, ella no trabaja solo tiene un pequeño negocio en la casa de hacer helados y con eso me ha mantenido.

Decidí estudiar comunicación social en UTESA en santo domingo, debido a que siempre me gusto esa carrera ya que considero que puedo aportar mucho a la sociedad llevando informaciones correctas y positivas. Pero debido a que mi familia no cuentan con los recursos necesarios para costear el pago de la matricula ni el transporte porque me queda un poco retirado necesito una ayuda.

Solicito el préstamo porque ya mi madre ha hecho todo lo que esta a su alcance para que yo inicie la universidad pero no he podido por la falta de recursos.

Mi sueño es poder realizar mis estudios, graduarme y ser un gran profesional, alguien pueda aportar algo positivo en los medios de comunicaciones que son hoy en día tan influyentes. Mi sueño es poder ayudar a mi familia a salir adelante y más a mi madre que con muchas limitaciones pero con su gran esfuerzo me ha llevado hasta donde estoy hoy.
texts.en:
Luis is a young student of social communication. He is applying for a loan in order to pay for his studies. This is his story:

"Hi. My name is Luis Eduardo. I'm 19 years old and live with my mother, cousin and niece in Romana, in the east of the Dominican Republic. I have no contact with my father. From a young age, it has been my mother who has given me everything. She does not work and only has a small business in the house, where she makes ice cream. With this, she has supported me.

"I decided to study social communication at UTESA in Santo Domingo because I have always liked this subject and I believe that I can give society a lot by bringing it accurate and positive news. However, given that my family does not have enough money to pay for matriculation fees, or even for transport, I need some help.

"I am applying for this loan because my mother has done all that she can for me to start university but I cannot start because I do not have enough money.

"My dream is to complete my studies, graduate and be a great professional. I want to be somebody who brings something positive to the now very influential media. My dream is to be able to help my family to get ahead, especially my mother who, even with limited resources, has got me to where I am today."

loans.use: to pay matriculation fees for his studies in social communication.

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en:
Nadir is a 42-year-old man. He has a lovely family and two sons. His wife is a housewife and helps Nadir in this business. Nadir’s elder son is 16 years old and goes to 10th class. His little son is 14 years old and goes to ninth class. His family is an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) family from Fuzuli city, and now lives in Mahmudlu village of Fuzuli. 

Nadir has been in an animal-breeding business for six years. He has more calves, and Nadir makes dairy products such as cheese, yogurt, etc., from the milk. He then sells those products at a local bazaar for earning money. Today, he wants to increase his business and is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair the roof of the stall. Nadir is thankful to the Kiva organization for the help.

loans.use: to repair the roof of the stall

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-years-old single young man from Jabalia City. He lives with his family in a small house in the city. His father works as a teacher with a low income. For the past two years, Mohammad has been working in a taxi office where he organizes the work for the taxi requests. It is a good business and earns a good income. Mohammad would like to improve his work and expand it.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy wireless devices for the taxi drivers. This will facilitate their work and increase the income.

Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy wireless devices for the taxi drivers.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La socia Ruth se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes,la socia tambien se sigue dedicando a la venta de suministros de computo, la socia lo vende por catálogos los productos de belleza ofreciendo a diferentes personas o amigos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar labiz labiales, cremas y perfumes.

La socia está muy agradecida con los inversionistas por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su trabajo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Ruth continues to work at her business selling beauty products: she sells lipsticks, creams and perfumes. This borrower also continues to sell computer supplies. Ruth sells her beauty products through catalogues, selling to different people and friends. She works from 8am until 6pm. She has had the business for five years and it is going very well. Ruth's dream is to have premises where she can sell her products. Ruth is applying for this loan in order to buy lipstick, creams, and perfumes.

Ruth is very grateful to lenders for helping her to develop her work. She promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, creams, and perfumes.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is 29 years old, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She has 3 daughters and a son. Her husband is running a video game shop in the locality near their house. He has experience in this field for 10 years. He is planning to buy more video games to expand the business. Due to insufficient financial means Saima's husband is unable to buy the video games for his business. Therefore she has requested Kiva's Field Partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan.

After getting the loan her husband can purchase the video games for the video game shop. That will help increase the income and profit ratio of her husband's business. It will also be helpful for them to remove the financial problems of her family.

Saima is very grateful to Kiva's Field Partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy video games for her husband's business.

loans.name: Najla

texts.en:
Najla is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Najla is a 41-year-old married woman from Rafah city. She lives with her husband and eight kids, two sons and six daughters, in a small house in the city. Her husband works as an employee with a low income. For the past three years, Najla's husband has been working in a store where he rents sound devices for use at parties and events. It is a good business and earns a good income. Najla and her husband would like to improve and expand the business.

Therefore, Najla took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to buy a new sound system for their store. This will increase their income

loans.use: to help her and her husband to buy a new sound system for their store

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
El señor Oswaldo pertenece al  banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
El socio continua dedicándose a la elaboración de pan en una panadería del lugar, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada di a su negocio, él socio es una persona responsable, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, azúcar entre otros.
El señor Oswaldo agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Oswaldo belongs to the "Virgen Asunta de Oropesa" village bank of the Arariwa Association. The member continues working making bread in the bakery of his place. The member has been doing this business for a long time, which is going well thanks to the effort that he puts forth to his business every day. The member is a responsible person, the member desires to be able to continue working so that in this manner he can continue supporting his family.

The member is applying for a loan for the purchase of supplies like flour, sugar, among others. Oswaldo is thankful for the loan and he promises to fulfill the payment of his installments according to the payment timeline.

loans.use: to buy supplies like flour, sugar, among others.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a 35-years-old married woman from Maribojoc, Bohol. She is the mother of two children, ages 14 and 9 year old respectively. She runs a sari-sari, or variety store, selling various goods and commodities to the people in her area. Angelica is asking for a loan for her store. She is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks, canned goods and other dry goods. This will improve the inventory of her store, as well as cater her customers' needs.

Angelica hopes to expand her business and make it a success for the welfare of her children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods and other dry goods.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 46 years old and she is from Nakuru. She is married to James and they are blessed with two children, aged 14 and 2 years old.

Esther is a farmer and has been working in this occupation for the last 24 years. She has applied for her first loan of KES 12,500 from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy a water storage tank. Esther believes that after she has purchased a water storage tank she will be able to collect rain water and, therefore, the time she has been spending going to the river to fetch water can be used working on her farm for more yield and greater profits.

Right now Esther's monthly income is KES 5,000 and she hopes that this income will increase. In the future, she hopes to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: To buy a water storage tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale for his work as a Community Knowledge Worker

loans.name: Yony

texts.es:
La socia Yony se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboracion de artesania como muñecas,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender las muñecas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar materiales para hacer las muñecas como telas,hilos y tijeras.

La socia se siente agradecida por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member Yony continues dedicating herself to the business of making artisan crafts like dolls. The member already has many years' experience in this business. The member works from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM. The member's dream is to have a shop where she can sell the dolls. The member is applying for the loan to buy materials to make the dolls like fabric, thread and scissors.

The member feels thankful for the loan granted and promises to fulfill her established payment installments.

loans.use: to buy materials like fabric, thread and scissors to make dolls.

loans.name: Los Siervos De Jesús Group

texts.es:
Lili de 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de edades de 16, 13 y 7 años, de los cuales aún depende de ella. Lleva 9 años como cliente de Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de Abarrotes. Comenzó por medio de la motivación de su hermana que tenía el negocio; antes ayudaba a una amiga con el negocio de repostería pero era más complicado ahora se siente mejor contar con un negocio propio ya que ella lo administra.

Con su esfuerzo y trabajo, Lili ha logrado darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Ella cubre algunos gastos como alimentación, educación, vestimenta. Su plan para el futuro es hacer crecer su negocio y el plan en el ámbito familiar es que sus hijos terminen el colegio y se conviertan en  profesionales. Ella usa el préstamo para la compra de Abarrotes en general. Lili pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Los Siervos de Jesús”, el cual está conformado por 6 personas y lleva el cargo de presidenta. La Sra. Lili es la persona que se encuentra de pie al costado de las otras señoras.
texts.en:
Lili, 40, is married and has 3 children, ages 16, 13 and 7, two of whom still depend on her. She has been a client of Edaprospo for 9 years and she makes her living selling groceries. She started because of the motivation of her sister who had the business; before, she helped a friend with the business of confections but it was more complicated. Now, she feels better having her own business that she administers.

With strength and work, Lili has achieved giving a better quality of life to her family. She covers some expenses like food, education, clothing. Her plan for the future is to make her business grow and the plan at the family level is that her children finish school and they become professionals. She will use the loan for the purchase of general groceries. Lili belongs to the "Los Siervos de Jesús" communal bank, which is made up of 6 people and she has the position of president.

Lili is the person who is found standing alongside the other women.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Lonkisa

texts.en:
Lonkisa is 46 years old, married to Naipanoi, and the father of seven children. For the last six years, he has farmed his own piece of land and earns a good income. Wheat has proven to do well in his area due to good climatic conditions.

Lonkisa learned about Vision Fund Kenya through posters. This will be his sixth loan. He plans to buy farm inputs and hire machinery for spraying the wheat with pesticides. With the profits he hopes to make as a result of this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

Lonkisa's dreams are to buy a bigger piece of land, plant more wheat for commercial farming, buy his own farm machinery, and educate his children. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and hire machinery for spraying his crops with pesticides

loans.name: Kuyioni

texts.en:
Kuyioni is 38 years old, married, and blessed with five children who are between the ages of 3 and 17. He is a livestock trader in Narok county, Kenya, and has been running his business for the past four years earning a monthly income of KES 30,000.

Kuyioni has borrowed his fourth loan of KES 100,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which he intends to use to purchase more livestock for resale. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost business. His future dreams is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale

loans.name: Benso Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENSO est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Wobougou, commune de Kaladougou préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments et de légumes frais. Les femmes du groupe BENSO sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énormes de la clientèle elles font recours a SORO YIRIWASO. Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées. 
 La cliente DJELIKA personne à assise au milieu n’a pas été à l’école. Elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiment chose qu’elle a hérite de sa grande mère. Elle compte acheter 10 paquets de jumbo, 20 kg de de noix de néré, un sac d’arachide au marché hebdomadaire de Dioïla (lieu d’approvisionnement) chez les grossistes. La vente se fait à une clientèle mixte au marché du village et chez elle à la maison en espèce et parfois en crédit. Cependant, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 5 000FCFA par semaine soit 20 000FCFA par mois qui sera divisé en deux : une partie sera utilisée dans les dépenses familiales et le reste est injecté dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Benso group is composed of married women averaging 39 years of age, with two children. They all live in traditional families in the Wobougou region, Kaladougo municipality, Diola prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of Mali).

They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell condiments and fresh vegetables. The group members are on their sixth solidarity loan. With the goal to meet the huge customer demand, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso. The funds will be used to buy the merchandise mentioned earlier. Our client Djelika, the one seated in the middle, did not attend school. She currently works as a condiment vendor, a trade she inherited from her grandmother. She is going to buy 10 packs of Jumbo cubes, 20 kg of néré [locust bean] seeds, and a bag of peanuts from wholesalers at the weekly market of Diola (where she stocks up). She sells to a mixed clientele at the village market and out of her home, for cash and sometimes on credit. However, she plans to earn an income of 5,000 West African francs per week, that is, 20,000 West African francs per month, which will be divided into two parts: one part will be used for household expenses and the other  reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Simeona

texts.es:
La socia Simeona  continua dedicándose al negocio de elaboración de pan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio, la socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
La socia elabora los panes para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, azúcar entre otros.
La señora Simeona agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: The partner Simeona continues working in the business of making bread. She has been working in the business for awhile which has gone well for her thanks to the determination she applies every day in her work. She belongs to the communal bank “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa,” of the Asociación Arariwa. She prepares breads to then sell to customers who request them. She is a responsible person, and she desires to be able to continue working in this way, to continue supporting her family. She is requesting the loan to buy supplies like flour and sugar, among other things. Simeona appreciates the loan and promises to make the payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies like flour and sugar, among other things.

loans.name: Anuarite Group

texts.fr: La cliente Pascasiya est une commerçante, secrétaire et membre d’un collectif d’affaires « Anuarite », junior entrepreneur, âgée de 22 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 2 étudient et 2 autres sont encore gamins. La cliente est une vendeuse des divers matériels d’ustensile de cuisine. Elle étale sa marchandise sur la route principale de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu comme prêt de l’IMF  Hekima. Son conjoint est un technicien maçon. Il y a 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 10 casseroles métalliques neuves. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique poste conflits à l’Est du pays. Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente porte au dos son bébé.
texts.en:
Pascasiya, age 22, is a junior entrepreneur and a merchant. She's a member and the secretary of Anuarite Group. She's married and the mother of four children. Two of them attend school, whereas the other two are still very young.

She sells various kinds of kitchenware. She displays her products on the side of the main road of the city. She started her business with funds loaned to her by Kiva's partner, the MFI Hekima. Her husband is a mason technician.

She's been running this business for four years. This new loan will be used to buy 10 new metallic pots. She wishes to increase her working capital, provide clothes and food to her children, and send them to school. 

In the end, she strongly thanks Hekima for its contribution to making women entrepreneurs who are excluded from traditional banks self-supporting, especially at this critical post-war time in the East of the country.

It has to be noted that one of the members is carrying her child on her back.

loans.use: to buy 10 new metallic pots

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is a 54-year-old married woman from Albur, Bohol. She has three grown children. She works in a food vending business, selling snack foods like puto (rice cake), banana cue (fried banana with a caramelized sugar coating), and ice candy to the nearby school in her community.

Due to a lack of capital needed to continue her business, Angeles is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as sugar, milk, cooking oil, cellophane, candies, biscuits, and other dry goods. This would help Angeles improve her income, purchase food, and set aside some of the savings for future use. 

Angeles hopes to expand her business and for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sugar, milk, cooking oil, cellophane, candies, biscuits, and other dry goods

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 48 years old and she is from Nakuru. She is married to Francis and they are blessed with two children, aged 28 and 14 years old.

Ruth is a farmer with a business she has been running for the last fourteen years. She has applied for her first loan of KES 33,400 from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy a water storage tank for water collection during the rainy seasons. This will give her ample time to work on her farm for greater crop yields and profits.

Ruth's monthly income right now is KES 15,000. She plans to use the profits realized from her expanded business to pay back her loan to VisionFund Kenya and to educate one of her children who is still in school. In the future, she hopes to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: To buy a water storage tank

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a farmer from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of two children, ages 9 and 8. She has been farming for more than 9 years now. This is the sole source of her income.
Arlene is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, which will  augment her yield and income. In the future, Arlene hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Faraja Group

texts.fr: La cliente Esther est une commerçante, conseillère et membre  du groupe d’affaires « Faraja», junior entrepreneur, âgée de 22 ans, mariée. La cliente est une vendeuse des divers articles d’habillement. elle étale sa marchandise dans un magasin dans une avenue de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec  le fonds reçu  de son mari. Son conjoint est un taximan de motocycle. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 3 ans qu’il exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter un lot de marchandises. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, construire une maison, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif,  il remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des hommes et femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique, post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Esther is a junior entrepreneur and a merchant. She's a member and counselor of Faraja Group. She's 22 years old and married. She sells various kinds of clothes. She displays her products in a shop on one of her city's avenues.

She started her business with funds received from her husband, a motorcycle taxi driver. Later on, she obtained a loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Hekima, 

She's been running this business for the past three years. This new loan will be used to buy a batch of clothes. Thus, she wishes to increase her working capital, build a house, provide clothes and food to her children, and send them to school.

In the end, she strongly thanks Hekima for its contribution to making men and women entrepreneurs who are excluded from traditional banks self-supporting, especially at this critical post-war time in the East of the country.

loans.use: to buy a batch of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery products such as rice, sugar, drinks, and others.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is a married man, aged 38 years, and he supports a family of four members. He has three children, ages 13, 11, and 7 years old.  Maurice sells cereals and has been in operation over a period of five years, earning an income of KES 15,000.

With his sixth loan of KES 100,000 from VisionFund Kenya, Maurice intends to add more stock of cereals for resale. With the profits he earns, he wishes to repay the loan and to reinvest the remaining amount in his business.

His dream is to excel in his business.

loans.use: To purchase varieties of dry cereals for resale

loans.name: Annelyn

texts.en:
Annelyn is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of two young children. Annelyn helps her husband in tilling their farm.

Annelyn is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm. With fertilizer, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus improving her crop yield and augmenting her income.

In the future, Annelyn hopes to make her business a success. She also wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
Elpedia is a married woman and the mother of five children. She is from Bien Unido, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari, or retail shop, in her town selling various goods and items to the people who live nearby. 
Elpedia is asking for a loan to buy more products to sell, like canned goods, candies, soda and other beverages, soap, and shampoo. With this, she will be able to attract more customers to her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell, like canned goods, candies, beverages, soap, and shampoo.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has four young children to support. She and her husband work together in their aluminum fabrication and glass installation business. Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy additional materials like glass, steel, and aluminum. With this, they will be able to accept more orders and this way increasing their income.

In the future, Jocelyn hopes expand their services and products and make their business more successful.

loans.use: to buy glass, steel, and aluminum.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio is a 47-year-old married man from Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a fisherman and has been in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. 
Florencio is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks. Through this, he will be able to improve his catch, resulting in more fish to sell at the market. Florencio hopes to make his fishing business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the school expenses of his son.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and hooks.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
La socia Maximiliana se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboracion y venta de pan,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de elaboracion y venta de pan.La sovcia solicita el credito para comprar insumos para elaborar el pan como harina,mantequilla y azucar.

La señora Maximiliana agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Maximiliana continues to work in her business making and selling bread.  She works from 8am to 5pm.  Through this business, she wants to get ahead.  Her dream is to expand her bread making and selling business.  

She is seeking a loan to purchase supplies to make bread such as flour, butter and sugar.  Maximiliana is grateful for the loan and she is committed to complying with the payment schedule.

loans.use: purchase bread making supplies like flour, butter and sugar.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia Marleni se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboración y venta de pan, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de elaboración y venta de pan. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para elaborar el pan como harina, mantequilla y azúcar. 

La señora Marleni agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Marleni continues to work in her business making and selling bread.  She works from 8am to 5pm.  Through her business, she hopes to get ahead.  Her dream is to expand her business of making and selling bread.

She is seeking a loan to purchase supplies to make bread such as flour, butter and sugar.  Marleni is grateful for the loan and she is committed to complying with the payment schedule.

loans.use: purchase supplies to make bread like flour, butter and sugar.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
