La socia Ana se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.

La señora Ana agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Ana continues to work in her business selling and raising animals.  She raises guinea pigs and hens.  When she raises them and fattens them up, she then sells them in different fairs.  Through this small business, she pushes her children ahead.  Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her guinea pigs and hens.  

She is seeking this loan to purchase guinea pigs, hens, and feed for guinea pigs and hens.  Ana is grateful for the loan and is committed to complying with the payment schedule.

loans.use: purchase guinea pigs, hens, and feed for guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de SOMPIYA  commune de Wacoro
préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments, de tubercules, d’animaux, de savon artisanal (gabakourouni) etc. Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire. 
 La cliente SOUMBA la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite. Elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments, chose qu’elle a hérite de sa mère. Elle compte acheter 10kg d’oignon, 2 paquets de jumbo et 5kg de noix de néré à Dioïla (lieu d’approvisionnement). La vente se fait à une clientèle mixte au marché du village et chez elle à la maison en espèce. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10000FCFA, qui sera utilisé dans l’élevage de chèvres.
texts.en:
The group DANAYA is composed of married women, who average 41 years of age and two children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of SOMPIYA, in Commune de Wacoro, Préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in condiments, tubers, animals, artisanal soaps (gabakourouni), etc.  The women of the group DANAYA are on their third solidarity loan. 

This client, SOUMBA, the second person standing at the right, is uneducated. She is currently a vendor of condiments, a business passed down to her from her mother. She intends to purchase 10 kg of onions, 2 packets of Jumbo, and 5 kg of néré nuts, in Dioïla (where supplies are gotten). Sales are made in cash to a mixed customer base at the village market and at her house. She plans on making a monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will be used to raise goats.

loans.use: to purchase condiments to sell

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: La socia Clara continua con su negocio de venta y crianza de animales y tambien tiene una libreria donde vende lapiceros,cuadernos,borradores,folders entre otros uitles escolares, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
texts.en:
Clara continues to work in her business selling and raising animals.  She also has a bookstore where she sells pens, notebooks, erasers, folders, and other school supplies.  She raises the guinea pigs and hens, makes them grow and fatten up, and then sells them in different fairs.  Through this small business, she is able to push her children ahead.  Her dream is to have a store where she can sell the guinea pigs and hens.

She is seeking a loan to purchase guinea pigs, hens and feed for guinea pigs and hens.

loans.use: purchase guinea pigs, hens, and feed for guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells onions and other groceries. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy cement, sand, and other materials to build a latrine. Her challenge is paying school fees for her three children. She hopes that in the future, she will own rental houses. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and other materials to build a latrine

loans.name: Rusi

texts.en: Rusi is a 49-year-old woman. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells bags and ropes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a favorable place, and her primary customers are small-scale customers. She describes her family's biggest challenge to be insufficient water supply. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy a water storage facility and add more inventory of bags, ropes, etc. to her business. The water tank will enable her family to store clean water for domestic use. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water storage facility and inventory of bags and ropes

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman from the municipality of Talibon in Bohol. This is a place where the crab-catching business thrives. She and her husband catch fresh crabs and sell them at the market and in her community. She has been in this business for almost 20 years. This business supports the needs of her family, which includes eight children ages 11 to 26. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000 in order to buy the rope and screen necessary for catching crabs.  
In the future, Gemma would like send her children to college and will strive harder to expand her business for them.

loans.use: to buy rope and screen for crab fishing.

loans.name: Joseah

texts.en: Joseah is a married man. He has four children between the ages of 1 and 10. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a farm where he grows tea. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a favorable place and his primary customers are small scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low returns and delayed payments. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a water storage facility and buy more tea leaves for resale. The water storage facility will enable his family to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water storage facility and buy more tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos que viven con ella en su vivienda propia hecha a base de madera. Elisa se dedica a la agricultura en su terreno de dos hectáreas que adquirió como resultado de muchos años de trabajo y donde posee actualmente una gran variedad de plantas rentables como cacao orgánico, café, barbasco; entre otros. Se inició en esta labor hace mas de 22 años con el apoyo de su esposo y motivada por el deber de madre que tiene con sus hijos. Es una labor que le agrada mucho porque vivió en el campo desde muy niña aprendiendo este oficio que le inculcaban sus padres y abuelos logrando hasta hoy convertirlo en su principal sustento económico. Se caracteriza por ser una agricultora muy empeñosa y por ello lleva sus respectivas campañas productivas con mucho esmero, no obstante es necesario contar con capital de trabajo que suele invertir en la contrata de trabajadores del lugar y compra de abono orgánico. Este es su sexto préstamo con Kiva y se siente muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de madera y calaminas para mejorar su vivienda donde comparte sus vivencias familiares.
texts.en:
Elisa is 38 years old, is married and has four children who live with her in the wood house that she owns.  Elisa works in agriculture on the two hectare lot that she acquired after many years of work.  At the moment, she has a large variety of profitable plants there such as" organic cacao, organic coffee, barbasco, and others.  She started this work 22 years ago with the support of her husband and the motivation of being a mother to her children.  She enjoys her work because she lived in the countryside since she was a little girl, and learned the trade from her parents and grandparents who to this day have made it their primary source of income.

She is known to be an earnest farmer and therefore she leads her production campaigns with a lot of care.  However, it is necessary to have working capital to invest in contracting local workers and purchase manure.  

This is her sixth loan with Kiva and she is very happy for the financial support that she has received to continue moving forward.  She is also committed to paying back the loan on time.  She hopes to get 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase wood and corrugated roofing to repair the home that she shares with her family.

loans.use: purchase wood and corrugate roofing to repair her home.

loans.name: Johanna Elvira

texts.es:
Hola, ella es Johanna  Elvira, quien es una niña emprendedora y juiciosa,  a su corta edad tiene un sueño y es el de pertenecer al mundo de la investigación, le gusta mucho todo lo relacionado con la investigación criminal, Pero desafortunada mente los sueños están muy difíciles de realizar por cuestión económica, a la mama le gustaría mucho ayudarle a realizar ese proyecto de vida, pero para la mama le queda muy complicado económicamente. 
Johanna de manera amable quiere  pedirle  que la ayuden por medio del  subsidio con  kiva, para que pueda  terminar ese ultimo semestre que le falta en Campo Alto.
texts.en:
Hello, this is Johanna  Elvira who is a enterprising and prudent youth. At her young age she has a dream and that is to belong to the world of investigations. She really likes anything to do with criminal investigations.

Unfortunately sometimes dreams are very hard to realize because of economics. Her mother wants to help her with this project for her life, but it is very difficult financially for her to do this. So Johanna in a polite way is requesting help through a loan from Kiva, so that she can finish this last semester she has at Campo Alto.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 31 years old  and has one child. She is from the community of Dauis in Bohol. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store business and plans to start a food selling business. 

Sheila is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy purified water, cooking oil, and sugar and to pay for school fees of her child. She hopes to give her child a better future.

loans.use: to purchase purified water, cooking oil, and sugar and pay for school fees

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be obedient. She operates a retail business where she sells tea leaves. She describes her family challenge to be a lack of water harvesting facilities. 

She will use the KES 37,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. 

She hopes that in the future, she will get other beneficial products from SMEP. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is from Dauis, Bohol. She is married with two adult children. Leonila has been engaged in a food vending business for five years now. She usually sells banana cues (deep fried banana in caramelized sugar), pancakes and juice drinks. She is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar and cooking oil. 

The income generated helps to buy food and pay for household bills.

In the future, she hopes to make a success with other business options.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 39-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three children, ages 10-15. She is engaged in a buy-and-sell business. She sells items like mats, blankets, pots and plastic wares. She has been in this buy-and-sell business for five years now. 

Vilma requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy more blankets, mats and plastic wares to attract more customers.  

In the future, Vilma would like to expand her buy-and-sell business to provide her family with a better life and education for her children.

loans.use: to buy blankets, mats and plastic wares.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia, la socia cría a sus animales para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan y a la vez venderlos a en las distintas ferias que se realizan, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio.
La socia solicita el crédito para el arreglo de su establo y la compra de alimentos para sus animales.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Sabina continues in the business of raising livestock. She raises animals to later sell them to her clients that request them and at the same time sells them in the different markets that are held. Sabina has been in this business for many years and things are going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. Sabina is requesting a loan to repair her stables and to buy feed for her animals. She is happy to have the loan and promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to repair her stables and buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Matthew

texts.en:
Matthew is a  Kiva borrower. He has one child. He describes himself to be focused and determined. He operates a restaurant where he sells cooked food. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are of all types. 

Matthew describes his biggest business challenge to be high economic costs. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy a water storage facility to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit three family members. His business goal is to excel within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of Kes 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water storage facility

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a fish vendor from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and has three children ages 13, 11 and 8. She also operates a sari-sari or variety store.

Hilda is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell and additional stock for her store such as canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and additional stock for her store such as canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a 60-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has four children, and her youngest is 18 years old. She works in her rice field for a living. She grows and sells rice to earn a living. She has been growing rice for more than ten years. 

To sustain her farming activity, Paulina requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy fertilizers to improve her harvest and yield. 

She hopes that in the future, she can continue farming, while also saving for her future needs. She is determined to make her business a success so she can enjoy her golden years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a married man. He has two children ages two years and six years. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a conducive area and his primary customers are small-scale customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations and high fuel prices. 

Josphat will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water storage facility and buy spare parts for his motorcycle. His business goal is to be successful within five years.The water storage facility will enable his family to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility and buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Finike

texts.en:
Finike is a 29-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be self-reliant. She operates a food stall where she sells cooked food. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are of all types. 

Finike describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water storage facility and add to her stock of ingredients for preparing food for sale in her stall. The water storage facility will enable her family to store clean water for domestic use. Her business goal is to be self supporting within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility and add stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 42-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be confident. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a favorable place and her primary customers are small-scale customers. 

Gladys describes her biggest business challenges to be small-scale returns and price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy a water storage facility and add stock of cereals.The water storage facility will enable her family to store clean water for domestic use. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility and add to her stock of cereals

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es: Fabiola tiene 39 años; es madre soltera de 2 hijos y vive en una casa hecha de madera en calidad de alquiler. Fabiola tiene una tienda dedicada a la venta de productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, huevos; entre otros.Lleva más de 7 años con su negocio y comenta que se inició motivada por buscar un ingreso fijo para mantenerse económicamente ya que no contaba con un oficio estable. Es una labor que considera algo moderada ya que desde muy temprano recibe la visita de sus clientes quienes la consideran una persona muy carismática y alegre. Le gusta mantener su negocio bien abastecido porque le beneficia en mantener la afluencia de clientes. Además de dedicarse a la venta de víveres realiza también la venta de bebidas heladas como chica morada y gaseosas. Es el tercer préstamo que solicita con Kiva y espera contar con la confianza necesaria para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para surtir su negocio con gaseosas y otras bebidas que planea adquirirlas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Fabiola is 39 years old. She is a single mother of two children and lives in a house she rents, made out of wood. Fabiola has a store where she sells food items like rice, sugar, eggs, etc. She has had this business for more than 7 years and started it looking for a stable income to support herself economically as she had no steady work. 

This is relatively easy work as from early in the day she receives visits from clients who consider her a charismatic and happy person. She likes to keep her store well-stocked as it is beneficial in maintaining the influx of customers.  Besides selling food she also sells cold drinks like "chica morada" ( a sweet drink made form purple corn) and soft drinks. 

This is her 3rd loan from Kiva and she hopes to have the confidence to carry on. She promises to pay her installments in a timely fashion. At this time she is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN to stock her business with soft drinks and other drinks that she plans to buy wholesale.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and other drinks.

loans.name: Casimera

texts.en:
Casimera is 59 years old and from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with four children. Most of her children are grown. She has supported her family by fishing and farming seaweed for 24 years now. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fishnet and seaweed seedlings so she can continue her business. She is determined to make her business profitable so she can support her family.

In the future, she hopes to expand her businesses and see her children having a good life, too.

loans.use: to buy fish net and seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah is a 42-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells onions, tomatoes and other food items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are small-scale customers. 

Hadijah describes her biggest business challenge to be low sales during the dry season. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water storage facility and add to her stock of grocery items. The water storage facility will enable her family to store clean water for domestic use. Her business goal is to be a food supplier in the market within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility and add to her stock of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a hard-working woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two adult children. 

Janeth has been engaged in manicure and pedicure services for ten years now. Her friends and neighbors are her usual customers. In addition to that, she also sells trendy clothing in her place. She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more nail polish, cuticle remover, and nail nippers. 

In the future, Janeth would like to expand both her businesses in order to save for the future.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, cuticle remover, and nail nippers.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a convenient place and her primary customers are of all types. 

Martha describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient funds. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a water tank and add to her stock of clothes. The water tank will enable her family to store clean water for domestic use. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water tank and add to her stock of clothes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 33-years-old, from Naivasha and is married. They have three children aged between 14-years-old and two-years-old.

Mary is a fruit vendor and has been in the business for many years and has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her buy more tomatoes, bananas and onions to add to her stock. She is optimistic that her business will do better after the loan.

She hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, bananas and onions

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a 53-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has been engaged in a basket weaving business for more than 20 years now. This is her main source of income. 

Basket weaving is a common way of earning a living in her place. They use bamboo, "buri" or native palm to make baskets. Celsa is asking for a loan to buy materials for basket weaving such as buri, wicker and straw. With this, she will be able to produce more baskets when the materials needed are available. 

In the future, she hopes to have another source of income and save for future use.

loans.use: to buy buri, wicker and straw

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de SOMPIYA  commune de Wacoro
préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales,  de condiments, de tubercules, et des articles divers. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire. Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées. 
Pour des raisons sociales, la cliente GNANDJOUGOU la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite. Elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments, chose qu’elle a hérité de sa mère. Elle compte acheter 20kg d’oignon, 6 paquets de jumbo et 10kg de gombo en poudre au marché hebdomadaire (lieu d’approvisionnement). La vente se fait à une clientèle mixte au marché du village et chez elle en espèce. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 75 00FCFA. Ce bénéfice mensuel sera utilisé dans la même activité.
texts.en:
The group BENKADI is composed of married women, who average 37 years of age and three children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of SOMPIYA, in Commune de Wacoro, Préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in grains, condiments, tubers, and general merchandise.  The women of the group BENKADI are on their third solidarity loan. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise, as cited above.

For societal reasons, this client, SOUMBA, the first person standing at the left, is uneducated. She is currently a vendor of condiments, a business passed down to her from her mother. She intends to purchase 20 kg of onions, 6 packets of Jumbo, and 10 kg of powdered okra at the weekly market (where supplies are gotten). Sales are made in cash to a mixed customer base at the village market and at her home. She plans on making a monthly profit of 7,500 francs CFA that will be used in same business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman and a mother of four children from San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in lumber and timber sales. She also has a chainsaw services business.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy a new chainsaw. With this, she will be able to improve her business thus augmenting her income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new chainsaw

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a repeat borrower, age 38, and a resident of Butinde Kinoni, Ntungamo district. He is married with five children who all go the school; he is also responsible for meeting their basic needs.

He applied for a loan of 3,000,000 shs to improve and increase his farming business. He has a pig business and wants to buy more pigs and hire more labor for pruning, weeding, and mulching his banana plantation. In the photograph is a client (center), a credit officer and his wife at his banana and coffee plantation.

loans.use: To buy pigs and hire labour

loans.name: Lungujja Kwekulakulanya Group

texts.en:
Florence, aged 35, is a married resident of Lungujja- a surbub in the city outskirts with four children. She has a very big responsibility of taking care of her children by providing them with good education, shelter, clothing and medical care, since her husband is jobless.

She operates a small restaurant along the road and this is where she has earned a living that has sustained her family. She has been in this business for two years and has a dream of expanding it into a bigger restaurant.
 
Florence’s major challenge is lack of enough capital to purchase more utensils and chairs for use in her restaurant. With the loan, however, the challenge will soon be history. Florence's neighbors commented that she is hardworking and dedicated.
She thanks the group members and UGAFODE for standing by her side.

loans.use: To buy restaurant items such as utensils and chairs.

loans.name: Danson

texts.en: Danson is a repeat client of Ugafode Microfinance who has previously applied for two loans of UGX.1,000,000. He runs a small retail shop in Mbarara town and has been doing this for more than five years. Edson is a hard working man who has managed to save money from his sales, which has enabled him to acquire a small piece of land in Mbarara town and in which he has constructed rentals. The purpose of the loan is to restock his business and renovate his rentals. He hopes he will be able to make more money from them if they are in good condition.

loans.use: To renovate his rentals and restock his business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de KOROBA, commune de WACORO préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, condiments savons, coutures, et article divers. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
La cliente ROKIA la première à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises est analphabète. Elle est actuellement vendeuse de grains d’arachide  et compte acheter 2 sacs d’arachide non décortiqués avec les paysans sur place au village qui seront ensuite décortiqués pour être vendus. La vente se fait à une clientèle mixte au marché du village et chez elle à la maison en espèce. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 12 500FCFA.qui sera divisé en deux: une partie sera utilisée dans l’élevage de petits ruminants et le reste de l’argent injecté dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group BENKADI is composed of married women, who average 38 years of age and four children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of KOROBA, in Commune de Wacoro, Préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains, condiments, soaps, clothing, and general merchandise.  The women of the group BENKADI are on their first solidarity loan. 

This client, ROKIA, the first person sitting at the left, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of whole peanuts and intends to purchase 2 sacks of unshelled peanuts from local peasant farmers in the village. The peanuts will then be shelled and sold. Sales are made in cash to a mixed customer base at the village market and at her home. She plans on making a monthly profit of 12,500 francs CFA that will be split in two: part for raising small ruminants, and the rest as money to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts to sell

loans.name: Rolandi

texts.en: Rolandi is a repeat borrower located in Rwensinga Rukanga Nyabihoko, Ntungamo district and has applied for loan of 1,300,000 UGX.  He wants to use the money to improve his coffee plantation through mulching it; he has a challenge of low productivity within his farming businesses due to poor farming methods.  His prime target is to yield high output from his plantations, and to take his children to better schools in the country.  He is limited by capital and funds to enable him to achieve his dreams.  With this loan he believes his production will improve and his lifestyle will change in the society.  Pictured is Rolandi with the UGAFODE credit officer(right to left)

loans.use: To buy mulch

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a 28-year-old man from Nakuru and very hardworking. He is married to Teresia and they are blessed with two children aged three and seven years. 

He operates as a photographer. He has been in the business for four years and earns a monthly income of KES 3,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES. 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use his loan to expand his film business by buying more quality digital cameras . He plans to use his monthly income to pay his loan, educate his children and expand his business. In the future he hopes to expand his business in other towns.

loans.use: to buy more quality digital  cameras

loans.name: Sekola Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SEKOLA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Wobougou, commune de Kaladougou préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de chaussures, de vêtements, de tasses etc. Les femmes du groupe SEKOLA sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire et dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de la clientèle elles font toujours recours à SORO YIRIWASO. Les montants empruntés seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente SALIMATA la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises est analphabète. Elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter 20 paquets de jumbo, 50 kg oignons, 20 kg de de noix de néré, 50kg de dah à Dioïla (lieu d’approvisionnement chez les grossistes. La vente se fait à une clientèle mixte au marché du village et chez elle à la maison en espèce. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 30 000FCFA par mois qui sera divisé en deux : une partie sera utilisée pour les dépenses familiales et les frais de scolarité des enfants et le reste de l’argent injecté dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group SEKOLA is composed of married women, who average 40 years of age and three children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Wobougou, in Commune de Kaladougou, Préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, shoes, clothing, basins, etc.  

The women of the group SEKOLA are on their sixth solidarity loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous customer demand, they always turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The funds borrowed will be used to purchase their goods, as cited above.

This client, SALIMATA, the second person sitting at the right, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of condiments. She intends to purchase 20 packets of Jumbo, 50 kg of néré nuts, 50 kg of dah [dried hibiscus flowers], in Dioïla (where supplies are gotten from wholesalers). Sales are made in cash to a mixed customer base at the village market and at her home. She plans on making a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be split in two: part for covering family expenses and the children's schooling costs, and the rest for reinvesting in her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Honest Group Ishaka

texts.en:
Justine is a member of the Honest Group and is a business woman aged 48-years-old who deals in shoes and clothes. She is a market vendor and this is her major source of income. She started doing business in the year 1999 and is happy that the business has rewarded her to some extent since she gets profits from it and she is able to cater to the needs of her family. 

Justine is a mother of six children and they are all still in school. She is a resident of a cell in Ishaka and that is where her business is located, though she also goes to some markets outside Ishaka. She started the business with the main objective of generating income and making profits so that she can give her children a quality education.  She is hopeful she will attain this if she gets a loan and buys more stock, which she will sell at a profit. Her clients are people from around and far from Ishaka since she moves to different markets. Justine hopes to give her children the best education and to expand her business to make more profits, part of which she will put back in the business and she believes that the business will grow and she will end up setting up a super market. She is mainly challenged by transportation costs which are high, but she believes that this will be no more if the business grows. She and the group members are greatful to the kiva lenders for thr great job being done.

loans.use: To buy shoes for sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 32 years old and a resident of Mutungo, a Kampala suburb. He is single, though he takes care of his siblings. He is a videographer, a business he started in 2011 with an aim of stimulating his daily income and being able to meet his needs and those of his siblings. Emmanuel wants a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to purchase better equipment for his business - that is to say, a computer set that will help him to record music and videos. His customers are the video halls and people from various areas who enjoy watching movies. However, he faces a challenge of inadequate capital, and many competitors. Emmanuel is such a focused man, and always works towards achieving all his goals if he gets enough capital.

loans.use: To purchase a computer set.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is a 30-year-old married man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is the sole provider of the family. He is a driver, earning a low salary. He said he faces a difficult situation because his income is not enough to cover his family's needs. He has a small house and he is well known in his surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.

Salah intends to renovate his house. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 YER from Al-Amal, with which to buy construction supplies. He will use these supplies for renovating his house. He believes that this loan will positively improve his life. He hopes to be able to provide for his family’s needs and to provide them with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for renovating his house.

loans.name: Expedito

texts.en:
Expedito, aged 31 years old, is a driver on the Kagadi to Kampala route. He is not married and has no children. Besides being in public transport, he is involved in buying and selling of agricultural produce, such as maize and groundnuts.

He has approached Ugafode for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to invest in his business of produce so that he can earn more profits. This being harvest season, the produce is cheap.

He dreams of having a family which he can maintain very well, and also complete his house that is located in Kagadi town.

He describes himself as a hardworking person who is honest, and also indicates that his main challenges are competition and seasonality of the business he is involved in.

loans.use: to buy agricultural produce.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe, 44 years old, is from Nakuru. He is married to Alice and they are blessed with three children who are fifteen, eight, and six years old.

He is in the business of selling cakes and buns, which he has been doing for the last 20 years. To enable him to buy some baking flour, sugar and cooking fat to use in the preparation of cakes and buns, he has applied for his second loan of KES. 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is KES. 10,000 and he has plans to use the profits anticipated from his expanded business to pay back his loan to VisionFund Kenya, educate his children and start a business for his spouse. In the future, Wycliffe hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more baking ingredients

loans.name: Odina

texts.ru:
Одина является дехканином и трактористом, проживающим в районе Восеъ. У него среднее техническое образование. Ему 59 лет. Одина примерный муж, отец пятерых детей, и дедушка. Его жена находится на пенсии, а старший сын предоставляет услуги мастера строителя. 
Сам Одина многие лет работал трактористом, и по ходу дела изучил как выращивать сельскохозяйственные культуры. Пять лет назад он сам начал выращивать и у него хорошо получается. Кроме того, ему помогают жена и дети. Одина на счет кредита собирается приобрести минеральные удобрения, семена, топливо, и провести посевные работы. Он хочет получить качественный урожай и поэтому надеется на вашу финансовую помощь.
texts.en:
Odina is a collective farmer and tractor driver, residing in the Vose region. He has a secondary technical education. He is 59 years old. Odina is an exemplary husband, the father of five children, and a grandfather. His wife is retired, and his eldest son provide services as a master building.

Odina worked for many years as a tractor driver, and in the process learned how to grow crops. Five years ago, he himself started to grow and he was good at it. In addition, he is helped by his wife and children. With the loan, Odina intends to purchase mineral fertilizers, seeds, fuel, and to conduct the planting work. He wants to receive a quality harvest and therefore needs financial help.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer, and fuel

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 43-year-old woman. She has 7 children and describes herself to be creative.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and she has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to add stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that she will improve her living standards in the future.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes

loans.name: Siguidiale Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SIGIUDIALE est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de KOROBA, commune de WACORO préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales, de tubercules, d'arachide et divers articles. Les femmes du groupe SIGUIDIALE sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de la clientèle elles font  recours à SORO YIRIWASO, Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées. 
La cliente KADIA la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises n’a pas été à l’école. Elle est actuellement vendeuse de grains d’arachide chose qu’elle a hérité de sa grande mère. Elle compte acheter 4 sacs d’arachide non décortiqués avec les paysans sur place au village et quelques fois au marché.  Elle  les décortique pour les vendre. La vente se fait à une clientèle mixte au marché du village et à la maison en espèce. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui  sera divisé en deux: une partie sera utilisée dans l’élevage de chèvre et le reste injecté dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Sigiudiale group is made up of married women with an average age of 45 years and three children on average. They all live in traditional families in Koroba, in the district of Wacoro, located in the Dioila prefecture in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

The women know each other through being relatives, neighbours and friends and are all involved in businesses such as catering or selling cereals, root vegetables, groundnuts and other items. 

This is the first solidarity loan for the women in the Siguidiale group. In order to satisfy huge demand from their customers, they have asked for assistance from Soro Yiriwaso. They will use the loans to buy the items listed above. 

Kadia, pictured sitting first from the left, never went to school. She currently sells groundnuts, which is a business she inherited from her grandmother. She hopes to buy four sacks of unshelled groundnuts from local farmers in the village or at the market, which she will then shell to sell them on. 

Kadia sells her groundnuts to a mixed clientele at the village market and from home for cash. She hopes to make 20,000 CFA francs a month, which she will split in two: part will go towards farming goats and the remainder will be reinvested in her business

loans.use: to buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 33-year-old married man. He has one child who is 3 years old. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a transport business transporting customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a suitable place and his primary customers are anyone in need of his services. 

Stephen will use this 50,000 Kenyan shilling (KES) loan to buy spare parts to repair his motorcycle and also fuel. He hopes that in the future he will introduce more people to the business. This is his third loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. His previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living style.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his motorcycle and also fuel

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 30 year old married man with 3 children aged 6,3 and 2 living in Fort Portal Uganda. His main business is retail alongside farming in order to boost his income. He is facing challenges of limited capital; however, he has a vision of constructing a commercial house. Richard has asked for a loan to help him add more business stock to sell.

loans.use: to help him add more business stock to sell.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en: Michael is a 30 year old married man with 3 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  His main business is retail alongside dairy farming, in order to boost his income. He is facing challenges of high costs of goods and weather changes, especially in the dry season where milk production is very low.  However, he has a vision of expanding his stock and educating his children to higher levels of learning. Michael needs a loan to add on a mobile money business (transfer of money from one person to another using mobile phones).

loans.use: to add on a mobile money business.

loans.name: Dayana Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, commune de Guégnéka préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font, le commerce d’habillements, savons, bois de chauffe, pâte d’arachides, de  charbons de bois, produits pharmaceutiques, encens, etc. Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire. Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées. 
La cliente AMINATA  la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises est vendeuse de savon. Elle compte acheter 5 sacs de savons en RCI par le canal de son oncle qui est transporteur. Son cycle d’achat est de deux fois par mois. Les savons sont vendus en détail à une clientèle mixte chez elle. Elle est parfois ambulante.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 30 000 FCFA par mois qui sera diviser en deux : une partie sera utiliser dans l’élevage de petits animaux (elle en possède au jour d’aujourd’hui 10 têtes de moutons qu’elle veut augmenter)  et le reste de l’argent injecté dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of married women with an average age of 37 years and four children on average. They all live in traditional families in Fana, in the district of Guégnéka, located in the Dioila prefecture in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

The women know each other through being relatives, neighbours and friends and run businesses selling items such as clothing, soap, firewood, peanut butter, charcoal, pharmaceutical products, incense, etc. 

The women in the Danaya group are on their 15th solidarity loan. The loan will be used to purchase the items listed above. 

Aminata, pictured sitting first from the left, sells soap. She will use her loan to buy five bags of soap from Côte d’Ivoire via her uncle, who works as a courier on the canal. 

Aminata receives her supplies twice a month and then sells the soap from home to individuals, both men and women. Sometimes she works as a travelling trader.

Aminata is hoping to make 30,000 CFA francs a month, which she will split in two: part will go towards farming small animals (she already owns a flock of 10 sheep, which she wants to increase) and the remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy soap.

loans.name: Boss

texts.en:
Boss is a resident of a rural trading centre where his clothing shop and salon business are located.  He started his shop in 2011 with the objective of earning income to support his family and he is glad that he has carried on the business to date.  Boss is a hard working man who works three days each week and twelve hours per day. His clients are mainly men and women from the same area who travel to the shop to buy clothes for themselves and sometimes for their children. 

He would like to use the loan money of 1,000,000 UGX to buy more stock of new clothes so that he can better serve his customers and earn more income in the long run.  His future hope is to grow the business so that it can earn higher profits. He is mainly challenged by the bad debtors who never pay in time and who sometimes never pay at all.  Boss is hopeful that his business will grow in spite of these challenges and that he will have enough money to educate all his children.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Bonney

texts.en:
Bonney, aged 36, is a hardworking and dedicated man. He is a resident of Kilinya Bbigo in Mutundwe, a neighborhood on the outskirts of Kampala. He works full time on his farm raising pigs and poultry. His farm has greatly helped him to look after his younger brothers and sisters and send them to school.

Bonney’s farm is generally profitable and the market for his animals(pigs) is favourable. But he has not been able to really benefit from his work, as the farm requires a lot of money to buy feeds for his pigs and chicks to ensure they are of good quality.

Therefore Bonney is applying for a 3,000,000 UGX loan through UGAFODE to buy feed for his animals. He desires to benefit from a large market for his pigs and poultry and enjoy bigger profits. Rubaga Road is one of the UGAFODE branches within Kampala city.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs and chicks.

loans.name: Fadhel

texts.en:
Fadhel is 26 years old and and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a hard-working and very honourable man; always committed to getting ahead. He completed secondary school but due to lack of financial resources, he couldn’t continue his studying.

All his life, Fadhel has been working hard and earning money to assist his family. He works in an electricity association, making a low salary. He intends to buy home appliances for his house, but the amount he has is not enough to buy what he needs.

So, Fadhel is requesting a loan from AMB to buy home appliances and furniture to use in his house. He dreams to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy home appliances and furniture to use in his house

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe YEREDEME est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de NIONKOMA commune de Wacoro
préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de tubercules, chaussures, d’habillements, de l’élevage, et d’articles divers. Les femmes du groupe YEREDEME sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de la clientèle elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. 
Pour des raisons sociales, la cliente KAFOUNE la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assis n’a pas été à l’école. Elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments, elle compte acheter 20kg de sel, 6 paquets de cube jumbo et 10kg de gombo en poudre au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait à une clientèle mixte au village et chez elle à la maison en espèce. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de l5 000FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour d’autres activités de revenue notamment l’élevage de volailles.
texts.en:
The Yeredeme group is made up of married women with an average age of 37 years and three children on average. They all live in traditional families in the village of Nionkoma, in the district of Wacoro, located in the Dioila prefecture in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

The women know each other through being relatives, neighbours and friends. They trade condiments, root vegetables, shoes, clothing and various other articles, and farm livestock. 

This is the first solidarity loan for the women in the Yeredeme group. In order to satisfy high customer demand, the women are seeking a loan from Soro Yiriwaso.

Kafoune, pictured sitting in the middle, never went to school. She currently sells condiments. With her loan, she wants to buy 20kg of salt, 6 packets of jumbo stock cubes and 10kg of powdered okra at the weekly market. She sells her groundnuts to a mixed clientele at the village and from home for cash. 

Kafoune hopes to make 15,000 CFA francs a month, which she will use for other business projects such as poultry farming.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 22-year-old man who lives with his family in Sana`a, Yemen. With great effort and dedication he managed his business well, which today is a fabrics store. He works about 12 hours daily. He said that, without sacrifice, there is no reward, and if one wants to get ahead, you have to do what you can. In order to move forward, he is able to attract his customers because he offers good service. 

Abdullah would like to expand his business to attract more clients and increase his income. So he has applied for a second loan of 500,000 YER from AMB to buy fabrics in order to offer a wider variety of products. With this loan, he will be able to have increased profits in order to improve his living conditions. He thanks Kiva lenders for funding the first loan.

loans.use: to buy a new range of fabrics so that he can increase his income

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADEYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de TONGA commune de Wacoro
préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, de tubercules, du savon artisanal,  de l’habillement, et d’articles divers. Les femmes du groupe BADEYA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de la clientèle elles font  recours à SORO YIRIWASO. 
La cliente FARIMA 1 ère de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang debout n’a pas été à l’école. Elle est actuellement vendeuse de pagnes et de tissus depuis trois ans. Elle compte acheter 5 pièces de pagnes wax et 4 pagnes brodés chez les grossistes à Bamako et les met sur le marché sans transformation. La vente se fait en détail la maison chez elle à une  à clientèle mixte  dans son village, et aussi à Fana. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA. Ce bénéfice sera en partie réinjecté dans l’activité et le reste pour assurer les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Badeya group is made up of married women with an average age of 44 years and four children on average. They all live in traditional families in the village of Tonga, in the district of Wacoro, located in the Dioila prefecture in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

The women know each other through being relatives, neighbours and friends. They trade cereals, condiments, root vegetables, handcrafted soap, clothing and various other articles. 

This is the second solidarity loan for the women in the Badeya group. In order to satisfy high customer demand, the women are seeking a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. 

Farima, pictured sitting first from the right, never went to school. She has been selling traditional cloth pagnes for three years. She hopes to buy 5 pieces of wax pagnes and 4 embroidered pagnes from the wholesalers in Bamako and sell them on as they are. 

Farima sells her goods to a mixed clientele from home, in her village and in Fana and hopes to make 20,000 CFA francs a month. Part of this money will be reinvested in her business and the remainder will go towards family expenses.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth pagnes.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира  трудолюбивая и ответственная женщина в возрасте 36 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Замира живёт в маленьком посёлке. Она очень любит своих детей и старается дать им всё необходимое для того, чтобы они могли расти, развиваться и реализовывать себя в обществе. Для этого Замира занимается своим бизнесом, чтобы иметь постоянный доход. Она закупает и продаёт женскую одежду. Закупает она свой товар на большом оптовом рынке и продаёт на местном рынке своего посёлка. Для этого у неё имеется маленький магазинчик. Сейчас Замира желает расширить ассортимент своего товара, ей необходимо закупить побольше разнообразной женской одежды, так как увеличивается спрос на её товар среди односельчан. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и желает получить кредит, чтобы закупить партию женской одежды. Замира очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Zamira is a hardworking and responsible woman of 36. She is married and has three children. Zamira lives in a small village. She loves her children very much and strives to give them everything necessary for them to grow, develop and realize their potential in society.

For this, Zamira is involved in her own business to have a steady income. She buys and sells women's clothing. She buys her goods at a large wholesale market and sells them in the local market of her village. To do this, she has a small shop.

Now, Zamira wishes to expand the variety of her inventory and she needs to buy a larger assortment of women's clothing, since this increases demand for her goods among the villagers. Therefore, she applied to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to purchase a parcel of women's clothing. Zamira hopes very much for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru:
Этого мужчину зовут Махмадали. Он гордо носит статус мужа и отца. Махмадали 33 года. Он много лет своей жизни посвятил деятельности животноводства. Махмадали занимается выращиванием крупно рогатых скотов. На своем дворе и в коровнике держит, кормит скотов. Махмадали пошел по стопам отца, который тоже занимался животноводческой деятельности. Опыт и мастерство он получит от отца, за что Махмадали ему благодарен. 
  Растут дети, растут их расходы. Дети Махмадали уже учатся в школе. Он хочет, чтобы его дети получили хорошее образование. Махмадали решил увеличить свою деятельность с надеждой на то, что увеличиться и его доходность. Махмадали намерен на деньги от кредита купит бычков, но ему не хватает средств, чтобы сделать покупку. Он просит Вас помочь ему. Махмадали ждет поддержки.
texts.en:
This man is named Mahmadali. He proudly carries his status as husband and father. Mahmadali is 33 years old. For many years of his life, he has devoted his life to livestock activities. Mahmadali raises cattle. He tends and feeds the cattle in his yard and in the barn. Mahmadali followed in the footsteps of his father, who also was involved in livestock activities. The experience and skills he received from his fatehr, and for that Mahmadali is grateful to him.

The children are growing, and so are their expenses. Mahmadali's children are already studying in school. He wants for his children to receive a good education. Mahmadali decided to increase his activities with the hope that this will increase also his profitability. With the money from the loan, Mahmadali intends to buy gobies, but he does not have enough money to make a purchase. Mahmadali is awaiting support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for livestock activities

loans.name: Humorbi

texts.ru: Хуморби повторно обратилась за кредитом. Предыдущий кредит она брала 5 лет назад для своего швейного дела. Сейчас Хуморби занимается животноводством. Она выращивает маленьких бычков и после 30-дней откорма продает на местном рынке с наценкой. Хуморби в течение 4 лет занимается этим бизнесом, он приносит ей стабильный доход. В закупе и продаже скота Хуморби помогает ее сын. В данный момент Хуморби просит кредит для того чтобы увеличить количество скотов в своем скотном дворе. Она планирует закупить пару молодых бычков и надеется на поддержку.
texts.en:
Humorbi is a repeat borrower. She took the previous loan five years ago for her sewing business. Now, Humorbi is involved in raising livestock. She tends small gobies and after a 30-day fattening sells them at the local market at a premium. Humorbi has been involved in this business over the course of four years, and it brings her a stable income. In the buying and selling of cattle, Humorbi helps her son.

Currently, Humorbi is requesting a loan to increase the quantity of livestock in her barnyard. She plans to purchase a pair of young gobies and hopes for support.

loans.use: to buy a pair of young gobies for fattening and resale

loans.name: Al-Raja'a Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Raja'a, which consists of four ladies who live in Hodeida, Yemen. They are working hard so that they can achieve their goals. 

Latifa is a 55-year-old mother and is the president of this group. She sells food items such as potatoes and sandwiches. She's been involved in this activity for three years. Latifa says that she began with a small amount, and thanks to sacrifice and daily hard work, she has been able to grow and continually improve her business. 

Latifa is asking for a second loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to purchase potatoes and sandwiches in order to continue her business. She looks forward to improving her family's living conditions and wishes to be financed also in this loan.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and sandwiches in order to continue her business

loans.name: Al-Omniatte Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Omniatte and it consists of five ladies. They are from Taiz, Yemen. This group works in different businesses in order to improve their living conditions. They took out a loan of 320,000 YER. 

Nour is the leader of the group and she lives in Taiz, Yemen. She is 50 years old. She has been selling different things as a business for many years. She is married and has children. She started her business with a saved amount  to operate her business well. She puts forth a lot of effort to increase her profit so that she can apply it to her family`s needs. 

Nour applied for a loan from AMB to buy goods for her business such as clothes, ladies' fabrics and incense, etc. She hopes to expand her business and increase her sales, so she will be able to buy a variety of products to satisfy the needs of each one of her customers.

loans.use: to buy goods for her business such as clothes, ladies' fabrics and incense, etc.

loans.name: Bahriddin

texts.ru: Бахриддин из района Хамадони начинает новый бизнес в сфере животноводства. Ему 39 лет. Он спокойный, трудолюбивый и ответственный человек. У него среднее техническое образование. Бахриддин является отцом двух дочерей и двух сыновей. Его жена нигде не работает, она домохозяйка. Бахриддин в семье трудится один. Он занимается постройкой зданий и жилых домов. В данный момент Бахриддин планирует параллельно начать бизнес по выращиванию бычков для продажи. Он составил свой бизнес план и будет действовать в соответствии с ним. У Бахриддина есть сбережение в размере 300 долларов и еще недостающую сумму он просит в кредит. На эти деньги он собирается закупить бычков и корм для них. Он очень надеется на вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Bahriddin from the Hamadoni region is starting a new business in the sphere of livestock. He is 39 years old. He is a calm, hardworking and responsible person. He has a secondary technical education. Bahriddin is the father of two daughters and two sons. His wife does not work anywhere; she is a homemaker.

Bahriddin is the only one in the family who works. He is engaged in the construction of buildings and homes. Currently, Bahriddin is planning in parallel to start a business raising gobies for sale. He created his own business plan and will act in accordance to it. Bahriddin has savings of 300 dollars and it is not enough so he is requesting a loan. With this money, he intends to buy gobies and feed for them. He hopes very much for help.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and feed in order to start a new business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 36 years old and lives in Prenza, Tangub City. She is married with two children.

Gloria sells Avon cosmetic products and earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to add to her capital to purchase additional Avon cosmetics products. 

Gloria has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Gloria hopes to improve her livelihood in order to offer more services to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase additional Avon cosmetics products

loans.name: Gerry

texts.en:
Gerry is married with six children. Gerry is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Gerry is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. He has been doing this for 30 years. He has requested a loan to buy fertilizer. 

Gerry has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Gerry hopes to own a rice field some day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and maintain his farm

location.town: Tangub - Garang, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Al-Raiheen Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Raiheen. It is made up of four women, who are neighbors from Aden, Yemen. They are hard working and enterprising women. They took a loan of 220,000 YER. 

Qwbla is the group's leader. She is a 40-year-old married woman who lives in Aden, Yemen. She sells fabric and various other items, and has over five years of experience.  She stocks fabric, robes and dresses to sell to her clients. Since she has professional experience in this field, she has attracted more clients who have helped her business to continue running successfully and more profitably. 

Recently, Qwbla took out a loan from AMB in order to invest in her business by buying more fabrics, skirts and dresses and reselling them to her customers. This loan will allow her to strengthen her business so that she can increase her revenue. She hopes to earn large profits so that she can improve her savings in order to obtain a big loan and further expand her business.

loans.use: to invest in her business by buying more fabrics, skirts and dresses and reselling them to her customers.

loans.name: Urulkan

texts.ru: Урулкан 58 лет, вдова, супруг умер много лет назад и Урулкан одна с тех пор воспитывает 4 дочерей и 2 сыновей. В настоящее время все дети женаты, проживают самостоятельно, самый младший сын живет и помогает Урулкан по хозяйству. У Урулкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Урулкан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 40 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Урулкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы,а также обрабатывает 1,3 ГА земельной доли на которой выращивает кукурузу, для обеспечения своего скота кормами и сеном. Также Урулкан дополнительно занимается торговлей продуктов питания и прохладительных напитков, имеет небольшой ларек на дому, который приносит тоже определенные доходы. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Урулкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Урулкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомашины для сына.
texts.en: Urulkan is 58 years old and a widow. Her husband died many years ago, and Urulkan had to bring up four daughters and two sons on her own. At present all children are married and live separately. The youngest son lives [nearby?] and helps Urulkan on the farm. Urulkan has finished secondary school. As a main source of income, she raises livestock and grows produce. She launched this business 40 years ago by buying livestock for 3000 KGS. Thanks to Urulkan’s hard work, her farm now includes three dairy cows, and 1.5 ha [3.7 acres], where she grows corn, in order to provide fodder and hay for her animals. In additional, Urulkan also sells food items and soft drinks. She has a small stand by her house, which also brings in some income. Her total monthly income is 15,000 KGS. In order to develop her farm further, Urulkan  applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan to buy cattle for fattening and later resale with a high mark-up. Urulkan plans to use the revenues from her loan for an additional expansion of livestock, and she also plans to save up to buy a car for her son.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Nurahmad

texts.ru: Нурахмаду 32 года. Он носит статус отеца и мужа. Жена Нурмахмада работает медсестрой. Они растят двоих дочерей. Им 3 и 4 годика. У Нурахмада большая семья, кроме жены и детей с ним живут его мама и брат с женой. Нумахмад занимается животноводством. Каждый день он встает рано утром, чтобы покормить и поить скотов. Так начинается день Нурахмада. Ему нравиться проводить время с животными. Для него деятельность животноводства является не только любимым занятием но и источником дохода в семью. Нурахмад хочет расширить деятельность и поэтому просит кредит, чтобы купить необходимое количество скотов. Он очень надеется, что ему помогут и он увеличит поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Nurahmad is 32 years old. He is a father and husband. Nurahmad's wife works as a nurse. They are raising two daughters who are 3 and 4 years old. Nurahmad has a big family. Besides his wife and children, his mother, brother and brother's wife live with them.

Nurahmad practices livestock farming. Everyday, he gets up early in the morning in order to feed and water his cattle. This is how Nurahmad's day begins. He likes to spend time with his animals. For him, the business of livestock farming is not only his favorite pastime but a source of income for his family. Nurahmad wants to expand his business, which is why he is requesting a loan to buy the necessary amount of cattle. He really hopes that he will be helped and will increase his number of cattle.

loans.use: to increase his number of cattle.

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.ru:
Юрий очень трудолюбивый, он работает не только  у себя на огороде, но и на наемной работе- бригадиром группы по ремонту дорог.  « В сельском хозяйстве бывают и трудности, болеют растения»- говорит  Юрий, «но  мы успешно  с этим боремся».

Прошлый КИВА кредит Юрий  использовал для ремонта теплицы и установки отопления.  Для того, чтобы отапливать теплицы  нужно закупить угля побольше, так как весна может быть холодная, а также  Юрий решил построить еще одну теплицу, чтобы земля не пустовала. Осуществить этот план поможет новый кредит от КИВЫ. Юрий просит предоставить ему 25,000 гривен.
texts.en:
Yuriy is very hardworking. He works not only in his own backyard but also as a wage laborer - as the foreman of a group that repairs roads. "In agriculture, difficulties occur from time to time, plants die off," says Yuriy, "but we successfully battle these problems."

Yuriy used his last KIVA loan for greenhouse repair and heating system installation. In order to heat up the greenhouses, he needs to buy more coal as the Spring could be cold. Yuriy also decided to build another greenhouse so that his land would not be vacant. A new loan from KIVA would help realize this plan. Yuriy is requesting that you lend him 25,000 hryvnia.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse and purchase coal for heating.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is from Dauis, Bohol, Philippines. She is married with four children. Her youngest child is 5 years old, and her eldest child is 22 years old. 

Carolina started her sari-sari (convenience) store business three years ago. She sell shampoo, chips, canned goods, candies, and seasonings. Her income enables her to buy food and to pay for her children's schooling. 

She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, canned goods, and chips. She wishes to fully stock her store and to offer her customers a variety of merchandise at affordable prices.

In the future, she hopes to make her store bigger for her family's benefit.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, and chips

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is a farmer from Bohol, Philippines. He is a married man and has 10 children. 

He grows rice in his field. Leonardo is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the farm. 

With these supplies, he will be able to improve the productivity of his farm and increase his yield and harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 40-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol, Phillippines. She has three children. Her eldest child is eight years old, and her youngest child is five years old. 

She owns a sari-sari (variety store) business. She has operated her business for five years and earns 15,000 PHP per month. This is the source of her income that supports the needs of her family. 

Gemma is requesting a loan of 28,000 PHP to buy additional commodities to sell like medicines, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, and soaps. 

With this loan, she will be able to take care of the additional needs of her business and to pay for household expenses. 

In the future, Gemma hopes to expand her business, to renovate her house, and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, and soaps

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a 47-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol, Phillippines. She is a mother of three school-aged children. 

Vicenta has been engaged in the hog-raising business for more than 10 years. She is currently raising hogs for an income. 

She is requesting a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy feed and supplements for her pigs. This will enable her to raise healthy and good-quality pigs to be sold in four months time. 

Vicenta believes that with the financial support of the loan, she can make her dreams of improving her family's lives possible, and she can continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplements

loans.name: Samandar

texts.ru:
Самандар активный молодой житель города Дангары в возрасте 20 лет. Он живет вместе с родителями, их в семье 5 человек. Самандар  способный и деятельный парень. Он одновременно учится и зарабатывает на жизнь. Самандар в данный момент учится в высшем учебном заведении, по окончании которого он хочет стать хорошим специалистом своей профессии. 
Год назад Самандар начал свой бизнес по выращиванию бычков для продажи. Он не хотел больше быть обузой для родителей и стал заниматься этим бизнесом. Он не только обеспечивает самого себя, но и к тому же еще помогает родителям с финансами. По его словам ему нравится проводить время с животными, он любит их с детства. Самандар берет кредит, чтобы приобрести пару бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Он хочет немного расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Samandar is an active young resident of the town of Dangara who is 20 years old. He lives with his parents and a family of five people. Samandar is an able and active young man. He studies and earns a living at the same time. Samandar is studying in college and wants to become a good specialist in his profession after graduation.

One year ago Samandar has started his business feeding calves for sale. He did not want to be a burden for his parents and started doing his own business. He does not only provide for himself, but also helps his parents financially. As he says, he likes to spend time with the animals which he loves since his childhood. Samandar is taking out the loan to buy a couple of calves for feeding and resale. He wants to grow his business a little.

loans.use: to buy a couple of calves for feeding and resale.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
El socio continua dedicándose al negocio de ganaderia, el socio cría a sus ganados para luego venderlos  a sus clientes que le solicitan, él socio lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma a que la socia saca a delante  a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado y el arreglo de su establo.
 Él socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The partner continues working in the business of livestock. He raises his livestock to then sell them to customers who request them. He has worked years in this business in which he does well thanks to the dedication he applies to his work every day. He is a responsible person, and in this way he moves forward with his family. He requests the loan to buy livestock and to repair his barn. He is happy for the loan, and he is committed to fulfilling his repayment terms.

loans.use: to buy livestock and repair his barn.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Panglao, Bohol, Phillippines. She wants to be able to pay for the school expenses of her children.

She runs a sari-sari (variety store) business selling various goods and commodities to the people in her community. She sell items like canned goods, toiletries, seasonings, and chips.
