texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Carlos con su credikiva anterior, pues con él logró tener un buen surtido para ofrecer a su clientela, quienes vistieron con ropa nueva  en las fiestas de fin de año, ofrecer un mejor servicio de telefonía celular con nuevos planes y aumentar el volumen de ventar por alquiler de lavadoras .   Con esta inversión obtuvo buenos ingresos en la temporada de mayor movimiento comercial y por ello dice “muchas gracias a los financiadores de Kiva”. En la actualidad se está preparando para responder a la época escolar, con mercancía a propósito del ingreso de los estudiantes a clases, por eso acude a un nuevo financiamiento , con el cual comprará libretas, bolígrafos, lápices, colores, temperas, cartulinas, planeando así incrementar sus ventas con nuevos clientes y mejorar sus ingresos aun mas y con ello su calidad e vida.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Carlos with his previous Kiva loan, as with it, he was able to have a good selection of merchandise to offer to his customers who dressed in new clothing during the holiday season.  

He was also able to offer better cell-phone service, with new plans; and increase the volume of rentals for his washing machines.  With this investment, he earned good money during the busiest shopping season, and for this, he says, “Thank you very much, Kiva lenders.”

He is currently getting ready for the back-to-school season, with merchandise geared towards students who are returning to classes.  For this he is requesting a new loan, with which he will purchase notebooks, pens, pencils, crayons, tempera paints, and construction paper.

He plans to increase his sales with new customers and improve his earnings even more, and thus, his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, pens, pencils, crayons, tempera paints, and construction paper.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son, but at the time of purchasing some money became short. Therefore, she has requested a loan for her son so that he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings. Now, she will successfully buy the new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.

Shehnaz is a 46-year-old woman living with her two children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
She hopes that this time her son can easily generate sufficient income to cherish his children and be able to pay all the installments on time. She is very happy after taking this loan; she thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Bunroeun

texts.en: Bunroeun is 54 years old, a married woman with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province. Two of her children are factory workers, one is a driver, and the other two are students. She is a salesperson, and her husband is a farmer and a motor-taxi driver. They can earn an income of about $22 per day. Now she is seeking a loan of $700 to buy wood to build her house and to pay house construction fees. Even though this loan will not help with her business, it will  improve how her family lives.

loans.use: to buy wood to build her house and to pay construction fees.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a 32-year-old man from Kisumu County, married to Masline, who has a salon in the same county. They have two children, aged two and four. He sells shoes, a business he has been in for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 45,000. He is taking out his second loan, of KES 60,000, from Vision Fund Kenya. He intends to use part of the proceeds of the loan to expand his business and part to pay his children’s education expenses. The anticipated revenues will be used to service the loan from Vision Fund Kenya. His dream is to bring up a stable family.

loans.use: to buy bales of shoes to sell to  his clients.

loans.name: Ramzan

texts.en: Ramzan is a 48-year-old woman, living with her four children and her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been driving an auto rickshaw which does not belong to him. With the help of his savings, he wants to purchase a used auto rickshaw. His friend is selling an auto rickshaw; its engine’s condition is good. But he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy the rickshaw. He wants to start driving, but needs to gather the lump sum amount needed. Therefore, Ramzan has applied for a loan for her son so he can buy the rickshaw and drive it happily. She hopes that now her son will be able to generate a steady income. She is very happy about taking this loan; she thanks Kiva and its Field Partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy a used auto rickshaw for her son to drive.

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en: Sinat is 41 years old. She is a married woman with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province. Three of them work at a factory, and the other two are students. She is a farmer, and her husband is a construction foreman. They can earn an income around $22 per day. She is applying for a loan of $800 to buy a cow to raise and to breed. She is trying to earn more income, to support her last two children with their education.

loans.use: to buy a cow to raise and to breed.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Ella trabaja como guarda de seguridad, teniendo turnos solo de noche, hasta que un día se puso a pensar que deseaba estudiar, porque   sentía que tenia a la familia muy sola y como a ella le apasiona todos los temas que tengan que ver con lo de salud, pues se decidió por estudiar Auxiliar en servicios farmacéuticos, un día de descanso tomo la decisión de ir al instituto para pedir información del tema, pues le pareció genial y de inmediato se inscribió en esa área de la salud. 

El cual ella pensó en disfrutar de un mayor bienestar personal y laboral para poder mejorar el potencial, excelencia y responsabilidad. Tener auto eficiencia con visión de futuro para así mejorar tanto la calidad de vida de ella misma  como la de la familia.

Necesita el subsidio, porque esta muy interesada en el estudio y le es una gran ayuda económica.
texts.en:
Angela works as a security guard, working only night shifts, until one day she began to think that she wanted to study because she felt her family was too alone. As she is passionate about all health topics, she decided to study becoming a pharmacy assistant. On a day off, she made ​​the decision to go to school to request information on the subject. She thought it was great and immediately enrolled in that area of health, which she thought would provide greater personal wellbeing and work in order to improve her potential, excellence, and responsibility, and to have the self-reliance and a vision of the future to improve the quality of life both for herself as well as her family.

She needs the loan because is very interested in studying and it is a great economic help.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio es un hombre casado de 36 años de edad, actualmente vive con sus tres hijos y su esposa en el Departamento de Sololá.
El comenta que se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 10 años, ya que su padre le enseño esta labor desde pequeño. Por lo que ahora esta actividad le genera buenos ingresos  que contribuyen al sostenimiento de su familia. Como también comenta que su esposa elabora güipiles y lo comercializan en el mercado local de su comunidad, con el propósito de mejorar la economía de su familia.
Ahora el está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la introducción de agua potable para su vivienda  y de esta manera su familia tendrá mejores comodidades en su vivienda. El préstamo lo pagara con los dos trabajos que actualmente tiene.
Su sueño es cultivar hortalizas  en su terreno para generar otra fuente de ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Gregorio is a 36 year-old married man. Currently he lives with his wife and three children in the department of Sololá.

He says that he has worked in construction for ten years, since his father taught him this work from a young age. Because of this, the work generates a good income that contributes to supporting his family. He also mentions that his wife makes güipiles (traditional regional clothing) and sells them in the local community market, with the goal of improving the family's finances.

At present he is requesting a loan of 5,000 quetzales to bring in potable water for his home. This will improve the comforts of his home for his family. He will pay for the loan with the two jobs he currently has. 

His dream is to grow vegetables on his land to generate another source of income for his family.

loans.use: to bring potable water into his home.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna is 51 years old and a married woman with six children. She lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. 

For a living, she does farming, and her husband is working with CMAC. Four of her children are working at the factory. All of them can earn $23 per day. 

Now she would like to ask for a loan of $1,500 for buying seed, petroleum and fertilizer for her field in the dry season. This loan is helpful for her to increase her harvest and make her family’s standard of living better.

loans.use: to buy seed, petroleum and fertilizer for her field in the dry season.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 58 years old and from Nyahururu. She is a widow and is blessed with six children, who are above 18 years of age.

She is a charcoal vendor, a business she has been running for the last ten years. To enable her to buy more stock of charcoal to sell to her customers, she has applied for her first loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES 10,000, and she intends to use the profits realized from her expanded business to expand her business and to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, she hopes to venture into the wholesale business and to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 32 years old and a married woman with two children. She lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. 

She has run a small business as a retailer since 2010, and her husband is on the staff of Angkor Beer Company. Both of them can earn around $11.30 per day. 

Now she is asking for a loan of $600 for filling up her land to protect her house from flooding. This loan is not only to protect her house, but also her small business.

loans.use: to fill up her land to protect her house from flooding.

loans.name: Mara

texts.en:
Mara is 34 years old and a married woman with one child. She lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. 

For a living, she is a basket maker, and her husband is a basket retailer. Both of them can earn $6.60 per day. She has been running this business since 2008. 

Now she is asking for loan of $1,000 for buying baskets from other makers in order to make more profit and to make her family’s standard of living better.

loans.use: to buy baskets from other makers to make more profit.

loans.name: Allaha Rakhi

texts.en:
Allaha Rakhi is a 45-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is spending her life with her husband, two sons and a daughter.

Her husband is a very hard-working and honest person; he owns a small restaurant in which he offers types of delicious foods. Allaha Rakhi cooks some dishes for the restaurant, and people like to eat from the restaurant of her husband. He has been running his restaurant for many years and this is the reason most of the chairs, utensils and crockery have broken. He wants to buy new plastic furniture, utensils and crockery but his major income has to be spent for household expenses. 

Therefore, Allaha Rakhi has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy plastic furniture, utensils and crockery. Allaha Rakhi thanks Kiva and appreciates the warm support she has received.

loans.use: To buy crockery, utensils and food items for restaurant business.
